[rp] 🥒 キュー
completed RP! / birds-of-a-feather
shit gets real 9/17/2023 12:51 AM
12 hours is a long break, but sometimes it feels like it’s not long enough. Celia is restless, walking around the upper part of the piano room, arranging books and peering through a broken telescope. Eventually, her stomach growls. Maybe grabbing food at this late hour would ease her restlessness. So, she quickly makes her way to the exit, down the small ladder, and delicately climbed and dropped her way down the tall tree. She didn’t care to take her mask with her this time, considering it to be a quick trip to and from the kitchen. Her hood should be fine. Tiptoe, tiptoe. Celia slips past an array of doors, passing through a pair that swung open almost at her command. Fluorescent lights buzzed on to illuminate the room — a few cooking stations, a round counter, cabinets and sinks along the wall, and two fridges side by side. There wasn’t much to eat for now. She knew in the fridge was mostly what was left after dinners or from company budgeting - few snacks. So Celia figured she’d try to make a meal. Some bread, any meat edible enough to fill a small stomach, cheese… It’s too late for a gourmet meal, so this should suffice.
Chili 9/17/2023 1:09 AM
For Sinclair, nights aren't entirely a source of comfort. Especially ones such as this, where there is ample free time. Even if he may not make it audible, he appreciated the distraction provided by his raucous coworkers. In the later hours of the night however, there's no shouting or painful wounds. No need to feel the blood rush to your fingers as you clamp on tight to your weapons. Now, there is only silence. The dreadful quiet accompanied by thoughts of everything that was ever lost. Try as he might, his mind cannot help but fill with thoughts of his life prior to Limbus Company, and the painful scenes that led up to it. Sinclair's heart quickens in pace, and he feels his breath catch in his throat. He wouldn't be falling asleep now, and he'd only feel more miserable trapped in his room. It wouldn't be much, but a short trip to get some water may be enough to soothe his spirit. Keeping his footsteps as quiet as can be, he snakes out of his room and saunters towards the kitchen.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 1:23 AM
An itemized list of ingredients brewed in her mind. She could add a side, or try and squeeze some of the fruits they were lucky enough to afford recently to make some juice cocktail, leaving enough for those who needed a quick refresher. Where did they even get these? She pulled out a pan. Turned on one of the eyes of the stove on a rusting kitchenette, pretended it was just another performance. Celia wasn’t an excellent cook— being comatose for years isn’t exactly helpful with developing life skills, but some of her coworkers were kind enough to spare some evenings letting her assist in the kitchen. Ishmael says to butter the pan, butter my bread, and to butter my senses. Celia sighed. She followed the advice to a T, arranging the elements of her sandwich and preparing to toast it. She wasn’t even paying attention to any external sounds any longer - there shouldn’t be any, as she recollected to herself. That also meant she was blissfully unaware of Sinclair soon coming to the kitchen to join the midnight escapade.
Chili 9/17/2023 1:36 AM
Just as he got to the door he heard the noises of another occupant within the kitchen. Huh. I thought most people would be asleep by now... Sinclair couldn't quite figure out who the mystery sinner was. He tried to run the list. Most would be sleeping by now, and those that may be awake are probably busying themselves with other things. Maybe Rodya? It's no secret that she likes her food. If anything, this eased Sinclair a little. Being able to talk to someone would kill some time till he felt tired enough to sleep. Gingerly, he opens the door, keeping himself sotto voce "Rodya..? Are you still up at th-" Sinclair cuts himself short as he notices a distinctly not Rodya-Shaped figure in the place he assumed her to be.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 1:43 AM
The second he spoke, Celia jumped — if she were any amount stronger, she would’ve hit the ceiling with such a reaction. They made eye contact for a brief second. Although her hood concealed the clarity of her face through shadow, Celia still didn’t have a mask on and it was clear that that was just her face. Oh no. Her right hand grabbed the sizzling pan to take it off the stove, holding it away from her body. Celia then used her left hand to swipe a knife off the counter and quickly point it towards Sinclair, perpendicular to her body. She made sure that her face wasn’t seen further, only the side of her white and red-striped hooded cloak. “…” Not the optimal response, but we’ll take it.
Chili 9/17/2023 2:06 AM
Sinclair feels his heart jump to his throat as the scene plays out. He was far from prepared for anything that had occured, and took just about all his restraint to avoid crying out at the sudden knife pointed at him. He raised his hands as if in surrender, and spoke to her with hushed urgency. "C-Celia! It's just me. It's just me, Sinclair. Lets... uh... not do anything hasty. Right?" Sinclair nervously clamped his teeth down on his tongue. It's not to say that Sinclair hated any of his coworkers, but he was certainly a lot closer to some compared to the others. Celia fell in the latter case. Although a calm demeanor was a nice change of pace, it also carried a somewhat cold presence. Not to mention her mask. It was kind of creepy, and reminded him of the dolls that accompanied the Doomsday Calendar abnormality, whose E.G.O he was all too familiar with as well. Suddenly it clicked for Sinclair. She wasn't wearing her mask. For what felt like the shortest of moments, their eyes locked. Although it was impossible for him to make out the distinct features, he was certain that it had happened. Regardless, he was certain that the last thing either party would want would to be incurring the ire of Vergilius for causing a commotion in the small hours of the day. He was almost certain he could get out of this situation without needing any touchups from Dante later.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 2:20 AM
Upon hearing him speak, her shaking hand slowly lowered the knife. Celia carefully placed it down on the counter, pushing her palm directly on the tile. “…” He didn’t see anything, right? No, of course not. That mattered to her. Only those she really trusted could look at her, and Sinclair was definitely not one of them. Nothing against him - in fact, Celia found him to be rather pleasant in comparison to most others. However, that was still not a metric of trust. Quietly, she kept her head low while trying to resume her cooking. Her left hand now started pulling the fabric to shield whatever could be seen of her face without completely obstructing her view. “…” “…Sorry.” With a voice as soft and sweet as a cat’s meow, Celia murmured her sheepish apology while trying to grab a plate and flip her late night meal onto it. That apology, at least, was one of the first few words Celia’s ever directly spoken to Sinclair.
Chili 9/17/2023 2:38 AM
Sinclair was able to breathe a sigh of relief when she finally put down the knife. He couldn't help but find it odd that he would be so afraid to get hurt. To die. Even though it felt like at this point it was a fleeting afterthought, after dying countless times over, he could never truly be comfortable with the idea of the deep cold of nothingness, only to have himself torn from it just as suddenly. Pushing aside those thoughts, he was able to focus better on his surroundings. It seems like Celia had also come searching for something, although in this case sought a meal as opposed to the quick drink of water Sinclair was planning to get. It wasn't hard to grasp that the last thing Celia wanted would be Sinclair looking at her face. He awkwardly shuffled around the kitchen, trying to keep his head in the other direction of her, fumbling with a paper cup to fill with water. As he sipped the cool water he found himself wanting to seize the opprotunity of conversation. Even if this wasn't his first choice of company, it definitely wasn't his last. And besides, he may as well kill two birds with one stone and try to get to know his fellow Sinner better. "I-It's fine. Um... couldn't sleep either, yeah?" As Sinclair spoke, he kept his gaze fixed to the floor, as if he was suddenly concerned with the color of his shoes.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 3:08 AM
ah. A conversation. Celia’s not much of a speaker. In fact, it’s known that she’s one of the most silent sinners, not even speaking when spoken to. To hear her voice is a miracle, let alone have her directly face you. Taking the toasted sandwich sitting on a half-bent plate in one hand, Celia sat on one of the stools that was near the counters lining a central island. She tried to speak. “Yeah. The night is always tough.” Progress, definitely. She slid the knife over to her and cut the sandwich diagonally, holding one half delicately between her gloved fingers. “…What keeps you up?”
Chili 9/17/2023 3:25 AM
To hear her voice was a good sign. At least, that's what Sinclair thought. Although her question was a bit troubling. The list of things on his mind was rather daunting at the present time. And it's not like it'd be right to burden anyone else with it. She's gone now. The whistles he hears aren't real. There's no cackling in the wind, and there's no figures in the shadows. Kromer should be a distant memory. But her grip was always so tight on his mind. "...Just things that are in the past now. Not worth fussing over, but I still find myself thinking about it." Sinclair refills his cup of water and takes another long drink. "How about you? Just hungry? Or something else keeping you awake?" (edited)
shit gets real 9/17/2023 3:30 AM
“Don’t remember.” Such a simply poised answer. Truthfully, if anything was bothering her, she doesn’t care to give it enough attention to be figured out. It could be the lack of memory, the nagging of others to speak, or the feeling that she doesn’t wish to be in her room for long. Celia shrugged a little. If she was gonna have a substantial interaction — now that she’s been thrust into it — she might as well speak a little more. Out of everyone, Sinclair seemed to be least likely to brag about his achievement of hearing more than 10 words from Celia. “…It’s okay, though. It won’t bother me for long. Just hungry, now.”
Chili 9/17/2023 3:42 AM
"Ah... alright." Sinclair wasn't entirely sure how to interpret her response, but given how little he knows of Celia it'd be best to take her answers at face value. The topic of the conversation was a bit gloom, and felt as if it was dangerously close to open up old wounds, so Sinclair took his best efforts to steer away from it now that seemingly she was engaged in their little chat. "I didn't know you could cook." Right as the words came out of his mouth, internally Sinclair felt the desire to slump down on the floor. You barely know anything about her, stupid! "I tried my hand at it... once. It wasn't the most fruitful effort though..."
shit gets real 9/17/2023 3:48 AM
The more Celia spoke, the more it became clear she was simply parroting out answers that seemed to be as simple as possible. She wasn’t overly wordy, nor was she someone of much significant character — perhaps that was what made her stand out, besides her unusual accessories. “I didn’t at first. Not much one can do in their sleep.” She tilted her head up, vaguely facing Sinclair’s direction while still being careful to hide her face. “Meursault teaches me now.” The implications of her statement weigh heavy on her. She admitted she didn’t know much, but not the reason why — this would be the first time she’s mentioned it so casually, as if recalling a simple memory. “Ask him, maybe. To teach you.”
Chili 9/17/2023 4:00 AM
"I see..." Sinclair found that Celia seemed to lack... personality, for lack of a better descriptor. She seemed keen on answers that would satisfy whatever prompt given to her, and nothing more. It's no wonder she is able to get along with the most esoteric sinner among them. "I'll probably look into it as a personal endeavor... I'm sure Meursault's busy anyway..." It felt odd to try and hold a conversation with someone he couldn't look at. From a young age his parents had drilled into his head that there was a proper way for everything. A proper way to eat. A proper way to walk. A proper way to speak. It felt alien to actively avoid eye contact. "How has work been treating you? There's nothing too troublesome, I hope?"
shit gets real 9/17/2023 4:08 AM
“…” His persistence on talking was almost frustrating. Normally, she doesn’t speak this much outside of routine counseling sessions. However, this might be a one-off moment, so she might as well give as much thought as her brain could muster. “Do you need to ask a question like that? It’d be the same for you… but…” She gulped. Would it? Celia didn’t ever have to really ponder how she felt about anything — it all fell under if she remembered or if she didn’t. But right now, she’s thinking somewhat deeper. “…I think I enjoy it. It’s — simple, I don’t need to remember anything.”
Chili 9/17/2023 4:27 AM
"I think you're right about that... there's no time to think in a fight. It's kind of nice... t-to forget about everything. I suppose there isn't much more stress relieving than cutting up abnormalities either..." Sinclair catches himself from rambling further. While it is a bit embarrassing that it feels like he's dragging this conversation by the heels, he was very grateful as well to her for humoring him, even if it was just a matter of circumstance. But there was one thing above all else Sinclair was curious about involving Celia. He wanted to know why she had gotten so worked up about the idea of Sinclair seeing her without the mask on. Granted, he was no stranger to being threatened with his life, but he hadn't expected it from her. He bit down on his tongue again with trepidation, contemplating if he should even pop the question, let alone the fact that she would give him an answer.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 4:33 AM
“Yeah. I need that, sometimes.” Something about how she spoke with such a monotone voice felt nearly unsettling, like speaking to a shell of a person. Celia ate between her comments, staring down at her small meal and examining what she liked or disliked. The cheese is not melted enough, but the ham is hot. Did I heat the pan too fast? Maybe I should use mayo instead of butter to coat the bread…. Pondering such deep thoughts about a mundane food, Celia twirled the plate with one finger idly. Her mind ran surprisingly blank, as if no thoughts existed there at all. What a difficult partner to converse with.
Chili 9/17/2023 4:42 AM
"I.. uh... Celia. I was wondering... how come you aren't wearing your mask? I've never seen you without it. Or... well I guess it wouldn't be very easy to eat with a mask on. I guess I was just... surprised by how you reacted when I came in. Is there a reason you didn't want me to see your face?" Sinclair felt like he was walking on thin ice on already uncertain ground. He was hoping that he could inch towards the question, rather than hitting her with it face on. He felt guilty for asking something so direct and surely personal, but could not deny that her reaction had piqued his curiosity.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 4:51 AM
“Uhm.” She choked up on her words again. Perhaps it was bringing up things her brain didn’t quite yet want to remember, or just her attempt at forming a response he’d understand. “Uhm, I.” She bites her tongue. How to explain this, the thought runs through her head over and over. Does she even know what she’s trying to say? “I didn’t think anyone else was awake. This would be 5 minutes, in and out.” Well, that answered one piece of it. She rubbed her nose with her knuckle, unsure of even why she was so concerned about Sinclair seeing her face — it’s not like she’s disfigured, or insecure about her looks. Perhaps it was the principle. But she wasn’t gonna say that. “I just… I don’t want anyone to see me. No offense. I’d rather hide.”
Chili 9/17/2023 5:04 AM
After hearing her response Sinclair couldn't help but wish that she did actually stab him, to save the both of them this situation. He internally chided himself for even daring to ask. "N-no, I understand. Don't worry. I... kind of get where you're coming from. N-not about the mask thing, of course! But I have a preference as well... I try to keep my gloves on at all times." Sinclair lets out an exasperated sigh. "I'm sorry... I didn't mean to come in on you without your mask. Nor drag you into this conversation. I owe you the apology... and my thanks."
shit gets real 9/17/2023 5:34 AM
“It’s okay,” Celia replied quietly. His sudden outburst mildly irritated her. However, it’s not like they intended to cross paths. It just… happened. Celia wasn’t gonna complain. “Mmmm,” she hummed Celia stood and quietly made her way over to the trash can, dropping the plate in delicately. She then carefully cleaned up her area. Part of her wished to inquire about his preference — however, the rudeness of the idea kept Celia’s mouth shut. “It’s not wrong to be curious.”
Chili 9/17/2023 12:30 PM
Sinclair was relieved for her forgiveness, even if he was still embarrassed by his own impulsiveness. Sinclair was contemplating just retreating to his room, although he'd likely have to wait for her to leave first, as to avoid any chance of him seeing her face again. "I guess you're right..." Sinclair was wringing his hands together. He was unsure how to proceed with Celia, given that it was unlikely she wanted to speak to him in the first place. Maybe it'd be best just to let her leave? It's not like trying to waste some time was an entirely fruitless effort. Sinclair racked his mind, searching for answers.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 12:38 PM
She seemed to turn directly to him, face shrouded in the darkness by her hood. Celia tilted her head. “Your room doesn’t look too comfy. Is that also keeping you up?” She asked, fingers tracing the edge of the pocket watch around her neck. She’s simply asking out of curiosity. Perhaps if he answered affirmatively, she’d invite him to explore the vastness of her room. She lets others visit, either to gawk at the size of the tree or peruse the books in the library — a small break to let another rest easily wouldn’t hurt her. (edited)
Chili 9/17/2023 12:51 PM
(She tilted my head so evil.(silly)) "Yeah... it's empty. Uncomfortably so. Nor do I like what it reveals about me..." Sinclair says the last part with some uncharacteristic venom to it. Having even his own room remind him about everything he wishes to forget is only a source of displeasure for him. "But I guess I can't really get away from that. How about your room? Is it to your liking at least?"
shit gets real 9/17/2023 12:56 PM
(( rizna makes a typo real )) “It’s… large. And familiar.” She clasped her hands together, holding them near her chest. Celia pondered to herself — well, she knew an extent of what he had gone through, but not enough to understand the contents of his room … or what little she saw of it. “I find it calming until the place shakes, and the sky crumbles —“ The thought made Celia shiver. “— uhm. Would you like to see?”
Chili 9/17/2023 1:17 PM
"Eh?" Sinclair had to do a double take. She was inviting him in? This was an unexpected development. "O-oh... alright. I'll come." He wasn't sure entirely what to expect. Sinclair seldom entered the expansion of Mephistopheles, let alone lingered around long enough to gaze at the rooms of the Sinners that were lined up within it. Still, the idea was rather interesting, and Sinclair took it as an indication that he hadn't gotten on her bad side despite the various missteps he may have taken since the start of their interaction, which he was grateful for.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 1:49 PM
“Mm. Good.” There was no way he could truly get on her bad side — but Celia offered the kind gesture on the front of it helping Sinclair, and possibly easing his curiosity. She nodded. Making her way towards the kitchen’s exit, the doors slid open with a careful whirring to let Celia pass. The cloth of her cloak dragged behind her like the train of a dress, giving her a larger appearance than her short stature could attribute. She stayed silent, just walking towards her half of the bus. Her door wasn’t too far, being #16 meant only a few others came before. Before she opened the door, she turned back to Sinclair — just to see if he was still nearby.
Chili 9/17/2023 2:08 PM
Sinclair was a few steps behind her. He gives her a small, yet warm smile when she turns to face him. "I don't think I've been in anyone else's room before... well, save for Don Quixote's." Sinclair kept his voice down to a whisper, so as to avoid disturbing those who may be sleeping. It was rare for the bus to be this quiet, which only added to list of odd things that were occurring tonight for him. "Thank you for inviting me..." Sinclair mumbled out his brief thanks. He found himself apologizing and thanking a lot tonight, but courtesy never hurt.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 3:22 PM
Celia nodded. No need to answer. She opened the door slowly, and the environment seemed to unfold itself. A room with a shallow pool of water at the bottom, and lots of greenery in different spots. Upon looking up, the ceiling felt unreachable -- this was definitely the tallest room in all of Mephistopheles, and it seemed to be a miracle that such an expansive space could exist. At the bottom of the central tree was a piano enwrapped in the tree's roots, as if having forcibly grown and split the tree into the two stalks that stretched to the roof. Celia walked forward, carefully treading across the shallow water. Two doors were on the left and right of the tree, one of them ajar and leaking light into the room from what appeared to be a library. Celia took a small scroll off the top of the piano's keys, storing it within her sleeve. "This is it." This wasn't it, as there were many rooms to explore, but Celia wasn't going to elaborate.
Chili 9/17/2023 3:42 PM
Sinclair couldn't hide the look of bewilderment on his face as he walked in. He was no stranger to the interior of Mephistopheles defying his comprehension of the laws of space, but this was practically a different beast. As he crossed the water, he grabbed the tail end of his coat to prevent it from getting wet. Still, it was nice. While the tree somewhat reminded him of his room, that is likely where the similarities end. It was a far-cry from the half lit and bare room he occupied. "It's beautiful here... hard to believe it's not a scene torn from a storybook." Sinclair cast his eyes around the room, taking in the spectacle of it all.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 4:33 PM
As the door closed behind the two of them, Celia lowered her hood and kept her back to Sinclair. Delicate chestnut hair, fluffy and light, fell from the fabric. She shuddered -- likely not used to the feeling of her hair constantly brushing the back of her neck. Behind the piano was a small bookshelf of her items and various books she's collected, but tucked between them was her mask. Carefully, pushing two separate pieces closer together, she put on the mask to conceal her face. Celia turned back to Sinclair. "Mm. Thanks..." Even if her face was hidden, it wasn't hard to tell she was giving a small smile.
Chili 9/17/2023 5:03 PM
Sinclair was glad to see her finally face him again, even if still under the guise of her mask. It was actually rather heartwarming to be on the receiving end of her smile. Sinclair pointed towards the piano. "Oh! A piano? I wasn't aware you played. I used to... hm." Sinclair cuts himself off, but continues to eye the piano. As far as he knew, the contents of the room were somehow related to ones E.G.O, as he had often seen the branch of knowledge lain about within the division of light and darkness in his room. He personally could not fathom most of it, but what he did know was that even looking at the piano caused his heart to ache a little.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 5:11 PM
“I do. I was taught… by… someone.” A face popped up in her mind, but it was hazy. The memory of someone important, but not so much they are clear in her mind… Celia’s mind clouded while trying to push away the recollection. Failing to remember who or what brought the instrument to her, Celia’s voice cracked. She swallowed, turning away and quietly hoisting herself up onto one of the branches of the left side of the tree. To get to a decent place to rest that wasn’t in the overgrown and off-access basement, they’d have to climb. So, Celia held part of the tree and looked down at Sinclair. “Uhm… Can you climb?”
Chili 9/17/2023 5:20 PM
"O-oh? Climb? Sure. I can do that." Sinclair looked up at the tree. It would be one hell of a climb, that's for sure. No matter how far he craned his neck, it just didn't stop going up. He did his best to follow her lead, finding a branch near him, and pulling himself on it.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 5:26 PM
She nodded. Thank goodness she didn’t have to carry another person again. Celia seemed to be a natural at this, but she was taking an easier route up the tree. Any moment Sinclair gave signs he needed a break, she’d stop and take a few moments to let him gather himself. Though, the moment they were nearing the ladder poking out of a thick bunch of leaves and branches, Celia quickly hoisted herself up to the stone platform landing on the next floor. A hand was held out. “Grab on. I got you.”
Chili 9/17/2023 5:32 PM
(again ) "G-got it." Sinclair was a little exhausted by the unexpected workout, but he was in the home stretch. And the last thing he wanted now was to fall and become a stain on the floor. Sinclair extended a gloved hand, and grabbed onto hers.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 5:42 PM
(some people are bad at climbing…) She took his hand in hers, pulling him up with her. “Please rest.” It was surprising to think past the thick greenery was yet another floor. A door was binded shut by thorned vines, while another was open into a small room with a telescope - and what appeared to function as Celia’s bedroom. Various framed photographs were on the walls and doorframes, depicting an obscured figure and a very young Celia. There were also sheets of music plastered on the walls, some complete and others nearing blank. Celia walked into the open door, moving the broken telescope and pushing a pile of books besides a bookshelf. “…hm…” As if remembering a puzzle, a few of the lampposts between shelves were turned off, before one of the bookshelves sank into the wall to reveal a small sage cushion to function as a makeshift bed. “There.”
Chili 9/17/2023 5:50 PM
The view from the top to the bottom was daunting, Sinclair understanding the truth in why people say not to look down. Although, he felt a twinge of pride in himself for climbing all the way up, even if he had to stop to rest a few times. Sinclair watched the scene unfold with curiosity and interest, like a child watching fireworks for the first time. "A-amazing! I hadn't known a room like this could exist on the bus. You really are something else..." He couldn't hide the smile on his face, as he was rather enamored with the complexities of the room.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 5:57 PM
Celia could feel her face get a little red from shyness at his amazement. She wasn’t particularly amazed by the room — she spent a long time in this place, even if the version Mephistopheles contained was a mere mimic meant to remind her of the depths of her mind she shuts out. Surprisingly, even she was somewhat amazed that many of the secrets were kept the same — Celia almost felt filled with a sense of wonder, desiring to see what else was the same. In her quiet mess of sheepishness, Celia let out a soft laugh. Was she entertained by this? Certainly. “Ah. Sorry,” she quietly murmured while quickly moving to pick up the books that were strewn about the floor.
Chili 9/17/2023 6:08 PM
"N-No, you haven't done anything wrong! Promise!" Hearing Celia laugh was something he never thought he'd hear. It was gentle, not grating, and reminded him of his sister's in a way. Hm. Sinclair joined in to help her clean up the books that were laid out across the floor.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 6:27 PM
As he helped her, she guided him on where each book went — truthfully, it was a random spot, as most of them were full of blank pages besides the ones she would stuff music sheets into. Celia picked up one book with a paper sticking out. She gently took it, staring at the contents. It was another obfuscated photo, but it appeared to be hand-drawn. Celia carefully placed it back in the book’s pages before she could ruminate on it. She turned back to Sinclair and gave a polite bow as a thanks. Quietly, she sat upon a bed that could only fit her, adorned with simple sheets and a small cat plush with a seamed mouth. “Thank you.”
Chili 9/17/2023 6:55 PM
Sinclair gave a polite nod. "It was no issue. I'm kind of envious, I wish my room were as comfortable as this. Although I could do without the climbing..." Sinclair looked upon the various photographs that adorned the walls and doorframes. "Oh? Are these you? And... someone else..." It was hard for Sinclair to make out the other figure, it was as if the image was blurred, but localized solely on this mysterious figure.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 6:59 PM
“…” It was as if Celia didn’t want to answer. It was no doubt that the little girl in the photos was her, in her happy and norml childhood. She could only really nod, choosing not to gaze near the photographs. Her eyes fixated past the railing by the edge of the room, peering into a void she could not dream of filling. Whoever that person was, must’ve been important — but forgotten, or erased. But it wasn’t anything Celia could really figure out right now.
Chili 9/17/2023 7:12 PM
Sinclair could feel he was reaching a sensitive subject, and stopped pressing the matter. But still... these types of photos. You didn't take them with just anyone. Whomever this person was, they are, or were someone to Celia. Even if now they were perfect strangers. "I'm sorry." Sinclair couldn't find any other words to say. He knew these feelings. And he knew that words wouldn't be enough to cure them. But sometimes it's words, the vibrations in the throat, that is all we can offer.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 7:16 PM
As he spoke, she turned back to him and tilted her head. How delicate that response was — and how apologetic Sinclair was tonight. “…It’s okay. I’m not sure who that is anymore.” Celia pushed her back to the wall of the bed, motioning for Sinclair to rest where she had opened the cushion for him. “Let’s just — sleep. The break will be over soon.”
Chili 9/17/2023 7:37 PM
(DIDNT MEAN TO SEND IT YET)
7:40 PM
Wordlessly, Sinclair laid down upon the cushion. It was soft and comfy. Maybe he could sleep tonight. It was different though. Comforting even. For once, the other figure in the room was real. The noises that passed were not laughter or whistles. There was no division of light and darkness. And above all else, for once he was atop the tree, instead of cowering in its shadow. What would he have said here? "You're doing good... you're stronger than you think... I'm proud..." Sinclair silently cursed himself. He meant what he said. He just wished he could say it with more resolve. That his reassurance could carry more weight than his meek voice.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 7:59 PM
This sight was one she was used to. Perhaps Celia felt a bit of solace in having another warmth here. It was like how it was the first time she got here - just herself for a while, until someday someone else showed up. She kept those events and memories locked behind, but Sinclair was mirroring everything that happened. The apologies, the wonder at the space, even questioning those photos and what they meant. Celia found it bothersome, because she couldn’t recall anything — she didn’t want to. She felt relieved that now, she could drift to sleep. A small escapade wasn’t harmful — in fact, this one was productive. Celia slowly removed her mask, placing it next to her pillow and laying down. “…” No response, of course, but she sighed and smiled to herself. It was - surprisingly - easy for Celia to fall asleep now.
Chili 9/17/2023 8:12 PM
Sinclair took in one last deep breath before closing his eyes. Even if he had to force them shut, he knew it would be better to sleep now. Being tired means being sloppy. And being sloppy means you might find yourself being revived more often than you'd like. It felt like ages, but finally Sinclair found himself lulled to sleep, completely still save for the gentle movements of his chest when he breathes.
Chili 9/17/2023 8:50 PM
Not even dreams where wholly a reprieve for Sinclair. Usually they were filled with things he wish he could forget, and voices he wish would stay dead. Sometimes, after using a certain mirror ID, they would be even worse. But tonight there was no cause for concern. It was like the way a child sleeps with a nightlight, where the minute illumination from the small bulb is enough to ease their worries. In this way simply the presence of Celia was enough for Sinclair to have a restful slumber. As his eyes cracked open and he stretched the stiffness out of his body, Sinclair recalled the memories of the night before. ... Sinclair admonished himself for still thinking this way. But he couldn't help but pray every night when he opened his eyes, that he would be greeted by the ceiling of the room he slept in all his life. Maybe tomorrow he would wake up from this nightmare. He was unsure of what time it was, but it would be better to arise now than risk being late. Sinclair went to go rouse his companion from her slumber, but was stunned. Celia had forgone her mask while she was sleeping, and for the first time ever, he finally was able to see the face of his companion. But there was nothing wrong with her face. No horrible disfigurement or deformity. Just another person, who was all too tired. (edited)
shit gets real 9/17/2023 9:34 PM
The way she slept was delicate. Like in a sweet dream, Celia was softly breathing and almost curled up into a fetal position. Her face was delicate, almost lacking the callousness or emptiness her personality gives. It was one of the few moments she felt peace - but still, only a moment. Upon her waking up, it was a simple process. Turn, rub the eyes, stretch…. Open those eyes up to another person looking down at her exposed face. This time, she couldn’t even muster the strength to quickly cover her face. She just sat there, staring at Sinclair like a deer in headlights. Well— there went all of that trouble of trying to keep her face hidden.
Chili 9/17/2023 9:43 PM
Sinclair quickly turned red when he realized he was caught staring. It was innocent curiosity, and ordinarily he would not allow himself to be impulsive like this, but he was still shaking off the drowsiness that clouded his judgement. "I-I... wasn't..." Sinclair snapped his head away, covering his face with his hands, which did little to hide how flustered he was. "I-I didn't mean... to see it. I just wanted... to wake you up. I.. um.." Sinclair was starting to wish he could just melt down into nothing to avoid the shame of this situation.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 9:51 PM
“…” Slowly, she simply took the mask and put it over her face. Celia sat up and moved off of the bed, making it without a sound. Beneath the mask, though, her face was red. The only other person to have seen Celia’s full face was Rodya, who wiped her tears away when Celia began crying from fear after experiencing her first death. Now, Sinclair was the second. Did Celia say anything? No, she couldn’t really make a reaponse. All she did was simply act like it didn’t happen, letting the embarrassment and anxiety stew deep within her. He wouldn’t tell anyone, right…?
Chili 9/17/2023 9:56 PM
She totally hates me. If she pushed me off this tree I wouldn't even be mad at her. I'm so stupid. Sinclair couldn't bring himself to even open his mouth outside of belting out another storm of apologies. He kept his face covered instead, the shame practically making his brain boil. Feeling his own face heat up however, he got an idea. Slowly Sinclair peeled his hands off his head, and awkwardly faced her again, trying to speak without sounding like he was mere moments from keeling over. "H-Hey... um... C-Celia..."
shit gets real 9/17/2023 10:00 PM
The shame in his voice was palpable. Celia turned back silently — head tilted as if to acknowledge his calling for her. “Hm?” What, was he going to make some comment about how empty her expression was? Or try and rationalize what happened, apologizing profusely? Truthfully, she intended to be forgiving. If it were someone like Heathcliff or Ryoshu, she wouldn’t have hesitated to knock them to the ground and throw them on top of the piano. Even if it got damaged, it’d repair itself regardless. But this was Sinclair. She was willing to listen, especially as he was kind enough to try and save face in the moment.
Chili 9/17/2023 10:10 PM
Sinclair tried to rationalize his thoughts, as embarrassing as it was for him. He had to control his breathing and steel himself, but eventually he worked up the nerve. His hands were shaking, making the task all the more difficult, but he managed to peel off one of his black gloves, exposing his hand to the elements. "I...It'd only be fair... right?" Sinclair felt a bit uncomfortable to have these gloves off in front of another person. Even in his nightmares, his palms were covered, his hands hidden away from the world. It makes us even. I hope.
shit gets real 9/17/2023 10:20 PM
She stepped forward. “You didn’t have to.” Celia removed her own gloves — she didn’t need them quite yet either way, but her next move made that action feel appropriate. She quietly took his hand in both of hers, holding it as delicately as possible. She intertwined their fingers, gently squeezed his palm — all trying to be very gentle. Then, she bowed down a little and brushed the top of Sinclair’s hand against her mask. It was like an attempt to offer a polite kiss to the hand, but all that could be felt was the coldness of the porcelain mask.
Chili 9/17/2023 10:48 PM
Sinclair took on the hue of a tomato, as even if it wasn't done proper, the gesture was still felt. He couldn't even bring himself to look directly at her, turning his head to the side. It felt unnatural to have the warmth of another in his hands. But it felt right. The way the fingers could lock into one another, the way the palms laid flat against the other. It made Sinclair wonder, just how long had he missing something he hadn't known he needed?
shit gets real 9/17/2023 11:00 PM
When she finished, she held his hand just a bit longer before letting go. Celia could feel that Sinclair might explode if they held hands any longer. “Thank you,” she whispered. Celia put her gloves back on, holding her hands close to her chest. How sweet. She felt her heart pound a little, realizing that they were even.
Chili 9/17/2023 11:33 PM
"Y-yeah. Um... no problem.." Sinclair slipped his glove back on as well, his heart beating a bit faster than he'd like to admit. "Maybe we... should get ready then. I wouldn't want us to get in trouble..."
shit gets real 9/18/2023 6:30 PM
"Hm. Right." Celia ducked her head down and put on her hood, taking Sinclair's hand to halfway-drag him out of the room. She lowered herself onto a sturdy branch. After finding solid footing, she lifted her arms up as if to catch Sinclair in the case he were to fall. "The way down's a lot easier," she clarified quietly. "But I got you." What a ... kind gesture. Part of her wished it was early enough that no one was awake -- not that there'd be much questioning, but she perhaps felt somewhat sheepish about the prospect of someone noticing Sinclair leaving Celia's room. Their chances right now should be slim.
Chili 9/18/2023 6:54 PM
“I-I’m sure I can mind my footing… but it’s rather relieving to know you’ll have my back…” Sinclair had to hold his breath during the descent. She was right, it was a lot easier to go down than up, but every time he had to look for his next foothold, he would catch sight of the daunting fall should he slip. It made his hairs stand on end just thinking about the fall should he lose balance. The idea of getting caught leaving Celia’s room was a bit awkward. There would be no doubt about it that some Sinners would take much joy in the opportunity to poke fun. But even if they should get caught, he could tolerate the shame for the sake of this moment.
shit gets real 9/18/2023 9:12 PM
As the two made their way to the ground floor, Celia stepped forward and lead sinclair to the door. She didn’t cross it, as she needed a bit more time to prepare herself. For a moment, she choked up. Felt a lump in her throat, as if she was dreading ending this moment and saying goodbye again - even if they were going to the same place. “…” “…” “…Wait.” Celia paused, holding Sinclair’s wrist before he would be able to leave just yet.
Chili 9/18/2023 9:22 PM
"A-ah?" Sinclair stopped when Celia grabbed onto him. It's strange how the moment her fingers locked around his wrists, he was as stiff as a statue. It's not that her grip was particularly powerful in this moment, but it seemed to hold Sinclair so strongly. "I-Is something wrong, Celia?" Sinclair felt his cheeks grow a little rosy, but also was confused as to what she held him up for. Maybe she forgot something at the top of the tree? Or was it something else? He continued to work the scenarios through his head, but couldn't find a concrete conclusion.
shit gets real 9/18/2023 9:31 PM
Celia paused for a moment. She was stunlocked, just shaking gently. Her heart pounded — she really wasn’t ready to say goodbye. But, she had to, and he’d definitely think she was a little weird for just holding him back for a second. With her head turned down, she pulled the other sinner in for a brief embrace. It was careful and delicate, but deeply heartfelt. “… I hope you feel better.” “And…” “Thank you.” After she spoke, she let go of him and turned around. Celia wasn’t gonna face those difficult feelings, just let them pass.
Chili 9/18/2023 9:51 PM
Even after the embrace ended, Sinclair stood paralyzed and wide-eyed. It was not like there was an absence of hugs or affection in Sinclair's life, but it felt like it had been so long since he last experienced it, that it was purifying. For so long now Sinclair was horrified, that he had become something unworthy of loving. He was a coward. So afraid, again and again. Too afraid to face himself, to accept the evil within. Too afraid of the times his sense of self was dominated by an E.G.O. Too afraid of the selves that lied within the mirror. Too afraid of blood on his hands. Sinclair felt powerless as tears dribbled down his face. It was cleansing. Every tear containing vitriol and hatred, resentment and rage that he wished to keep away from the world. But here it was safe. The tears would never be seen again once they land within the shallow pool. A chance to pretend things were ok again. (edited)
shit gets real 9/18/2023 10:09 PM
Goodbyes were always hard. Celia couldn't even figure out why this one hurt -- was it because she had a moment with someone that wasn't her being babied, just her helping someone out? It was like a new piece of Celia briefly unlocked. And now, she was having to go back to her usual quiet self, but she was longing for that connection to remain. Perhaps she'd invite him another night, playing some of the songs she's found the sheets to. Maybe she'll sit under the tree in his room, reading a book and hearing his story. Celia didn't quite remember what story she could tell him -- perhaps it would be of her dream, but it'd reveal too much. She was dwelling too deep into her mind. It was starting to ache. Celia gave a slight dismissive wave from behind, feeling a wave of some new, unfamiliar feeling wash over her.
Chili 9/18/2023 10:21 PM
Sinclair wiped the tears from his face, trying to make it look like he hadn't become a weeping mess just before the door. "Thank you..." His voice was small when he spoke, still trembling. He ought to head back to his room and freshen up before the morning round-up. It'd likely be another busy day of whatever they would need to fight, but at this point Sinclair was more than used to this line of work. He slipped out of the room, moving with relative haste to return to the half of the bus his room presided in. As soon as he opened the door he was greeted by the familiar sights. The divide of darkness and light, the floor of dead leaves that never cleared no matter how many times he cleaned it, the lone seat that remained in the darkness. And of course, the shadow of the tree that didn't exist physically. The serpent that coils so tightly. Crushing the tree in its vice grip. And yet it is never to reach that fruit it aims for. There wasn't much that Sinclair needed to right about himself, but he tried to look the best he could before they were due.
shit gets real 9/18/2023 10:30 PM
Celia sighed as he left the room. She removed her mask, staring into the water below. Her normally empty eyes were welling with tears, tears she couldn't explain. Part of her felt an urge to pretend she was happy, although still not quite sure what "happy" would be for her. She waded into the library, sitting at the desk and staring at the massive book that held endless notes of the world outside -- from simple things like how trees grow, to complex things such as the intricacies of a fixer's life. The page she was fixated on, it only had images of brains and skulls, and words she couldn't quite read. She felt scared to ask anyone else more qualified, but knew that the pages were important. From a drawer were withdrawn the few things she needed to get ready. Exchanging the cloak and shirt for pieces of her uniform, placing the stopwatch in that drawer to take out her ID tag. "..." When she felt she was ready, she put the mask back on and waded her way to the front of the bus, sitting in the back as she was designated to. Turns out Celia was one of the first, only being met with the cold gazes of Faust and her half-asleep lackey.
Chili 9/18/2023 10:47 PM
Sinclair took his time getting ready. As much as the silence irked him, it was one of the few moments of peace he would be experiencing today. The only sound accompanying his footsteps as he meandered around his room was the crunching of dead leaves when he entered the dimmer half of his room. Once he finally had his hair settled and his attire as proper as it could look, he readjusted the clip of his ID card. The Sinclair in that photo looked like it was from lifetimes ago. With Vogel in hand, Sinclair was one foot out the door before he looked back one more time. And what should happen, if the snake ever satisfies its hunger? A few of the more duteous sinners were already here. Meursault, Faust, Outis, and Ishmael of his original companions had already assumed their seats. While in the extended row he identified a few faces as well. He wasn't quite well acquainted with the whole of them, but they were tolerable at worst, which is the best Sinclair could hope for. It was easy enough to make out Celia. Her mask did not exactly make her inconspicuous. He looked at her for a moment or two, before turning his head back towards the front of the bus, feeling bashful. He took his seat, although the ones that occupied the same row were still absent presently.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 12:51 AM
Celia felt her face get warm when Sinclair walked past. While not exchanging a look back, her arms somewhat tightened around Recital as he soon turned back. Her stomach churned. She watched the others file in, reacting as usual to their morning wake-up routine. A tall one grumbles some swears, an even taller one slouches behind with no word and drops in his seat. The lesser knight strutted in jubilantly, lance in hand to sit upon her rightful place and take in a new adventure. A princess dashes forth with her jade-eyed prince, sitting in their spots and resuming their morning chatter past unwilling ears while downing the remains of breakfast. Celia realized she didn’t eat breakfast — but she also lacked an appetite. Perhaps it would come through the day. As the rest of the sinners made their way to their seats, Celia kept her head up to listen to any instruction. A makeshift role call later, off the bus went. This time, while LCC prepared for the next Golden Bough, a few fixers of a renowned legal office needed assistance in handling their distorted boss. They greeted Limbus Company with grace, one of them seeming to glance at a few of the sinners between statements. The operation was (somewhat) smooth. Although said distortion was self-contained within the bowels of its own office, what proved to be an issue was when said office became an obstacle itself. Celia watched indifferently as she and her coworkers passed — they revived within moments, too. In the end, a hefty reward and likely some social credit was due for the newer firm. One dinner later, with Celia mysteriously eating with the mask on (in truth, she just lifted it to quickly take bites), the sinners were all back on the bus with more knowledge and (likely) new fears. Of either Abno-parasitism, partial distortion, or simply anything with too many eyes. At the end of the day, Celia trudged back to her seat — her gaze was fixed outside the window. Finally… another day done.
Chili 9/19/2023 1:14 AM
Sinclair slumped down on his seat with a groan. Not my day today... He found himself thinking that often. But to his merit there was some truth to his words. While the operation was ultimately successful, it was not without great toll to Sinclair himself. To Sinclair's credit, he could get things done when the situation hinged on it, but when he was asked to affix a mirror ID onto himself, he was contemplating just gutting himself. Ironically, the mirror self which he loathed most actively, was easily one of if not, the strongest in Dante's current repertoire. It was not enough to have his thoughts and actions pervaded by things he'd rather suppress, but he unfortunately found himself corroding a multitude of times. Even now he can feel the judgmental stares of a few of the Sinners. Especially those that reside in the extension of the bus, who were less familiar with this particular ID. So much for making friends... No one wants to make nice with a person that bisected them... At least they helped people, was the sole reprieve Sinclair had. Even if he had to suffer for the sake of it. At the very least, the day was over. He wouldn't have to worry about today, because soon enough it would be yesterday. But still, one thought stuck to Sinclair's head. How many... Who did I kill this time? (edited)
1:19 AM
(corrected a minor grammatical/spelling error sorry)
shit gets real 9/19/2023 1:25 AM
This new job had its perks, thankfully. But it also had drawbacks. Ever since Faust made those extensions and sent out a new wave of contracts, it’s like having to go through orientation all over. These new employees were more unhinged, eccentric — Celia among the bunch was no exception. Celia was used to how things ran, even being the easiest one to extract IDs of out of the bunch — it seemed she was full of endless potential, able to shift in any way and make any melody work. However, with such potential came that she was frail. In the heat of the moment, she hadn’t noticed Sinclair corroding and heading straight for her — normally, Rodya would’ve taken most of the hit, or she would at least make it out only somewhat injured, but the second Celia could try and warn others, it was already time to rewind. Sinclair had killed her — not an unfamiliar occurrence, but the way it made her think had definitely changed. As she sat and replayed that moment, she could feel a sense of sorrow. Neither of them wanted to be in that position, it was just… an accident. Besides — whatever they were dealing with, it was tanking everyone’s sanity, even Celia’s. Is there any way I can avoid this, from now on?
Chili 9/19/2023 1:40 AM
It wasn't uncommon for Sinclair to be in this state of gloom after using this ID. All power comes at a price, and this one was rather self evident in application. If anything, it'd be best to eat his dinner then scamper off to his room. It may just be his nerves on edge, but it felt just about every single eye in the room was on him. Even if for a fraction of a second, there was the icy cold waves of contempt, and disappointment. Some definitely made it more obvious than others that they were unfortunate victims of his mental instability. It was an unfortunate curse that Sinclair had gotten skilled at scanning the emotions out of people. Even those who did their best to hide it, he could see a look of concern or fear in their eyes. Was it that bad today? Sinclair heard it was an arduous battle, and in heated conflict he was quicker to lose himself, more like a rabid beast wearing human flesh than a person. He spared himself from the desire to make small talk, isolating himself away from the crowd till he was dismissed. He hadn't much of an appetite tonight, but he figured it'd still have been best to eat something, if only to have something to fuel his body tomorrow.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 1:54 AM
In the midst of the mingling, Celia stood up and slipped away. Soon, they’d say that the nightly break has begun, and everyone would scurry off to do their usual routines. As she departed, she turned her gaze back to Sinclair. Another uncomfortable feeling filled her stomach — but she shoved it down, letting herself make that silent escape. It seems like not long after, the sinners were dismissed. She got passed by a few bodies, occasionally stopping to pat her on the head and remark about her disappearance. It was normal. She walked past the double doors of the kitchen — no need to pay mind to it today — and simply slipped away into her room. She kept thinking about those moments in her head. The way her heart stopped, the worry not only for her own life anymore— but Sinclair’s as well, and even wondering how she wasn’t fast enough this time. Opening the door and seeing the door on the right ajar, she stepped through it. As expected, the room was like she left it. The candelabra glowing golden, the foggy windows, and the painting leading to the basement. … She’s… never been able to walk into there before. Celia carefully treaded the stairs fore reaching the bottom, into the basement overgrown with thorny vines and a dense thicket. Does this mean i… She sat down at the piano in the center of the room. It was thickly wrapped in the vines, leaving only the keys exposed. “…” Celia wanted to escape, but she knew she was unable to. No, I don’t want to do this. Her guilt and her dread played over and over as she stared at the thorns. Was it offering the solution to her? Who knows.
Chili 9/19/2023 10:04 AM
Sinclair broke away from the crowd, feeling sick to his stomach. He stopped by his room first, to deposit his weapon and leave his jacket behind. It felt like it was darker today. As if the shadow dominated the light, what was an even divide looked a little more one sided. I’m just imagining it… No… sh-she’s not there. And it wasn’t your… Stop thinking about it. Stop thinking. Stop. Sinclair’s feelings reached a fever pitch, and he stormed out his room. Water would clear his mind. It was a simple remedy. Fire extinguished by water. Standing in the kitchen, sipping absently from a paper cup in order to clear his head. Sinclair remembered how a similar situation, albeit one less stressful, led him to his chance encounter with Celia. … Sinclair hesitantly approached the door of Celia’s room. It was nerve wracking. This should be… okay… right? (edited)
shit gets real 9/19/2023 10:32 AM
From the edges of the door was almost stillness. No pit-patting of the water of feet traversing the ground, just quietness - as if entirely empty. However, upon opening the door, the gentle sound of piano filled the room. Celia wasn’t at the central piano wrapped with the tree’s roots, but the sound was still present and filling the space with her music. Celia was in the basement, then. Surrendering herself to the task at hand, she played the thorn-covered piano. As she continued, vines slowly unwrapped and water began to pour onto the ground. She didn’t notice the door being opened, or the new presence. All that mattered to her was clearing up the basement, seeing what it would do and what it meant — an important moment… did something important happen recently? Celia had no time to think about it.
Chili 9/19/2023 10:42 AM
Sinclair had to bite the bullet. Even if he knocked, considering the vastness of her room the chances of her hearing it were slim. He gnashed his teeth and bit his tongue, before finding the will to open the door. The sight was about the same as the last time he saw it, yet he couldn’t help but gaze around in curiosity. When Sinclair finally found his voice, he called out. “Celia? I’m sorry for…intruding like this. But if you don’t mind..”
shit gets real 9/19/2023 10:49 AM
Still, she’s not there. Could be up the tree, but the only sound is the rustling of trees, occssional shaking, and a discordant melody being played from below. The door to the painting room was still ajar. Celia’s hands felt cold, almost shaking. But as she made more progress, she was … possessed. Where have I heard this melody? Why do I know it so easily… She still remained unaware of everything else — after all, she’s so used to being alone. If someone else was here, she definitely wasn’t going to notice them for a bit.
Chili 9/19/2023 10:56 AM
Music. Sinclair’s ears picked up on it. It wasn’t something he often heard anymore, save for within dreams or nightmares. It wasn’t playing last time. Sinclair found himself curious again, and moved to investigate. It was hard to focus though, as his mind was muddled. Resonating so strongly with an ID can mean that it’s thoughts may persist for a good while after. That Sinclair was furious. It wanted nothing more than to tear off its own flesh and smash everything that stood in his way. He’s a possibility. But he’s not me. Sinclair had to remind himself to disassociate the thoughts from himself. Even if it was hard, even if it meant swallowing down every single heap of fury, he had to stay calm. There’s no telling if he would break under pressure right now.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 11:06 AM
Each step closer made the music get louder, ringing clearer. As Sinclair approached the bottom of the stairs, the sight unfolded. Celia was playing away, He reached the basement room at the end of her performance. She took her hands away from the piano, staring up at the ceiling as the sky cleared up and let light in. She carefully got up, pushing the bench in and pulling a small vine off of her leg. “…” Celia’s heart ached. She looked at the left side of the room - more stairs, but the end of them looked to be shrouded in darkness still. If this was a sign she was slowly changing, It’s not a very good one, she could only think. (edited)
Chili 9/19/2023 11:19 AM
The basement was interesting. Unlike the peace and gentleness of the upper areas, this was a lot more like his room. Thorns that hung above the room, and dim lighting. Sinclair felt his skin crawl and his teeth gnash compulsively, as the things that existed in his imagination felt far more vivid this time. The music stopped, and Sinclair was left thinking if he should say something. It's not like she was going to remain oblivious of his presence forever, but at the same time it may be best to let her think for this moment. ... "Celia." Enough to make himself known, and controlled enough that he would not say words that weren't his.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 11:28 AM
The second he spoke, she jumped and turned around, stumbling to land upon the piano bench. “…!” “…” “…When… did you get here…?” Her heart nearly leapt out of her throat in that moment, pounding fervently as she breathed heavily. For a moment, she wanted to be upset with Sinclair for simply walking in without warning — but, he was likely uneasy, much like herself. She’d admonish him later, if at all.
Chili 9/19/2023 11:33 AM
"I-I'm sorry... I knew I shouldn't have... c-come in unannounced. I just... needed someone to talk to. There's a lot less pressure when I can't see your face..." Sinclair shifted uncomfortably in place. "I... didn't... do anything to you today... did I?" Sinclair had to force words out his throat, but he just had to know. Even if just to formally apologize now that he was fully in control of his faculties.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 11:47 AM
“I—it’s fine.” Celia stood up, slowly walking towards Sinclair. In her heart, she debated if she wanted to tell him the truth. The fact he asked meant he cared, but part of Celia wanted to hide it. However, she’d be haunted by that choice. “…” She gulps. “I was killed a few times — but it’s normal. I don’t mind.” Said quietly and politely, Celia nodded to herself. That was enough said, her own thoughts lacked enough substance to be added.
Chili 9/19/2023 12:11 PM
"A-a few..?" Sinclair felt like his soul was about to leave his body. Now, he was no stranger to the shame that followed the discovery of what he did, but the fact that he had done it multiple times to her? He felt despicable. "No.. um. I-It isn't normal... don't say that... d-don't justify it..." Sinclair's voice trembled, he felt dizzy and sick. "I um... when I did that I wasn't myself... o-or well, it was me. But not the me you know, if that makes sense... e-even if... it looked like me...." Sinclair felt like a fool trying to speak, he's sure Celia is already well aware of the functions of the mirror, someone so full of potential like herself. His face was running hot with shame, and he wanted to just run away from the whole situation. Why have I always been so weak? "I-I should go.... s-sorry." Sinclair felt like he might bite his tongue into two, should he press down any harder.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 12:16 PM
In that moment, she felt like it was a mistake telling him the truth. Again, it only serves to make a situation painful. “W-Wait. Don’t go, please.” He already made his way down here, past all the unfamiliarity of this room … why go now? Celia sighed, head tilted down. “It’s okay. I understand.” She’s talking more now, a sign she was getting comfortable. “I…” She wasn’t going to say she was worried. No way she’d let him in on that. She’s worked here for what, a few months? By now, Celia knew at least the basics of how things worked, she knew that the Sinclair who killed her wasn’t the one she was speaking to now, that she grew close to, that she started to… … Celia looked straight on. “Just— don’t go.”
Chili 9/19/2023 12:32 PM
“I… are you sure?” Truth be told, the last thing Sinclair desired was to be alone right now, but if she needed her space he was the last person to deny her. He nodded weakly in return. “If… you insist.” Sinclair’s mind was a little fuzzy still, but he never recalled anyone being more forgiving of what he had done than now. Forgiveness means everything for someone who always makes mistakes. He kept his eyes low to the ground, still abashed.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 12:45 PM
Stepping just a bit closer, Celia’s hand went up. She gently ruffled the top of his head in reassurance — It’s all okay, I can forgive you easily. “Are you okay?” She asked. Of course not. He’s probably deeply embarrassed, pretending it’s fine just to keep his composure steady. The light from above illuminated the two in a turquoise haze, making the entire environment feel still, sleepy. … Her heart seemed to beat a little faster each time she looked at Sinclair.
Chili 9/19/2023 12:57 PM
Sinclair blushes as she ruffles his hair. It was a sweet gesture. He could no longer tell the exact reason his heart was pacing. Sinclair wanted to be honest. It wasn’t fine. He was actively aware of everything he’s done wrong, and how everyday he had to face the reminders of how he let evil wander so freely into his home. He took a deep breath before he spoke. “Celia… have you ever looked into the mirror… and saw something you wished you would go away?” “…” “I’ve heard what the others have said… there is evil in my gaze… I want to be… a kinder, gentler person… I want to be… a stronger person…” (edited)
shit gets real 9/19/2023 1:02 PM
As he spoke, she simply gazed on. The lack of emotion granted by her mask meant that it would be impossible to tell that her heart was aching from his words. What did she see? Something she’s trying hard to forget, but can’t quite shake away fully. A version of herself who ignored the pain, one who woke up from the dream like it never happened. Her pain may not be as prominent, but she understood his desires. She wished to find something, someone, but it was impossible for her to realize who it was. “…” “I think you’re already very kind,” she said to him. “…And strong.” It was no lie that Sinclair had a lot of area to grow. Celia did as well, but the two of them talking meant progress was being made.
Chili 9/19/2023 1:29 PM
Sinclair pulled her into a tight hug, as if afraid that if he let her go, that she would disappear like everything else he had loved. It was hypocritical, that even though he had prayed so fervently for strength, he felt weak in her arms. An emotion so powerful, that it made him shake and quiver, and yet... not unwelcome. Hm. What a strange feeling.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 1:49 PM
“Ah—“ Celia had no choice but to hug him back, holding the back of his head with her hand. Who knew that such small words could make such a reaction. She buried her face into his shoulder, although all that could really be felt was just the coldness of her mask — the force was enough to really show the intent. Caring like this was an unfamiliar feeling. It hadn’t been experienced in a long time, but she no longer could picture who or what she was caring for. Living with only half of her memories, everything redacted meant over time, nothing made sense. Not even the feeling deep in her made sense right now, but she knew it was … pleasant.
Chili 9/19/2023 2:03 PM
Eventually, Sinclair let go, his sense of shame overtaking him. "Thank you... um... Celia. You don't know... how much it means to me." Even if Sinclair was a stranger to these feelings, he was not opposed to them. It anchored him to the world again, it reminded him that he was alive. That he was not the evil he repressed. He was not vehement rage and prejudice. They may be parts of him. They might be things he shunned and hid away, but they did not define him. Everyone had something to hide, things they wished to bury and cover in dirt. And that was okay. That did not make him a monster, it made him a person. Emil Sinclair had never desired more than peace of mind.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 2:15 PM
When they parted from the embrace, Celia felt the warmth leave with him. It made her empty, longing to hold him just a little longer. But, she suppressed the feeling. "I don't, but it's okay." She ruffled his hair again, then walked past to move up the stairs. Something about the basement irked her, and she wanted to leave again. Taking Sinclair's hand and gently dragging him off with her, she kept a gentle grip on him. "Come..."
Chili 9/19/2023 2:36 PM
Sinclair followed her, the beating of his own heart filling his ears. He wasn't quite sure what she wanted to show him, or if there was even something to be seen, but the kindness she afforded him left him more than willing to do so. So gentle, so kind.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 2:55 PM
Taking him up the stairs, they landed again eventually into the piano room. Celia shut the door and kept it tightly closed, soon making her way to the piano. She sat down at the bench, looking at the keys for a few moments. Then, Celia motioned for Sinclair to either sit beside her or on top of the piano -- much like she did when she was in the dream, passing by the hours. He needs company right now...
Chili 9/19/2023 3:11 PM
Sinclair sat next to her on the bench. It had been a long while since he was seated before a piano like this. His parents had always wanted him to play the piano. While he was capable, his sister was far more talented, which diminished his drive to practice. Still, the sight was not unwelcome, and was reminiscent of better times. How nice it was... to have company.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 3:24 PM
She watched as he scanned the keys, eyes focused on Sinclair. Celia then took the halves of the mask -- holding them to her face, Maybe, if I shed the disguise, he'll feel at ease. It's... Painful, she wanted to finish, but part of her felt it was worth it. Something in Celia felt that she was making the right choice in getting closer to Sinclair -- he willingly went back to her, seeking her comfort. Celia's hands tightened on the mask. She split it into two, keeping the upper half, and cast the bottom half on top of the white piano, to wait until she put the pieces together. When she turned back, a faint smile was on her face. "You said... you played piano at one point, right?"
Chili 9/19/2023 3:56 PM
Sinclair was dumbfounded, she had broken her mask? It felt like an honor for her to so willingly cast it aside for his sake. “I…used to, yes. But that was a long time ago, I’m probably rusty…” Sinclair’s eyes fell to the fragment of the mask that was laid upon the piano, before he gingerly placed his gloves next to them as well, neatly folded together.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 4:04 PM
"It's okay. Would you like me to teach you?" She followed his gaze -- and as Sinclair placed his gloves down, Celia's expression turned to one of surprise. "A-Ah. Don't worry, the mask can be put back together... the cracks are a guide." Celia gently took Sinclair's hand again, knowing how much he didn't enjoy having his hands exposed. It's nice that we can be open with eachother. . .
Chili 9/19/2023 4:21 PM
“And the gloves can be put back on… I think it’s fine for now… right?” He couldn’t help the blush that climbed his face when her hand took his. “I’d be honored to play with you…” Sinclair gave her hand a gentle squeeze.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 4:36 PM
“Mm. Moment.” Celia held Sinclair’s hand to her cheek for a moment. It was warm, soft, and untouched. When the moment passed, she soon got up and left his side. Pit-pat, pit-pat. Her shoes treaded across the shallow waters, and soon landed in the library room. Where’s that book… Ah. Right where she left it. Celia stood on top of a pile of books, grabbing one that had a cover of a tree etched into it. When getting it, she hopped off of the pile and walked back into the Piano room. The closed book was placed on the stand, and Celia moved back into place. “…”
Chili 9/19/2023 4:53 PM
Sinclair hadn’t moved a muscle since she left. He was burning red, the sensation of her face still fresh on his hand, the moment replaying in his head. Her flesh was so soft, so warm. It felt like a cloud. He briefly acknowledged her return with a sideways glance and a nod, before lowering his gaze again.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 5:04 PM
Celia opened the book, flipping through the pages. Most of them were stuffed with different sheets, notes, or blank pages. Halfway through, though, a small bookmark fell out and onto her lap. “…!” She picked it up, holding it to the distant light — it was made of brass, ornate and elegant. At the top of it was a small image of a bird. Celia inspected it more, then tilted her head. Where that bookmark came from… she didn’t know. Gingerly, Celia placed the bookmark in Sinclair’s hand. “Here… this is yours, now.”
Chili 9/19/2023 5:13 PM
“O-oh… thank you for the gift…” Sinclair held it in his hands and admired it. It looked beautiful, and admittedly while he did not read much as of late, he was tempted to purchase a few books on piano the next time they stopped somewhere, just to find some use for it. Something worth cherishing, that is certain.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 5:47 PM
She nodded, giving a genuine smile. Pulling out a few sheets from the book, Celia placed them on the stand in front of them. Her gloves were taken off, cast next to the piece of her mask. She scanned the music sheets carefully. “Ah- Uhm…” “…” “Clair… can you read music?”
Chili 9/19/2023 5:53 PM
Clair? Oh. It’s a nickname… “Y-yes? O-oh. Can you not? I-I can read them for you, If you’d like…” Sinclair assumed she could, given that he had heard her playing earlier. But it would be best to not assume either way.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 5:56 PM
“…” Celia laughed. It was a genuine laugh, where she even took his hand and held it to her chest — her heart was pounding fast. “Why else would I have all of these sheets, if I couldn’t?” She asked between giggles, beaming widely. That’s the most she’s ever smiled or laughed in a long time. Right after, Celia’s expression changed to her usual, neutral look.
Chili 9/19/2023 6:34 PM
Sinclair felt a bit embarrassed initially, for asking such a foolish question, but her laughter was so sweet, so heart-touching, that he found himself joining in, creating a choir between the two. “I-I suppose it was foolish of me to ask.” Sinclair finally sputtered out, in between howls of laughter. When he finally righted himself, there was a smile on his face.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 6:55 PM
She rested her head on his shoulder to calm down from her laughter, wiping a tear from her exposed eye. “Mm… okay, follow my lead.” Celia separated her hands from his, placing them on the piano. For a moment, she looked ahead, then started to play, using her heel to tap the tempo and keep them together. She… purposefully picked a duet, one easy enough for Sinclair to understand - but Celia no longer remembered where it came from, and why it felt so dear to her. Just that she picked up the papers, and placed them in the book for a moment like this.
Chili 9/19/2023 7:03 PM
Like he thought, it was a bit hard to get used to the motions again. Sometimes he’d accidentally play the wrong key, or bump his hands into hers, but even the discordant noises seem to wash away in the combined beauty of it all. He found himself often peeking at her face while they were playing. It looked so peaceful, no signs of worry or stress, it was sole devotion to the moment. She was playing her heart out, and how could he ask for anything more?
shit gets real 9/19/2023 7:53 PM
Even with his mistakes, she didn’t mind - it was enough that Sinclair was even trying, as awkward as it was for him. After a few moments, Celia stopped. “Ah- here, you continue. I’ll guide.” Carefully, she held one of Sinclair’s hands and guided him, using her free hand to turn the pages. “You’re doing good so far.”
Chili 9/19/2023 8:07 PM
Instantaneously Sinclair found his blush grow, his heart jump in speed, and throat tighten. He was certain now, that he didn't get this way around anyone else. This... this is what it feels like, huh. * How suddenly, he developed feelings, even when he felt no one could love him. This was something he wanted to last forever. Just making melodies with her. Soon enough, the sound of his rushing heart in his ears, joined the music. *Do you ever feel like you've been given more second chances than you deserved?
shit gets real 9/19/2023 8:21 PM
Celia’s gaze moved carefully between their hands, the pages in front of them, and Sinclair’s face. What am… I feeling? It was warm, delicate. Something she’s never felt before, but she didn’t want to stop feeling it. Getting lost in thought, Celia nearly forgot to flip to the last page, quickly doing so before starting to play with her free hand. “…” Did she have feelings? Was that it? She could ask someone for advice, but… that’d reveal everything, wouldn’t it? Her stomach churned, full of butterflies. What mattered now, though, was just how comforting this felt.
Chili 9/19/2023 8:28 PM
The song was almost over... even if he didn't want it to end. He would play every last note, each one with his heart in his fingertips. Playing the piano... it felt like home. It felt like the sights he had forgotten. The smiles, the laughter, the love. Everything he had... and everything he lost. Did you fail to love them? Did you fail to verbalize your love for them? Did you fail to realize your love for them? Are all of these questions part of the same horrible nauseating feeling in your stomach? How long were their bodies warm? Never again.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 8:35 PM
Something felt right about playing the piano. Like something, someone she loved gave this to her. Someone she never got to see again, never got to say a proper goodbye to. Tears welled up in Celia’s eyes as they finished playing together — she tried her best to blink them away. Even if she didn’t remember who that person was, it hurt her to think about anyone she once loved dearly no longer being able to share memories with her. …but this love she felt now, wasn’t quite like what she once had. It’s different, refreshing. Like a summer breeze, or a spring rain. It was one she could never really let go of, even if who that love was attached to dissipated. Celia looked up, carefully placing the sheets back, then looked at Sinclair while holding the book to her chest.
Chili 9/19/2023 8:50 PM
Sinclair tried to find it within him. He was searching for answers inside his head. What would they have said here? What would he have said here? ... It's in my hands isn't it? I can't chase ghosts and memories like they'll ever give me what I'm looking for. Sinclair mustered up every ounce of courage, every tiny scrap of strength and confidence, and spoke. "I know... until recently we were almost perfect strangers. But..." "I want to run my fingers through your hair, and tell you everything. I want to see your face again. I want to play music with you, hear you laugh, I want you to hold me close when I am weak, and I want to be there for you just the same." "..." "I need you, Celia. I need you in a strange way that I cannot explain to myself yet, and I don’t want to. Your presence is calming and comforting. I… I appreciate dearly that you comforted me that night...” "But, it's different now. I can face my own problems. I am me... and you are you. It has all become clear to me now. I also learned that I really do need you. It's not because I need you as a sanctuary for my problems." "..." "I need you because I truly love you." Sinclair said everything he withheld. Leaving his heart on the table for her. Most people do not have the audacity to say the things they leave unsaid, but Sinclair has found time and time again, he is not most people.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 9:06 PM
As she listened, her eyes widened. Her heart pounded harder and harder, until she nearly became deaf to her own thoughts. This… This is real… Not… a dream? …I…Is this what they call this feeling? Love?… “Ah, I—“ Celia’s cheeks flushed a bright red. She couldn’t hide behind her mask, the piece she left wasn’t enough to shield how obviously flustered she was. “…I…” Getting the words out was harder than she wanted to admit. But, she couldn’t just leave him without an answer. Especially not after he poured his entire heart out, and after all the beautiful moments they had together.
