At that moment, she spoke without even thinking… letting be known what her heart desires. “I love you too, Sinclair.”
Chili 9/19/2023 9:14 PM
The reciprocation of her feelings burnt away every doubt and fear that still lingered in his mind at that moment. Even the muddled thoughts of violence that still remained from the ID, were no match for the elation he felt at that moment. It is so strange... that today... the day that I killed you... is the day I would love you. It was rather cruel... but it was only after things died, that Sinclair truly understood how much they meant to him. "I-if you would be... kind enough to receive me... may I hold y-your hand again?"
shit gets real 9/19/2023 9:26 PM
Delicately, she put the book away, on top of the piano next to their belongings. No words, just a nod. She took his hands, holding them carefully. Although her expression was nearly unreadable, Celia’s rosy cheeks gave away exactly what was on her mind. Despite losing much of herself, she still had a space in her heart for someone to fill again. While this wasn’t exactly the person she expected… she wouldn’t have it any other way. Perhaps, when she remembered everything, this bond and its foundations will mean just that much more to her.
Chili 9/19/2023 9:34 PM
It was wonderful. The way it felt as if Sinclair's skin was built to hold her. His fingers locked perfectly with hers. When he hugged her, his head fit just right in the crook of her neck. It couldn't be a coincidence. Even if he was lacking purpose now... he knew he was built to love her. Nothing could take that away from him. For as long as they operated with Limbus Company, not even death could do them part. It's faster than a shooting star, but somewhere else on the bus, for the thinnest of moments. There was a room that was perfectly bright.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 9:41 PM
Celia’s brow furrowed. She squeezed Sinclair’s hand — the squeeze got a little tighter as she felt a tear hit her thigh. Her vision became blurry. Celia’s nose burned, she felt a lump in her throat. And, suddenly, she burst into tears. The normally quiet, seemingly emotionless Celia was now crying, pathetically wiping her tears away with her sleeve and mixing in joyful laughs to cover the display of vulnerability. She hadn’t cried like this in a while. Since she…. A long time, at least. Celia didn’t exactly know how to handle it, even feeling a little awkward doing it in this moment. But, she couldn’t really hold it in for much longer.
Chili 9/19/2023 9:49 PM
Sinclair ran his hand over her head, stroking it gently. “It’s ok… to cry. It’s ok to feel weak sometimes… when that happens…You have me. I’ll be there… I promise...” Sometimes, it’s better to cry. To lower our defenses, to be honest with each other. If Sinclair has learned anything recently, that tears are just another flavor of the human existence.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 9:59 PM
Celia instinctively leaned into Sinclair as he comforted her. Her tears didn’t last long, drying up almost as quickly as they started. “… uhm.” “Thank you.” Truthfully, she was remembering how to feel things. Crying like that felt unnatural, but it wasn’t so bad with Sinclair around. She was certain that anyone who had cared for her would be proud of her for being able to be vulnerable like this. However, she had a question. “A—are you gonna stay here again tonight? Or, are you going to sleep in your room?”
Chili 9/19/2023 10:14 PM
“I…” Sinclair hadn’t actually put any thought into that till now. While he didn’t want to be rude and impose on her two nights in a row, he didn’t want to part ways either. “I-I’ll just linger for a little longer…and I’ll find out from there.” It was an uncertain answer, but satisfied both of his concerns.
shit gets real 9/19/2023 10:22 PM
“Mm… okay.” Part of her wanted to ask him to stay, but she didn’t wish to subject him to climbing the tree again, or arouse suspicion in the case they weren’t lucky enough to wake up early. Celia leaned back on Sinclair, closing her eyes a little. A wave of relief seemed to wash over her. For telling her how she felt, for seemingly comforting him, even crying felt relieving. Celia’s voice got quiet. “…Do you feel better?”
Chili 9/19/2023 10:27 PM
“A-ah…” Sinclair just remembered the reason he came into her room in the first place. “Yeah. I think… this is the best I’ve felt in a long time.”
shit gets real 9/19/2023 10:39 PM
“That’s good.” Celia paused. She had something she wanted to do, but couldn’t quite bring herself to do it yet. Can I…? Would he…? Well, part of her wanted to see his reaction. So, she leaned in and applied the smallest kiss to his cheek. It was less her actually kissing, and more of Celia simply pushing her lips into Sinclair’s skin. Right after came some words of reassurance. “Don’t… feel bad about today, okay? Things happen. Now we’re here.”
Chili 9/19/2023 11:05 PM
It was a quick peck to the cheek, but it felt like so much more than that. Sinclair wasn't one well versed in romance, but he had heard from others. Rodya had told him before that a kiss between lovers is different than a kiss from family. While he wasn't sure what it meant at the time, now he understood there was wisdom to what she said. As his face turned a deep red, he forced himself to look directly into her eyes, even if he was currently feeling timid. "Thank you... I really don't have any other words.... but thank you...for finding in your heart to love me, even when there is something so shameful beneath the surface..."
shit gets real 9/19/2023 11:12 PM
Celia sighed. “Is that what you think of yourself…?” The question was simply poised. She saw nothing shameful, just someone hurting. Someone who’s suffered a lot. That was very much worth caring for, especially given how each meeting they had seemed to have Sinclair on the verge of breaking down. Celia asked Iris to catch her up on what she had missed once, having the knight easily recount the stories Faust explained to her in thorough detail. From the bug soldiers to the freezing castle, even up to the fight with Kromer and the tragedies within K Corp. itself, Celia knew a lot of the sinners had deep sorrow, and Sinclair’s burrowed deep within him. Part of Celia wanted to make a comment about how he felt so strongly for someone who barely even remembers who she is — although such a statement was half-true, as she was merely trying to define it as she went on. To Celia, she didn’t understand how he felt about himself — nor did she want to try.
Chili 9/19/2023 11:24 PM
"N-no, It's fine now. I um... d-don't mind staying a little longer. I-If that's fine by you..." Sinclair was still a little flustered, but he wanted to stay with her for a while longer, and enjoy this moment while it was still fresh. In his own eyes, Sinclair saw Celia as someone who had lost their place in the world. But that's alright. Everyone is looking for something, somehow, someway. So what made her any different?
shit gets real 9/19/2023 11:31 PM
“Mm. You can stay again tonight…” Admitting that she wanted him to stay with her made her heart pound. Ach, there’s no guides on this… Just going along with what your heart wants. Celia stood from the piano and stretched, staring up at the wall between the trees. The normally dull center pendant glowed a bright cyan, likely signaling she was… happier than normal. Celia’s never seen that before, but she smiled up at it. As the room shifted to reflect her lighter mood, it was like the sun was shining down after a brief rain. She picked up the book again.
Chili 9/19/2023 11:47 PM
Sinclair stood from the bench, taking his gloves with him. He had no intention of putting them on, but he did not desire to forget them either. His hands were for her only. Nor did he forget the bookmark, which he promised himself to find a use for. The room seemed more vibrant, as if an artist had added a splash of color to their work. It only added to the already impressive scene, and left Sinclair as awestruck as always. He wasted no time dragging his feet however, and was ready to go anywhere she wanted to.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 12:01 AM
Quickly, Celia put the book away in the Library and returned to Sinclair. She looked over at her mask. “…” Then, she fully took off the fragment that remained over her eye, placing it by the bottom half and pushing the sides together - they slowly formed a whole, leaving the crack that never ceased to exist. When she turned back, her face was exposed. All of it. Even if most was visible, something was different about seeing her entire expression, appearing nearly half-asleep. It was … cute.
Chili 9/20/2023 12:20 AM
To be entirely honest, there was scarcely a difference. But the simple step it took to expose the entirety of her countenance meant the world to Sinclair. Now that the both of them had fully laid bare that which they had always hidden, it was a moment of beautiful transparency. She looked precious. Someone worth fighting for. Dying for. Living for. Coming back just to do it all over again. She looked precious, because she was precious to him.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 12:55 AM
“We should go upstairs.” Celia walked to the bark of the tree, trying to get herself sturdy. Her foot touched a tile right behind the piano, shifting the center of the floor and rotating it until a portion of it raised. A platform? Ah… must make climbing easier. “…This room… keeps surprising me.” Celia suddenly felt the urge to withhold this discovery from any new visitors. Just to have them climb. “Hmmm….”
Chili 9/20/2023 1:07 AM
"O-oh? A-amazing..." Sinclair was filled with childlike wonder once again at the sight of the various mechanisms of the room. It was like a new experience each time. The platform wasn't unwelcome, as Sinclair was more than happy to avoid the strain of climbing to the top once more.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 1:27 AM
“I guess that saves time.” Celia stepped upon the platform, taking Sinclair’s hand along the way and holding it tightly. “I don’t remember this,” she whispered to herself. The platform shifted out of the floor and floated up the tree — Celia knelt down, closing her eyes so she didn’t look down. It was ironic now, given she lived in the room with the giant tree. Perhaps it was merely the lack of control that made the height scary. Then, the platform stopped. Celia’s eyes opened. “…That was easy.” She stepped across the gap to the upper floor’s landing, soon falling and landing on her hands and knees from a tiny slip-up. Normally, Celia would just get up without complaint. But this time, she let out a soft chuckle.
Chili 9/20/2023 1:35 AM
It definitely was easier to take this platform than to climb. Sinclair was quick to help her with a worried look. "A-are you alright Celia? Y-you're not hurt are you?" His eyes ran up and down, trying to confirm her condition. (edited)
shit gets real 9/20/2023 1:42 AM
As she stood, she simply kept laughing to herself. She lifted each leg, noticing only a small scrape on her left knee. It began to bleed, but not so much it was of too much concern. “I’m okay— Oh, just a small scrape,” Celia pointed out. No matter, she thought while walking forward into her room. The normally hazy darkness past the fence at the far side had become a waterfall outside the window, exposing a foggy forest of trees that seemed to expand endlessly. It was a lot calmer, more comforting than before.
Chili 9/20/2023 2:07 AM
He wasn't quite sure what she was laughing at. Was she trying to laugh off her little spill? It left Sinclair rather confused. "I-If you're sure..." Sinclair still wore concern on face, but ultimately relented. If she was sure she was fine, he may as well believe her. It was soothing to take in the scenery of the room, as such sights of natural beauty were scarce in The City. And he could not help but wish he had some sort of camera to save this view outside of his memories.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 2:16 AM
“Positive,” she reassured him. “…I see you’re worried, though. Mm.” Celia made her way to a bookshelf right next to the window, pulling out a small box. Inside were various makeshift first aid items, among them being gauze she stole from Dr. Frankenstein’s room (it was willingly surrendered; Victor just didn’t outright say it) and a few cotton pads. She took just enough care to clean up the wound before wrapping it. Now it’s actually fine. “….There. All good now, don’t worry.”
Chili 9/20/2023 2:23 AM
"S-sorry... I don't mean to be overbearing..." Sinclair shuddered. He had seen small wounds like that get infected in the past, and they were not pretty. Even in his town of Calw, he had seen a few people that had to amputate and replace entire limbs with prosthetics due to a single medical mishap. Sinclair was glad though, to see her wound properly taken care of.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 2:27 AM
Celia was used to small bumps and bruises. Even as a little girl, she used to run around and explore, sometimes slipping up and hurting herself. And, much like now, she’d usually laugh it off. Someone older would admonish her carelessness, and he’d bandage her wounds — only to then release her to continue her grand adventures, as if the mishap didn’t happen. That was one of the few memories she still had. Celia made her way over to Sinclair, taking his hand. “No, not overbearing. It’s… nice.” She said it with a smile, squeezing Sinclair’s hand. (edited)
Chili 9/20/2023 9:59 AM
“O-oh… no problem.” It felt stupid to blush every time they touched, but Sinclair couldn’t help it. It felt so warm each time, that he could never tire of the feeling. He had missed moments of innocence like this, they are so few and far between now, but it was so wonderful to have them back in his life. (edited)
shit gets real 9/20/2023 10:35 AM
It’s times like this that make Celia’s life a little less bleak. She grew used to the monotony of life, fighting the same things and being with the same people, watching the same tragedies. At least when the sun went down, she could change things up. Play the piano, read a new book, aimlessly wander the kitchen, chat with a coworker… even hold hands with them in the vastness of her room, having just linked hearts. She leaned in again to apply a better, proper kiss on the cheek. Likely just to make up for the last time, or to get Sinclair fired up again. Cute. ♡
Chili 9/20/2023 11:02 AM
Sinclair wasn't expecting it, and it made his face flare even brighter. Her lips felt so soft and smooth, and now that she fully pressed them against his cheek, he could feel them with complete clarity. He stammered briefly, trying to find words to say, ultimately giving up with a sheepish smile on his face.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 11:10 AM
That was the kind of reaction she expected. Celia smiled coyly. “Ah- you’re not hungry, are you…?” Even if they were high up, she realized both of them hadn’t eaten for a while. Hopefully that platform was still there, waiting to take them down. “It’s… okay…. If not.”
Chili 9/20/2023 11:18 AM
Sinclair thought for a moment. He had neglected his hunger earlier, while he was feeling gloom. Even if he could go without food for the day, he didn't want her to stay hungry for his sake. "W-we can go eat. I think we've both had a long day today." Sinclair gave her head a gentle pet, running his fingers through her hair.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 11:38 AM
“Mm.” As he ran his fingers through her hair, Celia’s face lit up and her cheeks became red. Her hair was soft, fluffy, cared for greatly. She lead him to the edge of the upper floor, seeing the platform that lead them up still there. She carefully stepped on - then made sure Sinclair got on as well. “All good?” She asked.
Chili 9/20/2023 11:51 AM
“Y-yeah.” Sinclair peered over the edge of the platform. He felt he could never tire of it. The picturesque view surpassed anything The City had for display.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 11:59 AM
As they both stepped on, Celia held Sinclair close. Something about the platform moving made her feel uneasy, but keeping hin close gave her just enough comfort. And to think, this only happened because they happened to cross paths that night. When it landed, she quickly went up to the piano at the bottom of the tree, picking up her mask and gloves to put on. Once again, concealing her face. Part of Celia wanted to ask about why her room ended up this way. She couldn’t ask Iris, who’d refer to Faust — and Faust would only babble about how it was ‘the fathoms of her EGO,’ or that it was ‘a physical form of her mental state.’ Not really enough answers, but the beauty and vastness of it seemed to suggest Celia was filling a lot of her mind with emptiness and fantasy. Celia quietly walked to the door, holding the handle and waiting. For this moment, her silence resumed.
Chili 9/20/2023 12:46 PM
Sinclair nearly forgot to put his gloves back on before he left. His hands once again closed off to the world. Maybe one day I’ll take them off… for good. Sinclair waited patiently behind her, allowing them to go at her pace.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 1:02 PM
She opened the door and tightly shut it, scanning the hallways. It looked... clear. Normally, by now, some of the newer sinners would be moving between rooms and mingling -- perhaps they already were in their destinations. Celia took Sinclair's hand and lead him to the kitchen. The double doors slid open to show that ... someone was already in there. Humming resonated through the room, and beneath the orange light was Rodya, who seemed to be quite occupied with whatever she was cooking. A small notebook was on the counter next to her, with varying scribbles in overly-neat blue writing. She read the book, then tried following the instructions. The younger sinner knocked on the wall. This alerted Rodya, who turned around fast as if she were getting caught doing something she wasn't supposed to. "...oh! Kiddos, I... didn't think you'd still be up this late." Celia shrugged. Her hand waved over her stomach. "You're hungry, too? Mmm~" Rodya put her ladle to her lip, stealthily tasting the contents. "I think I'll make just enough food for you too, but please don't snitch to the others about this. I don't wanna be put on kitchen duty." A thumbs up was only given in response. "Good. I can always count on you, Celi! your quietness has perks, fufu~ ... Trouble sleeping, though? Or have you two been staying up chatting all night?" She teased. Celia kept quiet. Not that she wished to speak, either way. She felt it was easier to let Rodya make her own conclusions, and perform her almost motherly role on her own script.
Chili 9/20/2023 1:24 PM
Sinclair wasn’t quite expecting to encounter Rodya here. If he could help it, he’d rather keep his feelings for Celia unknown from the other sinners. “Oh? I-I was just coming to get something to eat… and um… Celia happened to be going the same way I suppose…” Sinclair realized that he hadn’t said it earlier, and probably owed it to her as well. “Sorry if… I did something to you… earlier today.” He looked rather embarrassed when he said it, sincerely regretting his instability during their work. His time with Celia had helped him get over most of the guilt, but he may as well apologize in case there were still some bitter feelings lingering.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 2:33 PM
Rodya rolled her eyes and scoffed lightheartedly. She turned back, holding the ladle close to her. "It's okay, Clair -- I know we all get a little cuckoo sometimes. Honestly, maybe Dante should've listened to Faust's advice on moderation~" Celia stifled a small chuckle. She quietly let go of Sinclair's hand, sitting at one of the chairs right in front of the row of cooking stations. "What's that?" "This? Ahhh~ Just some kind of stew that Sault wrote the recipe down for. It's awfully cold in my room, so this warms me right up. Maybe take some for your plants, they'll like it." "They... prefer water." Rodya laughed at the comment, looking back at the notebook and grabbing some spices from a nearby cabinet. Celia looked over at Sinclair, staring quietly. Her cheeks felt warm.
Chili 9/20/2023 3:16 PM
Sinclair returned the gaze and gave a brief, knowing nod. If she doesn’t figure it out, no one will. Sinclair hadn’t seen Rodya cook since the event at Eubong’s, but if she’s following Meursault’s recipe, it should turn out pretty well.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 3:24 PM
She seems clueles... that was a good cover. "Would you like some of this, Clair?" Rodya asked. "It's real good, I promise~" Celia raised her hand. Rodya nodded back, preparing to plate the stew after a few more taste tests. "Most people aren't up right now -- I think I saw Heath and Ish storm off to their rooms right as I left mine, so feel free to lift the mask a little, Celi -- unless he hasn't seen your face." "Mm. Okay..." She wasn't gonna admit that minutes before, they were close and both exposing themselves, but she just agreed with the notions. It was infinitely easier to just let the woman ramble. "Are you doing okay, though, Clair? I know Faust tends to get shaken up by her Inquisitor ID, I always see Iris have to comfort her before getting those three-hours-of-sleep. If you need anything, I got you--" "He'll be okay. He's strong." "That's right! He is!~" Rodya parroted back with a joyful giggle.
Chili 9/20/2023 5:06 PM
(DIDNT MEAN TO SEND IT IM KILLIN MYSELF)
Chili 9/20/2023 5:15 PM
"Y-Yeah... I'll have some..." Sinclair felt a little bashful to be receiving these compliments. Strong isn't exactly a word that comes to mind when he pictures himself, but if they say it, he's willing to believe it. Faust's N-Corp ID wasn't something Sinclair liked thinking about. The first time he saw it... he couldn't help himself. For every ID that was related to Nagel Und Hammer, it was almost a rite of passage to be chopped down by a frenzied Sinclair. While now he had gotten better at controlling himself, those wearing Inquisitor ID's were most likely to be targeted when he corroded. Not like he had control over that...
shit gets real 9/20/2023 5:33 PM
The two nodded in unison. It was like watching mother and child, their similarities rang a lot deeper than either Rodya or Celia would like to admit. Celia played with her sleeves and kicked her feet against the stool she sat on, eyes scanning all of the items in the kitchen. The kitchen duty board, laden with notes and half-assed scribbles of sinners trying to dodge their responsibility. Another board for shopping lists, including someone's endless requests for strawberry shortcake and another's for quality beef (for steaks! *they'd remark). Things they couldn't afford quite yet, despite the new makeshift accountant's excellent budgeting and occasional fund increase thanks to lady luck blessing a chronic gambler. A few sticky notes on the corkboard parallel to the viewing window, mostly being chatter between the sinners. One of them stood out, being a "PLEASE stop taking my breakfast!" from a distressed Ishmael, to which a reply from Heathcliff was written -- a simple "No thanks." As Celia let her mind wander, Rodya began serving the food for them. She ended up having leftovers, so she quickly packaged them and shoved them into a back corner of the fridge -- if someone found them, she would immediately know someone was snooping to find her stuff. "Okay, kiddos, eat up," Rodya said while carrying two small bowls. She placed the first in front of Celia, offering the second to Sinclair. "Mm, thank you." Celia split her mask again momentarily to eat -- Rodya's expression changed to one of surprise. *Is she gonna question me? I hope not... I can just say it was a mistake, Celia thought to herself. It sort of was, at least the first time.
Chili 9/20/2023 6:02 PM
Sinclair did his best to pretend that he didn't see what Celia just did, acting like he was far too engrossed in his meal to notice Celia's blunder. Internally however, Sinclair was sweating bullets. He wasn't sure how Rodya would react if she found out, and frankly he didn't want to chance it either. He nervously scooped spoonfuls into his mouth, scalding his tastebuds.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 6:19 PM
"Hey, Clair, be careful. You too, Celia..." Rodya said, putting her fingers against the cold mask to push it against Celia's face. "Oh, it's fine, he's alr--" "?" "He won't look, I think." "Okay, if you say so." Celia sighed, lifting the spoon and quickly lifting the bottom part of her mask to eat. Rodya ate from the other side of the counter, keeping the half-tattered apron above her uniform. It wasn't clear where they got it from, but now it was a valuable asset to Limbus Company. Rodya kept her focus mostly on her meal, even going out of her way to find some of the buns she had just purchased to dip in the soup. Right as she turned around, though, heavy footsteps walked past the door. Celia looked back as well. "Celi, hide the b--" "They're gone. I think I saw a red hat." "That fly..." Rodya grumbled with a half-chuckle. "Mm. Wandering..." "Ah, it's fine. Even if he knew we were in here, he hates this stuff. Can't get him to try it even once." "...how do you know?" "Just do," Rodya fibbed. Celia chuckled to herself. Seems Rodya's got some secrets of her own... maybe that's why she's not as attentive. Subtly eating, she made sure to occasionally peek over at Sinclair, hiding the butterflies in her stomach.
Chili 9/20/2023 6:53 PM
Sinclair had to pretend he was completely clueless, which isn't to say was impossible, just very difficult. It was only made harder by the glances that Celia kept stealing at him, and while he wished to do the same, he had to pretend like the stew was the only thing in the world. It was good, as expected from Meursault. He was just that type of man, wholly capable in just about anything. Sinclair hoped that someday he could be just as reliable.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 7:08 PM
Rodya seemed not to notice the tension between the two. Although Celia kept accidentally slipping up, Rodya paid no mind to it. She finished her bowl of soup, putting the dishes in the sink. "Okay, kiddos, i'll handle the dishes. And..." Celia peeked up. Her head tilted. "Geez, don't look at me like that. I was just going to say to have a good night~ I heard from Dante that we're stopping at a Terminal tomorrow." "Terminal?" "Yeah. They have a few that move to different districts, and one just relocated near where we are now. It's a good chance to stop and shop~ I can give you allowance!" The younger sinner grimaced at the notion of an 'allowance,' like she was a child. But, she had to keep up her role. "I think I have enough... but more would be nice." "Get a treat with it. I won big recently, but Fau went on about needing to save it and put it in for everyone, so i'm trying to pretend I'm running a charity service, huhu~" Celia enjoyed Rodya's chatty nature. She nodded along, continuing to eat until she no longer had any soup left. She held the bowl up.
Chili 9/20/2023 7:26 PM
A Terminal.. huh. It had been a fair bit of time since they had the chance to stretch their legs. Sinclair had been hoping to pick up a few things the next time they stopped, so it was good timing. Sinclair finally finished his bowl as well, feeling full and refreshed. "Is there something you're looking to buy Rodya?"
shit gets real 9/20/2023 7:32 PM
“Me? Oh, it depends on what’s there. Normally I have to go grocery shopping, but this time I wanna get something nice for myself.” “Like what?” “Mmm… good question~ Perhaps it’s due time I got a bracelet — and one that isn’t horribly overpriced.” Celia hummed in thought. What would she buy? In looking at the terminal guide pamphlets, she always remembered wanting to go to the book store, or simply cruise the various restaurants and stores that were at each different one. She might have to ask around for the pamphlet for the terminal they’ll be going to, and develop a plan as she read through. Maybe she could get to look around with Sinclair. Celia’s stomach began to churn in anticipation… she was quite the simple girl, after all. “Ah. Why are we going?” “I dunno, maybe corporate things. The bus might need tweaking, since the boat upgrades and expansions must’ve done a number.” “I see.” “Yeah? Hey, Clair- do you have anything you want to get done?”
Chili 9/20/2023 7:38 PM

Is there anything she would like? "H-how about you Celia? Is there anything you want to pick up?"
shit gets real 9/20/2023 7:43 PM

Yeah.” “Oh, you know Celia. Usually she just sits at the piano in the lobby and plays away until it’s time to go. Are your plans changing?” “Mhm. Worth a shot.” She put her hands on her cheeks, really debating what she’d do. Ah, maybe I’ll find something Sinclair would enjoy. Although, I gave him that bookmark… She looked at him again, putting her hand to her chin. “Your possibilities are endless,” Rodya reassured. “Maybe ask around for ideas, and don’t listen to those rich-folk — either of you. Chili 9/20/2023 8:10 PM

It'll be worth it tomorrow though. (edited)
shit gets real 9/20/2023 8:17 PM

She opened it, grabbing a small piece of cake that was wrapped in adorably pink plastic. She’s definitely stealing someone’s snack. A little bit of mischief - guess it never hurts. She had an alibi, either way. Perhaps it was the setup to an argument. She took off her mask and placed it to the side, unwrapping the cake to take a bite out of it. “…mgh… That wasshh… hardurr… than i fhought…—“ She swallowed the small bite of cake. “It would be… excuse me.” The small lack of manners went by with a brief apology and Celia’s cheeks getting red. Perhaps she was releasing the pent up anxiety from that interaction.
Chili 9/20/2023 8:24 PM

shit gets real 9/20/2023 8:32 PM
“I think she was too busy with the soup and worrying about whatever she’s gonna do tomorrow to figure us out.” “And… That’s okay… I think I need to arrange some things, as well.” She continued eating the cake, then discarded the trash in the nearby bin. Should I face the consequences… Ah, It’s worth it. I might ask her for her tastes. Oh… wait… I need to ask for something. Celia sighed to herself - admittedly, she did want to stay a little longer, but they were getting the habit of staying up late. Is this a goodnight, then? Lifting herself off of the fridge’s door, she walked over to Sinclair and nearly threw herself into a hug. It was tight, sincere… full of affection. How sweet.
Chili 9/20/2023 8:41 PM
Sinclair almost fell back from the sudden hug, thankfully he managed to keep his footing. He hugged her tightly, and gave her a cheeky kiss on the top of her head. "G-Good night Celia..."
shit gets real 9/20/2023 9:04 PM

That… made up for everything that happened today. She grabbed her mask and soon left the kitchen, but stayed behind for a bit to make sure Sinclair got into his room safe. She had an extra mission, just before settling in for the night.
Chili 9/20/2023 9:26 PM
Sinclair made it back to his room without any trouble, not that he was expecting any. The sights were the same as always, but at the very least, he wasn't imagining anything. Instead, he was busy thinking about where to take her, what to wear, what she would like. Glasses... I hope she doesn't laugh... Sinclair didn't wear them often, as they would more than likely get in the way in a fight. It's not like his eyesight was terrible either, but it relieved some of the strain.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 9:38 PM
As Sinclair entered his room, she slipped further down the hallway to a door labeled ‘24,’ with a small cross underneath it. Knock, knock. ”…At this hour? I hope it’s something important…” “”…Worry not, Faust believes it has to be.”* When the door opened, Celia looked up expectantly. Before her was Iris, someone who Celia looked up to greatly. “Advice, please.” “Mm. Come in.” As Celia entered the vast white space, she noticed a few of the swords that normally hung from the ceiling impaling the ground, forming red spots near their landing. She felt guilty for intruding, just for a moment. “Lady Faust, it’s Celia. You don’t mind if she stays for a bit, right?” “Faust permits this.” Celia bowed politely. “… We’re going to a terminal, right?” “Mhm. Why, are you nervous about an outing?” Celia shook her head. Their next interactions fell silent, as if Iris was reading Celia’s mind and vice versa. “…Oh, I see… Well, just follow what you think is best. If all else fails, why not ask?” “…” “…not that simple, I see. Okay, next best bet is something personal to you.” “…” “Mmm, okay. My, Celia, you’re even making me confused.” Iris’ halo spun and flickered in thought, before it lit up right as her brows raised. “Depending on who it is, it’s either gonna be something that reminds them of their past, or…” “…?!” “Not that… okay. Just… maybe figure out what they liked, and find something like that. I can’t give good advice if I don’t know who it is, and…” “…!” “…You’re not gonna tell me. But that’s a good sign.” Celia considered this to be good enough, and gave another bow to Iris and Faust before leaving the room. She ran back to hers, invigorated by the ideas she received. I got this, Celia thought to herself before closing the door. “…Did you know about that, Iris?” “No, I didn’t. I’m glad she’s making friends, though. Even if i’m unsure who they are.” “We shall see in time. After all,” “Faust knows all outcomes. Agreed.”
Chili 9/20/2023 11:11 PM
That's everything. I think. Not being frivolous whenever they reached rest stops paid off, as Sinclair had a decent stash of Ahn saved up. As long as everything was not upcharged beyond reason, he'll likely be able to buy a few books and take Celia somewhere nice to eat. That was the plan, at least. Sinclair wished he had a bed. Unfortunately, the only furniture in his room, besides the side rooms that seemed to manifest when he needed a change of clothes or a shower, was the chair. It didn't even move, it's like it was fused into the ground. And so, he sat down and closed his eyes, sleeping as comfortably as he could in the split of his room.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 11:20 PM
As Celia entered her room, she ran to the library to gather her items. She left them laid on top of the piano, and shed her mask, taking in the air. It's still so bright... The gem hadn't stopped glowing. The room seemed to still be filled with that beautiful sunlight, the lily pads on the shallow water blooming with lotuses. Celia's heart was fleeting with such joy -- it was rare, and so pleasant. She stepped on the platform and kneeled down. As if on command, it turned and lifted her up the tree once more. "Convenient," she murmured to herself. Celia walked to her room, staring past the waterfall. In the distance, she could see a shadow. Tall, lanky, and familiar. is that.... You're back? What, to wish me well and remind me? Remind you... of what? No, it can't be this. I don't want to see it again. She blinked and the figure was gone. Celia sighed. She had a big day tomorrow, and needed to get as much rest as possible. Turning to the small cat plush she always kept on her bed, she hugged it tight as she crawled in and tried her hardest to sleep.
Chili 9/20/2023 11:29 PM
Sinclair was uncomfortable. He was every night. But after sleeping comfortably last night, he suddenly wished to never sleep upright again. Maybe if I... Sinclair closed his eyes and tried with all his might to imagine a bed. A soft, plush bed smack dab in the center of his room. ... And when he opened his eyes... Nothing. He let out a groan. The fathoms of his E.G.O didn't have room for a bed? Seriously? Resigned, he tries to sit in a somewhat comfortable position, and fall asleep proper.
shit gets real 9/20/2023 11:36 PM
As she repressed the shadow's appearance, and who it reminded her of, Celia eventually drifted into a dream. And for once, this dream wasn't unpleasant. She was floating in the clouds, sitting on the moon and watching the carnage below. She was with... someone special. Although she never looked their way, the feeling she got when their hands got close enough left Celia feeling at peace. And just before she could leap off the moon into the sea of despair below, Celia woke up in a cold sweat. Was it... early enough to get up? In front of her was a mirror, showing her childhood self. When she looked at it, she grabbed the doll as quickly as possible. Mirai, it's too early, isn't it? This time, the doll didn't answer. ...It has to be, I'll just go back to sleep. Celia buried her face in the sheets, once again tying to sleep. Her stomach churned, but eventually the sheer heaviness of her eyes lead her back into a new dream.
Chili 9/21/2023 12:22 AM
Sinclair's dreams were relatively... boring. Which is something that is appreciated given his typical dreams. Every so often he'd wake up in the midst of the night, hearing footsteps in the hall, or the chattering of two sinners who were up far later than they should be. Every time, he'd take a long look at the ceiling. Because just maybe... it would be his own. Am I... cruel? Heartless? To still want that? Even now?
shit gets real 9/21/2023 10:05 AM
Finally having a good rest, Celia woke up and nearly hit her head on her wall from how quickly she sat up. This isn’t my home… will I never wake up to it again…? Of course I won’t. How do I even remember it? Do I …? Swallowing the discomfort, Celia tried her best to keep her mind steady. Shoving uncomfortable feelings into the depths of her mind — much like the vastness of this castle — felt easier. The routine was easy. Stretch, rub the eyes, float down the tree, and prepare. Right as she landed at the bottom of the tree, she heard a knock on her door. Covering her face with her hair, she guessed who was knocking. It’s Iris. And correct she was, as her dear seonbae was at the door - finally not seen with Faust - holding Chevalier next to her. Instead of her uniform, she wore a simple blouse with a blue bow, and a long navy skirt. Celia nodded a ‘good morning.’ “Morning, I’m just making sure you’re awake. Do you need my help at all?” “…” “Alright. Dress like you’re not at work, Verg told us it’d be fine considering we’re not intending to do much than to stay at the Terminal while Mephistopheles gets a check-up.” “…!” “Mm. I’ll see you.” And with that, Celia closed the door, fixed her hair, and walked to where she left everything out to get ready for the day. I wish… I could look as pretty as Iris.
Chili 9/21/2023 10:33 AM
Sinclair woke up as stiff as always, stretching the drowsiness out of his bones. Still not there… He had things to care of today anyway, not like there’s time to dwell on it. He fixed his hair, found his clothes, and gathered his Ahn. Hopefully, whatever planning he did would be enough to have the day run smoothly. He pushed his glasses onto his face, and went to his seat in the bus.
shit gets real 9/21/2023 10:48 AM
She seemed to just stare at her clothes, putting her hands on her cheeks in thought. Never in her life did she ever have to go through such menial, but such massive debates in her head. Is this… nice enough? Will he like it? Ah, he’ll like it either way. It’s Sinclair, he… loves me. She reassured herself and quietly changed, soon walking into the library to make sure everything was right. Something’s missing… She remembered a small headband she received as a gift during her first days working for Limbus Company. Perhaps as a ‘congrats for waking up,’ or just for landing a job despite her injuries and amnesia. It was a small white headband fashioned like a flower crown - Celia put it in her hair, then put on the mask right after. Grabbing Recital and her wallet right after, she quietly walked to her seat on the bus, giving a brief glance to Sinclair. Thankfully, she wasn’t one of the last ones.
Chili 9/21/2023 10:53 AM
Sinclair was a bit surprised for a few reasons. Celia looked amazing, so much so that he already felt his heart beat fast, and he just wanted to pull her into his arms. However… she was bringing her weapon. Sinclair had left Vogel in his room. Were weapons really necessary for this stop?
shit gets real 9/21/2023 10:59 AM
It was merely following Iris’ lead — who always kept Chevalier by her side, just in case. After all, better safe than sorry. She crossed her legs, watching as the last few people filed in. As expected, the people nearest to her were last. “What an adorable get-up, Celia,” Sei complimented kindly. For once, her words weren’t laden with a disdainful venom. “Thanks,” she replied softly. Ishmael gave a passing glance and a nod, making her way past Meursault and bundling her hair in her arms. As Holden passed, he tapped Celia’s shoulder. Pretending he didn’t, when she glared at him all he did was chuckle and wink back at her. How annoying….. Rodya was the last. She looked to multiple people, but her gaze fixated on Sinclair for a bit longer. Cute glasses! she thought, before making her way to her seat. Celia’s stomach churned. “Can we go already? I’m starting to get tired of this bus again,” complained Sei while side-eyeing Heathcliff. “Quiet, Princess, we just got here,” Holden barked back. “…How long will it be?” Celia asked. Iris replied, “About an hour.” Hm. Not bad. (edited)
Chili 9/21/2023 11:03 AM
The bus ride wouldn’t be terribly long, and it might even be more comfortable than usual given that they weren’t in uniform. Everyone seemed excited to be out and about, although it only added to the butterflies in Sinclair’s stomach. It’s just a simple outing… you won’t mess it up… I really hope I don’t mess it up…
shit gets real 9/21/2023 11:13 AM
Celia listened to the conversations of the others near her on the bus. She was seated near the noisiest corner, so it meant every day was different and just as entertaining as the one before. She listened to a debate today. A debate about how deep a pan had to be before it became a pot. Celia couldn’t really figure out her stance, but listening to the passion of her coworkers was enough to pass the hour by. Holden was particularly passionate. Every word Heathcliff tried to get in, Ishmael and Sei would snuff it out and bring up their “totally correct” points. Faust tried to be factual before being mocked into quietness, and Hong Lu tried feigning indifference. Even Iris had a few good points, but she couldn’t defend them well enough as soon as Holden tried to cut in with a “Nuh-uh!” Ryoshu seemed to just want to listen in as well, occasionally glancing at Celia to see how she was reacting. Eventually, with no side ever agreeing, the bus came to the terminal. It was half-worn down, half newly renovated. Faust was giving a lengthy explanation on the one they were pulling into, but no one cared to listen — not like they wouldn’t figure it all out in a few minutes, either way. Right as the bus stopped, Vergilius ordered the sinners off. Celia stayed behind as those before her got up and left first. Celia stood up, taking Recital, then quietly walked off the bus. That was… eventful. (edited)
Chili 9/21/2023 11:56 AM
Sinclair brushed himself off before joining the rest of the Sinners off the bus. As he stepped off he took a deep breath of the fresh air, eager to enjoy it for as long as he had the chance. He could hear some Sinners that were still mumbling, evidently bitter over some sort of argument. Not that he had any idea what it was. He waited alongside his coworkers until they were formally dismissed, and permitted to wander about the Terminal. (edited)
shit gets real 9/21/2023 12:05 PM
Celia subtly made her way until she was standing next to Sinclair, looking around. Lots of different things, including maps and guides and dozens of small stores. “…” Vergilius seemed to be speaking with someone, Faust standing by his side. Iris was a few feet behind — she was always near Faust, only separating for moments at a time. “…Alright, you all are dismissed. We’ll call for you when it’s time. Any of you who brought weapons, put them on the wall over there.” As instructed, Celia dropped Recital where designated. She saw a few other weapons placed there as well, making her feel relieved it wasn’t just her or Iris bringing weapons. Chevalier, Hearse, 鏡花水月, Walpurgisnacht, 太虛幻境, РАСКО́Л. Ryoshu seemed unwilling to put her weapon away, but no protest was made. Celia returned to her spot. “Go, handle yourselves,” Vergilius said while waving. Almost instantly, different groups split off and went their own ways. Celia stood there for a few moments, gazing at Rodya, before turning to Sinclair. Suddenly, she forgot her plan.
Chili 9/21/2023 12:14 PM
Sinclair was somewhat abashed, and with his glasses on he could see her outfit perfectly. It was all so cute… “W-well um, Celia. How about we look around for a book store..?” It hadn’t dawned on him till now, how hard it would be to make it through the day with her, without being reduced to a red and bumbling mess.
shit gets real 9/21/2023 12:21 PM
“O-Oh, right, yes.” She approached a holographic screen with a map of the entire terminal, including the off-limit areas. “Hm…” She quickly grabbed a map too, just to shove into her pocket in case they got lost. “Ah, right here. The upper floor.” Her finger gravitated to a small icon with a book on it. “…should only take a couple of minutes to walk there.” Shyly, she extended a hand for Sinclair to hold.
Chili 9/21/2023 12:32 PM
With a brief blush, Sinclair takes her hand in his. He would take off his gloves had they been away from the prying eyes of other sinners, but for the time being this was fine. “Lead the way.” He smiled warmly at her.
shit gets real 9/21/2023 12:35 PM
When he looked at her, her stomach filled with butterflies. At this rate, she wouldn’t be able to eat with how much he was making her uneasy. Celia walked alongside Sinclair, head bowed to the ground as she carefully navigated the terminal. Occasional doors were boarded up, or stores had iron bars locking them away, but most of it was sleek and new. How odd, Celia thought. Eventually, she stood in front of the bookstore, looking over to Sinclair. “This should be it…”
Chili 9/21/2023 12:42 PM
Sinclair found it peculiar how some stores appeared to be closed. Was it too early for them to open up shop? Sinclair gave an affirmation to Celia before heading in with her. The sheer size of their stock was enough to have Sinclair’s head spin. It’d probably be easier to list the books they didn’t have.
shit gets real 9/21/2023 12:46 PM
Despite having her mask on, Celia visibly lit up in wonder. “Woah… the shelves are almost endless here.” She hugged Sinclair’s arm in excitement, letting out a childlike gasp. “Ah, there’s so many things I could get—“ Right, a gift is one of them. When realizing she had a bit of an outburst, Celia adjusted her mask sheepishly and stifled a small laugh. How embarrassing…
Chili 9/21/2023 1:12 PM
Cute! She's way too cute! "Ah... um... how about we split up for now then? There's so many books, and it'd help us save time if we individually went looking." Sinclair partially meant what he said, but he also didn't want her to see him buying books on the piano, as it would be far too embarassing.
shit gets real 9/21/2023 1:15 PM
“Mm, okay. I’ll see you, then.” She scanned their surroundings quickly, making sure the coast was clear. After confirming no one was nearby, Celia moved her mask slightly to plant a small kiss on Sinclair’s cheek. Then, she let go of him and put her mask on before dashing off. There was so much to explore, so many opportunities of books she could buy — history, art, literature, even books about other people. Celia’s mission begins.
Chili 9/21/2023 1:38 PM
Sinclair was left dumbfounded in the middle of the store, and felt like his heart might beat out of his chest. When he finally felt was able to calm down, he began to browse the shelves. His first priority was finding a book on the piano. While he didn't have one to practice with, reading might be able to refresh his memories on when he did play. However, he found some interest in picking up other books. Cooking was one that came to mind. It seemed handy, and as of late he had developed an interest, among other things.
shit gets real 9/21/2023 1:58 PM
She scanned all of the shelves, debating what topics she wanted to pick up. Maybe Celia could pick up better cooking skills so she could do better when helping Meursault. Or maybe… ah, books on relationships? Wouldn’t that be obvious? She scanned the titles - I need something subtle, Celia thought. She took one, slipping it between two other books. Perfect. She smiled as she walked to other shelves. Another book on piano, a novel she remembered Iris recommending, a Color Fixer’s biography. She had about 5 books now, varying in size. This is enough. Now… a gift.
Chili 9/21/2023 2:42 PM
Sinclair was pretty sure he had enough in terms of books, now all that's left was to wait for Celia. Hmm... Sinclair got an idea, albeit one he wouldn't be able to bring to fruition till later today. He stood by, holding his books.
shit gets real 9/21/2023 3:04 PM
She needed a few more minutes. As she passed by other things that weren’t just books anymore, Celia’s face lit up. She grabbed a few more things— notebooks, pencils, pens, etc. Then, her eyes were set on a small machine. Put something personal, receive an unforgettable trade, she read the etching on the top of the glass box. “…” Celia thought about what she’d sacrifice. She took the stopwatch in her pocket, placing it into the machine. It whirred gently, seemingly crushing the stopwatch in the darkness of its depths. The item that came out… amazed Celia. How did it… She took it, grabbing some newspaper to wrap it up. It’s cute… he’ll love it. Celia soon made her way over to Sinclair. “Okay. all done.”
Chili 9/21/2023 3:17 PM
"Ah. Perfect... lets pay and see what's next then." Sinclair ushered her towards the checkout, attempting to pay for both his and her items. He rifled through his pockets, before placing the Ahn on the counter.
shit gets real 9/21/2023 3:22 PM
As she watched him place the Ahn down, she put her hand out. “Ah? Sinclair, I have money, I can pay for my own items—“ The worker, whose face seemed to be obscured with a translucent face shield, laughed at their interaction. Taking the money, Celia could no longer protest. She placed the wrapped item on the counter. “Separate this from the main bill, then.” “On it.” Handing the change back, they then scanned the gift Celia had and took the Ahn she held tightly in her fist. Give a nod, receive a nod. They then placed it in her hands, and she quickly concealed it. Mm… how nice that was, she thought to herself.
Chili 9/21/2023 3:25 PM
Sinclair gave her a small nod. "Just consider it a gift then." Sinclair was feeling a bit more comfortable around her, and was willing to come out of his shell a little for her. "Is there some other stores you want to visit, Celia?"
shit gets real 9/21/2023 3:31 PM
“Ah…” She took her items from the counter, really taking a moment to think. Celia really had to think about it. “…Are there…? Oh, right. There is.” Celia could feel her cheeks getting warm again as she held the bag of books close to her. “Uhm… don’t make fun of me, but there’s a candy store I remember Sei told me about. C—could we go there? They also have candles, I wanted to buy one or two of them.” The request was made with the softest voice, Celia obviously being embarrassed to ask.
Chili 9/21/2023 3:51 PM
"Of course! L-lets go!" Sinclair grabbed her hand again, and smiled sheepishly. "I-I take it you know the way..?" Just stay cool Sinclair… you’ll be fine.
shit gets real 9/21/2023 4:01 PM
“I can figure it out.” Which was a smoother way of saying, I have zero clue besides verbal directions I was given. Interlocking their fingers, Celia walked forward and lead the way. Although she didn’t entirely know where she was going, something in her kept giving her clues. Following a trail of pink, a smear of cyan, a gray pair of wings and a smoky haze of red. Passing an orange blur, storming along a violet cloud. Glancing at a pink rose, bathing in a blue halo’s glory. Eventually, her almost aimless steps got her to where she needed to go. “In here!” She said, having another moment of childlike joy.
Chili 9/21/2023 5:28 PM
Sinclair couldn’t help but laugh and smile when he was with her. He thought the sun and the moon of her, and there wasn’t a reason for him to think otherwise. “Mm… Celia, I’ve just got to stop at a nearby store to grab something for Yi Sang… can I leave you to shop alone for a few minutes?”
shit gets real 9/21/2023 5:33 PM
“Mhm. I’ll make sure not to wander off, but…” She figured out how she wanted to say this, almost a bit unwilling to separate from him. The words seemed to come naturally, though. “…Come back soon, okay?” And with that, she let go of his hand and excitedly walked into the store. Ah… I don’t know what I want, there’s so much I could get…
Chili 9/21/2023 5:42 PM
“I promise.” Sinclair saw her off into the store before heading his own way. I feel bad… but it’ll be worth it. Sinclair could only cross his fingers that she would like it as much as he thinks she would.
shit gets real 9/21/2023 5:51 PM
Sometimes, Celia feels bad that she regards her seonbaes so highly. Taking all of their advice, letting them guide her so much — it was because of one of them that she’s now here, splurging on so many new things for herself. Her trail gravitated towards the candles first. A wall of scents ranging from ‘Rainy Musk’ to ‘Fresh Spring Day,’ there were even more weird scents that matched some of the candy and sweets in-store. Eventually, Celia just blind-picked one. “Mint Tea…? Hm.” Then, she decided that some candy wouldn’t hurt. ‘Some’ then became ‘a lot,’ and now Celia was paying for two bags of candy for her to possibly share with anyone who asked. She knew she couldn’t eat it all herself. When she checked out, she avoided making any eye contact. Was it out of shame? Possibly. Not that she’d be judged, but perhaps this was just Celia trying to make up for lost time. With items in tow, she sat on a bench to wait for Sinclair. In the meantime… hmm, let’s try some of this.
Chili 9/21/2023 6:10 PM

He evidently had been running in order to minimize the time spent separate from Celia. “S-sorry… I’m back… a-anything else you want to do?” Sinclair couldn’t help but smile in her presence, as if it was a compulsion.
shit gets real 9/21/2023 6:14 PM
When he came back, all he could see was Celia staring blankly, a pink sour belt slowly rising behind her mask. She was eating. How cute. “Mmhh… non. All good. You?” She was carrying everything in her larger bag, but kept one of the smaller bags of candy in her hand. It was nearly empty.
Chili 9/21/2023 6:40 PM

shit gets real 9/21/2023 6:43 PM
“Mmh… sorry.” She said, clearly getting embarrassed. Putting the bag away, Celia stood and stretched. She could never really turn down a chance to spend time with Sinclair, so the proposal was met with a nod. “We can do that.” Celia extended her hand again for Sinclair to hold, almost doing a grabby-motion towards him.
Chili 9/21/2023 7:10 PM

shit gets real 9/21/2023 7:17 PM

Before they started walking, though, she tried her hardest to get a compliment in. "Oh, uhm.... Sinclair, you..." She choked up on her wordsd for a moment. It's not that hard to say, just tell him, "You look cute in those glasses."
Chili 9/21/2023 7:37 PM

shit gets real 9/21/2023 7:41 PM
Celia's heart seemed to skip a beat the moment Sinclair's face got red. He's so adorable, she thought to herself. The rush of good feelings made her burst into a joyful giggle, holding his hand tightly and hugging his arm just like she did when they first entered the bookstore. "But I think it's true," Celia justified to herself. "I think you look very cute."
Chili 9/21/2023 7:59 PM
Sinclair was worried that he might ruin the evening by having a heart attack at the rate that his heart was beating. “I-I…” Sinclair couldn’t find words, so with an awkward smile he just started walking with her, hand in hand. If you’re getting worked up now, you’ll never work up the nerve later! Calm down!
shit gets real 9/21/2023 8:06 PM
Celia tried matching his pace, occasionally lifting her foot a little higher to step forward. It was for a moment that she forgot everything; she forgot her restless night, the fact they were technically at work, that everything and everyone else existed. She even forgot that no one knew about the feelings they had for each other, and how strong they were. Would she have cared if they found out? Not really -- her worry lied in the reaction. Would Rodya freak out, would Iris be worried, would Sei make fun of such an innocent love, would she be admonished for a feeling she couldn't control? But for now, Celia was just focused on the beating of her heart. The hand in hers, the blushing red face that hand belonged to, and the one she gave her heart to. For now, Celia wasn't quite 'Celia,' but the 'Alice' she kept locked away.
Chili 9/21/2023 8:50 PM
Everything felt so much more vibrant with her next to him. The colors seemed to bounce off the walls, the vegetation that danced in the wind, the sound of her laughter filling the air, the warmth of her hand in his. Even this idle affair of meandering through the terminal to work up an appetite felt like so much more. Sinclair felt like a weight he had never known he was carrying was off his shoulders.
shit gets real 9/21/2023 8:54 PM
In her idle thought, Celia began humming to herself and letting her mind wander. For once, it was like she had no issue thinking and imagining things. Everything in the city she wanted to do with Sinclair -- because, for now, they had no worry about their lives being limited. In a sense, Celia would get a small amount of joy from even dying by his side. The tune she hummed was one she somehow remembered, but never really knew why. It just brought her a certain amount of comfort, and helped her mind stay clear. Clear of anything bad, but especially how nervous she felt being next to Sinclair right now.
Chili 9/21/2023 9:20 PM
Sinclair had no idea how long they were walking, he had lost track of the time. Eventually he started feeling hungry, and popped the question. “Ready to eat yet?”
shit gets real 9/21/2023 9:22 PM
That question snapepd her out of her trance. Celia turned back to Sinclair, holding his hand just a bit tighter, as if scared to let him go. "Ah... yeah, I'm ready. I have more of an appetite." How much time passed...? I hope we aren't running out of it. I don't want to let go yet.
Chili 9/21/2023 9:25 PM
The strength of her grip was surprising, it almost hurt. “Hmm… is there anything you want to eat particularly?” I think I saw the perfect spot for later while we were walking around…
shit gets real 9/21/2023 9:28 PM

Leaving the choice in his hands was deliberate - she was curious what he'd pick out for her, considering Sinclair was taking more of the lead this time. Celia didn't really care about what they'd have either way.
Chili 9/21/2023 9:39 PM

With the varied tastes and budgets of all the different Sinners, the likelihood he would run into at least one no matter where they went was a bit too high for his liking. What’s the worst that could happen… right? “I think I saw a good spot then. A-although if you don’t mind… I just want to take a precaution.” Sinclair wore his gloves just in case what he feared happened, and took her hand in hand once again, leading her to a restaurant he saw while they sauntered about.
shit gets real 9/21/2023 9:42 PM
Celia almost got visibly saddened from Sinclair putting his gloves on again, but she nodded in understanding. "Mm, I trust you." Those words hold a rather deep meaning. Her trust in him was deep-rooted by now, only growing more as they got closer. She only had a trust like that in one other sinner, but it was seldom brought up. She seemed happy that he didn't get too anxious at just letting him choose where they'll eat.
Chili 9/21/2023 10:11 PM

shit gets real 9/21/2023 10:14 PM

Chili 9/21/2023 10:29 PM

shit gets real 9/21/2023 10:36 PM
Fortunately, despite Celia's mask, no one's given her a hard time about it. Even when they were being guided to their seats, no comment or looks were given by any employees. Perhaps she's no longer that eccentric, which was good to her. Ah, a booth... mmmm... As a young girl, she could vaguely remember seeing couples on the same sides of the booth, sitting next to each other to hold hands. Celia wanted to be the same - but she was also somewhat worried about someone walking in and seeing that, then making questions. In the end, she'd let Sinclair make the call. Celia sat on one side of the booth, placing her bags by her feet and minimizing her presence.
Chili 9/21/2023 10:49 PM

shit gets real 9/22/2023 12:06 AM

shit gets real 9/22/2023 12:48 AM

shit gets real 9/22/2023 1:58 AM

She ate in a delicate manner, trying to savor the meal. Most of her mind was on Sinclair, though, even if she was actively eating. Celia struggled to keep him out of her mind.
Chili 9/22/2023 2:11 AM

Chili 9/22/2023 2:23 AM
