shit gets real 9/22/2023 2:30 AM
“Mm.” Celia just kept eating, but between bites she occasionally would smile to herself. She thought about what he could take her to, what he thought she’d like. Does Sinclair really think about me that much…? The thought of it alone made her want to squirm in excitement. She’s clearing through her food fairly quickly. Celia’s used to eating fast, from slim dinnertimes and getting her portions in — or just wanting to get back to her usual activities.
Chili 9/22/2023 2:50 AM
Sinclair was a little slower than her, in part due to him always being told to pace himself while eating, and in part due to him not wanting to embarrass himself. When he finally finished, he was rather satisfied, which was nice given the one thing he had consumed in the past two days was the stew Rodya prepared. “How was your food?”
shit gets real 9/22/2023 2:53 AM
“Mm? Ah. Delicious… i’ll miss this for a while.” She pushed her clean plate to the side, then picked up the cookie. Celia was a little embarrassed with how much sweet stuff she was eating, but how else will she fully enjoy the sweet feelings going through her mind? The cookie was picked up, and delicately split in half. Celia got a small napkin for hers, pushing the other half towards Sinclair. “…For you.”
Chili 9/22/2023 3:07 AM
“M-me? O-oh!” Sinclair was joyful at the gesture, and was more than happy to bite into his half of the cookie. It had been a while since he got to enjoy a sweet like this, so he took his time with it.
shit gets real 9/22/2023 3:11 AM
Victory. She carefully bit into the cookie, one side at a time. If anyone else were with her, they’d probably point out the oddness of her habit. However, Celia liked doing it this way. It was rather cute, like watching a bunny eat.
Chili 9/22/2023 3:36 AM
It was interesting for Sinclair to keep track of her peculiarities. Of course, everyone had their own distinct ways and habits, but never had he paid attention so closely to them than now. “It tastes good… I like it.”
shit gets real 9/22/2023 3:39 AM
“Good. Consider it a smaller gift.” Again, she was quick to eat, and finally was completely full. This would likely keep her fed for the next few days. At least, between this and the leftover candy. Right on time, the waiter had walked by their table and dropped the bill by the edge. Celia’s eyes scanned to see if Sinclair could take it, and she could propose to handle it this time. Something to treat him…
Chili 9/22/2023 10:40 AM
Sinclair was already running his hands through his pockets the moment they were presented with the bill. …Wallet feeling a lot lighter now. He put the money on the table before standing up. “Just gonna wash my hands… be back in a moment.”
shit gets real 9/22/2023 10:43 AM
Celia furrowed her brow. “Take your time.” As he left, she pulled out her own wallet. A lot of money was still leftover, she had scraps from when she first joined — it was perks of growing up rather wealthy, with whatever family was left to support you. For her, it was just a few aunts and uncles by now. Quietly, she swapped their money out and left a bit of a larger tip. Celia dipped her head low as if to not get caught, but laid Sinclair’s Ahn right where he was sitting. …I hope he doesn’t get mad over this. Celia raised a hand to alert the waiter. And just as quick as they put the bill down, they took it right up. She felt an urge to lament their career’s pitfalls, but it wasn’t entirely in her place to. “…” Celia put the other half of her mask on, sliding it into place.
Chili 9/22/2023 10:51 AM
Sinclair felt painfully tense, I just hope she doesn’t take it the wrong way… Sinclair almost started washing his hands with his gloves on. Deep breaths. You’ll be fine. The soap had a nice smell. He couldn’t decipher what it was, but it was pleasant. Before Sinclair left the bathroom, he looked in the mirror to ensure his hair wasn’t out of place. Gotta look my best for later… When Sinclair emerged, he made his way back to Celia. “Ready to go?”
shit gets real 9/22/2023 10:53 AM
“Ah?… yeah, I am. Uhm…” She gently placed her fingers on top of the small pile of Ahn she left. “I handled the bill. I had extra saved up, I wanted you to save it.” She then quietly gathered her things, slowly exiting her seat. He’s so cute. I’m lucky that I got along with him of all people…
Chili 9/22/2023 10:58 AM
“You didn’t have to do that… but thank you.” Sinclair was a little disappointed. He had been hoping to take it upon himself to finance this outing. He gathered his Ahn, stuffing it back into his pockets. “Hmm… getting late. Let’s hurry then, I’ve got something I want to show you.”
shit gets real 9/22/2023 11:01 AM
She wanted to be even, someone important to her always told her about how sometimes it’s better to split everything evenly in a relationship. Relation….ship. Was that what they called it? Is that what this is? Celia didn’t exactly know, but it felt like the right descriptor for this. Ever since Sinclair had confessed, and she knew in her heart she felt the same way, that felt like the right description — not like she knew anything else, either way. Nevertheless, she was head over heels for Sinclair. And that proved true right as she was quickly taking his hand again to walk beside him. “Mm. Ready.” (edited)
Chili 9/22/2023 11:11 AM
“Y-yeah.” She’s so precious… Sinclair had seen just the spot earlier. It was a little terrace, carved into the side of the Terminal. A few beds of flowers were there, which made it a somewhat scenic locale.
shit gets real 9/22/2023 11:17 AM
As they got closer to it, Celia only seemed to light up more. It was cute, romantic… I wonder who taught Sinclair all of this. For a moment, she forgot they were in public, but she kept her composure. “…” It’s hard for Celia to contain her wonder right now.
Chili 9/22/2023 11:33 AM
“You’re welcome to rest wherever… it’s already so late… I can’t believe time went so fast…” Sinclair ran his hands through the bag he bought, fumbling with something inside. “There’s something I want to show you… whenever you’re ready.” (edited)
shit gets real 9/22/2023 11:39 AM
Putting her bags down, Celia sat atop a small bench, adjusting the sleeves of her sweater nervously. Time did go fast, but there was a saying for it — something like, ‘time flies fast when you’re having fun.’ And surely, these two were having a lot of fun. “Ah, uh… okay. I think I’m ready.” She tapped her fingers together to keep herself busy, suddenly feeling even more nervous than before. What … did he get her?
Chili 9/22/2023 11:45 AM
From the bag, Sinclair produced a camera. “I saw those photos in your room… and I know it won’t replace what you’ve already lost, but I think it would be nice to make new memories.” Sinclair felt his face heat up. “Celia… would you like to take a photo with me… so we don’t forget this moment? No matter what?”
shit gets real 9/22/2023 11:49 AM
If her mask weren’t on, her entire face would be red right now. She could barely speak, just holding her face in her hands. “Ah- I- Sinclair…” This meant so much more to her than she could ever say to him. “Y-yes, but I also have something to show you after this.”
Chili 9/22/2023 11:53 AM
“A-alright… just give me a few moments.” Thankfully, the camera came with a stand, which Sinclair spent some time fumbling with. It took a few minutes but he managed to get it to stand with the camera, and loaded the film into it. “Let me see… a ten second delay… should be fine.” After he set the camera, he quickly ran next to Celia. (edited)
shit gets real 9/22/2023 12:00 PM
In the ten seconds, Celia took off her mask — in this moment, it’d be fine. She can put it back on right after. Celia looked over at Sinclair, then starting to smile naturally. Thoughts in her mind rang about where she wanted to put the photo, how happy she was, and wishing the moment would last forever. “…” All she could do now, was smile like she never has before.
Chili 9/22/2023 12:09 PM
When ten seconds finished, a clicking noise from the camera filled the air. There was a brief whirring, before it printed out a photo. The sight of it was enough to make Sinclair’s heart melt. Celia was truly happy, and her smile had been preserved through this photo. “Here… keep it with you.” Sinclair handed off the photo to her, and began to stow away the camera. “I hope we’ll get the chance to do something like this again…”
shit gets real 9/22/2023 12:16 PM
Putting her mask back on, she took the photo and shook it in joy. “I’m gonna put this up in my room… thank you…!” Celia tucked the photo away in a safe spot, then went through her bags to find the small paper-wrapped gift she bought. “Okay, be really careful when opening this… I found something in the bookstore that offered me a trade, so this is worth a lot.” Cupped in her hands, it was held out for him to take.
Chili 9/22/2023 12:19 PM
“Ah? Oh… I feel a bit guilty you’d get something so costly…” Sinclair gently retrieved it from her hands, and carefully unwrapped it
shit gets real 9/22/2023 12:23 PM
“It’s okay — the actual monetary cost wasn’t much. I gave up my pocket watch for this…” Inside the paper was a small, delicately crafted statuette of a precious moment between the two — in Celia’s room, playing the piano together. It was as if it were taken from Celia’s memory itself, put into a smaller form. The tree was accurate, their items on the piano, their nervous and overjoyed expressions. The first moment they really connected, immortalized forever. “…I don’t know how it did this, but… I think it’s worth the sacrifice, to keep that memory forever.” Celia put her hands behind her back, anticipating Sinclair’s reaction.
Chili 9/22/2023 12:29 PM
Sinclair trembled a little as he held it. “I… how could you give up something so precious to yourself though? I…are you sure I can have this? It’s beautiful…” Sinclair delicately put it in his bag, before wrapping his arms around her in a tight embrace. His voice didn’t carry very far, but that’s alright, he only wanted her to hear it. “I love you…” She already knew that though.
shit gets real 9/22/2023 12:37 PM
“I—it’s yours, I promise.” She hugged Sinclair back just as tight, nuzzling into his cheek for a moment. … He said it. Even if she knew, it was that much sweeter when he said it. Celia’s voice was weak, quiet, but she gave a response. “I love you, too.” Right as she finished, she looked up and saw a blue blur drenched in blood, briefly approaching. It stopped, looked back, and stood for a moment. When Celia’s eyesight cleared… It’s Iris. Oh no… it’s Iris. I didn’t want this to end yet… Iris smiled, turning around and walking away. She knew better than to interrupt such a sweet moment. “Ah.. Sinclair.. I think we should get going now.” She hoped he didn’t notice anything, although his back was turned to what Celia saw.
Chili 9/22/2023 12:51 PM
“R-right.” Sinclair released her from his embrace, his blush still painted over his cheeks. Today would be unforgettable, that’s for certain.
shit gets real 9/22/2023 12:56 PM
She picked up her things, heart pounding fast from … well, a first date. “I’ll run ahead so they don’t get suspicious,” she said. Part of Celia was also curious about what she saw of Iris. When she was ready, she half-dashed to where she expected the other sinners to be. A couple of them were drenched in blood, mostly those who brought their weapons — it seems those who did, but were unscathed, weren’t there for whatever happened. Did I … miss something? Celia picked up Recital, putting the strap of it over her chest. She looked at Iris, who seemed unbothered by what she saw and the fact she was covered in something’s viscera. She glanced at the girl, gave a nod and a wink, then turned back to Faust. Celia looked back briefly to make sure Sinclair was still there. (edited)
Chili 9/22/2023 12:57 PM
Sinclair was flabbergasted, and picked up the pace to approach the blood soaked Sinners. “A-are you guys alright? What happened?” A fight? Here on the Terminal? And I thought everyone left their weapons behind. (edited)
shit gets real 9/22/2023 1:03 PM
Ishmael was the first one to answer, head hung low. “Someone got too close to the more worn down parts of this place, and lured out some abnormalities. Next thing you know, half of the west side was swarming with them, and we had to fight them off.” We were on the east, Celia recounted to herself. “How was I supposed to know there were abnormalities? I thought this place was safe,” Rodya groaned. “At least the kiddos are fine…” Dante seemed to be avoiding any comments, simply keeping their head directed towards Vergilius. “We’ll be fine, we can wash off on the bus. If anyone needs, the pools in my room are open,” Iris offered to the others, holding her skirt in one hand. Celia’s stomach churned. She was suddenly forced back into the reality of her job, and in the most uncomfortable way. (edited)
Chili 9/22/2023 1:13 PM
Sinclair sighed. Couldn’t be helped… you’ll probably have ended wearing that ID again… “Oh.. sorry we couldn’t be of any help…”
shit gets real 9/22/2023 1:17 PM
“Don’t worry about it. We were making sure the rest of you had a good time,” Iris reassured. Celia admired how kind and professional she was. They hailed from the same district, and Iris was formerly a well known fixer… Celia almost felt like she was working with a childhood hero now. If that’s the case, I guess I’m thankful. I won’t forget this. Faust looked back at Celia, then looking to Iris. Outis coughed. “Ahem. Quit dawdling and get back on the bus,” she ordered on behalf of Dante. Slowly, everyone filed back on, making their way back to their seats. “Is our break… now?” Celia asked. All she received was a nod. Perhaps they received good graces for the trouble of fighting off all those abnormalities. I guess I’ll have to clean up and put my things away…
Chili 9/22/2023 1:34 PM
Sinclair made his way back on the bus and to his room. As empty as always… He didn’t really have a shelf, and the space that appeared when he needed clothes didn’t have much room besides that, nor did he want to risk anything. He gently put the bag in the corner of the brighter half of the room, and placed the statuette nearby. Sinclair was glad that at the very least, the limited control he had over his room could make a restroom. Although before he stepped into the shower, he considered what Iris had said, and was somewhat curious as to what it could look like, and being able to wash off at the same time would be nice. It was an open invitation… Sinclair made his way down the hall to Iris’s room.
shit gets real 9/22/2023 1:45 PM
The door opened slowly, and Iris was behind peeking at whoever was knocking. “Sinclair. Come in,” she said, opening the door wider. As it was before, Iris’ room was a blank void, filled with different pools of water surrounded by plants of varying cyan and lavender hues. Some swords were dangling from the endless ceiling, swaying in the delicate wind, while others were stabbed into the ground, oozing blood. In the center of the room was a cross and a bed of flowers, likely where Iris rested. “The further you walk, the more pools there are. Just be careful not to slip, okay?” She said, smiling down at him. Rodion and Ishmael were already bathing in a pool together, seemingly chatting and trying not to start an argument about who started the scuffle and who continued it. Sei appeared to just be sitting alone, basking in the sourceless light of the room. She seemed at peace for once. Before he left, though, Iris pulled Sinclair in. She was careful not to get any blood on him. “I apologize if this worries you, but I happened to walk in on you and Celia before you both returned… I promise, I won’t tell a soul. Be careful.” With that, she gave him a small pat on the shoulder, turning around to make sure no one was drowning or about to start anything. How kind. Celia chose to stay behind, but took a chance to put away her things and change into more comfortable wear. She sat on the bus and listened to scraps of chatter, mostly consisting of sharing plans and theorizing about what changed with Mephistopheles.
Chili 9/22/2023 2:07 PM
Sinclair was rather flustered when she suddenly alerted him of what they saw, but there was no point in fussing about it. At least he hoped there wasn't. He was looking for a pool away from most others, maybe just to close his eyes in and let the stress of the day break away. He wasn't precisely sure how to approach it, and he was definitely not asking anyone else for guidance, so instead he brought a few extra towels. He wrapped a towel around his lower half to cover himself, before slipping into the water.
shit gets real 9/22/2023 2:13 PM
Iris walked back to the cross, looking behind it. She arranged a few items, then looked towards the other pools. Her hospitality was something often criticized, but she considered it a humble task and part of her duty as a knight... she played that role so well, that even Don Quixote began looking up to her on how to be so noble. "Sei, are you faring well over there?" "Just fine. No need for you to worry.... thank you for your kindness, though." "Any day, my lady." "Hey! Why don't I get called 'fair lady' or something nice like that!?" Rodya called, clearly wanting to have some playful banter. Iris was simply smiling to herself. "I pay respects to noblewomen, former or current. If you'd like, though, I can do the same for you." "That'd be real nice," Rodya sighed. The chatter of the women made the normally still and peaceful room lively. In the distance, towards Sinclair, was Yi Sang. He was simply staring into the water, not needing to bathe, but just examining his reflection. Perhaps he was also enjoying the sights.
Chili 9/22/2023 2:36 PM
Internally Sinclair had to thank Yi Sang, as he had used him as a scapegoat to sneak off and buy the camera. It would be best to leave him undisturbed regardless. The temperature of the water was pleasant, and Sinclair found himself comfortable enough to close his eyes and soak.
shit gets real 9/22/2023 2:41 PM
Eventually, Iris was able to bathe herself. She didn't ever mind being coated in blood, but she wanted to sleep clean tonight -- in the case she was able to sleep. Eventually, Sei and Rodya left the room, cleaning up and drying themselves off. They joined the front of the bus, where things seemed neat and orderly. Celia and Meursault were reading one of her books, where he was re-formatting some of the information for her so she would easier understand it. Gregor was playing cards with Don Quixote, who was trying her hardest to hide the fact she had no idea what she was doing. Others were simply trying to keep to themselves, like Frankenstein being nose-deep in her notebook writing everything she did or saw of note today. Celia occasionally would look over to her and want to ask a question, but her fear of the much-older scientist kept her quiet. After a few minutes, Sei seemed to disappear into the kitchen. Things continued as normal.
Chili 9/22/2023 2:58 PM
When Sinclair was finally done, he hid in a corner to dry off and slip back into cleaner clothes. As he left, he gave a small smile of appreciation to Iris, both for allowing him to rest in her room, and for not telling anyone about him and Celia. It was a nice day today...
shit gets real 9/22/2023 3:10 PM
She waved back to Sinclair, soaking in the water of her room. She anticipated that no one else would need to enter, so once Ishmael and Yi Sang left, she'd finally be alone -- and able to talk to Faust again. Back on the bus, things simply... continued. By now, Rodya joined the card game, staring over Gregor's shoulder and trying to offer advice despite the fact he was clearly winning. Celia stopped reading, instead staring out the window and replaying the memories of today. I wonder when I'll be able to do that again... At least, she did that until a loud crash was heard in the kitchen. The entire bus fell silent -- their heads all turned, until the doors opened widely to an enraged Sei grabbing the empty wrapper of what was once her cake.

"One of you.... ate my cake. And if I find out WHO it was...--"

Three heads shot towards Heathcliff. He was an easy scapegoat, knowing how often he got into squabbles with Sei. Celia was hiding her guilt, remembering the alibi Rodya implanted into her; If anyone asks, blame Heathcliff. Sei noticed the direction everyone's heads turned. Heathcliff was now staring back... All Celia heard as she turned away was Sei climbing over the seat, her sleek black hair flying behind her in a frenzy. A fist was readied, another tried to block it, but she landed the punch either way. Suddenly, the tension seemed to burst. Rodya's shoulders went up in discomfort -- How could such a small thing land such a hit? Holden even looked shocked, holding Meursault's shoulder and trying to shield him from any impact. "Oi, woman, why'd you immediately come to me!?" "I know it was you, what other filthy, brutish pig on this forsaken bus has been UP MY ASS since I got here?" "Why, you... how--" "I don't want to hear it. You could've at least asked, you know! Did no one teach you manners in the backstreets?! Geez, did they teach you ANYTHING?" That seemed to be a bit too close to home for comfort. Heathcliff was already preparing to get out Revenge, Sei gripping the handle of her kodachi to unsheath and split it into two. If someone didn't act, Dante would have to rewind soon. Rodya looked to Celia to see if she had anything to do with it. Celia was almost frozen in anxiety, holding her mask tightly to her face.
Chili 9/22/2023 3:24 PM
Sinclair spilled into the kitchen, having barely made it to his room before the crashing from the kitchen started. He ran into the kitchen panting, clutching Vogel tightly, only to be relieved to see that there was no terrible monster that breached its way on the bus, and instead it was just his coworkers about to tear each other to shreds. S-shouldn't someone say something...? Vergilius will lay into us if he finds out that they killed each other over cake...
shit gets real 9/22/2023 3:31 PM
I really need to say something. Weapons were being picked up, people were trying to react, all wondering who'd alert someone else. Donqui even gazed at Dante, who was looking from the other side of the viewing window, fearing the worst. Eventually, Celia couldn't try and hold it in. "Sei!" Celia shouted -- it was fairly loud, enough to shock everyone in the room. "Celia...? What, do you know something?" "I... ah... I--It was me, I ate the cake." Rodya sighed. Gregor furrowed his brow, even Holden looked gobsmacked at Celia's admittance. Sei seemed to visibly calm down... but just for a moment. Her head lowered, and she dropped her weapon, pushing Heathcliff away from her. Then, in almost a flash of light, Sei nearly tackled Celia into the ground. She held the younger sinner by the neck, grip getting tighter and tighter. "A--I'm sorry, I just...--" "Sei, put her down! I'm sure she didn't mean it, and you know what's gonna happen if you hurt someone else," Rodya tried reasoning, already fearing the worst. In a moment like this, Iris would be the ideal person to de-escalate. But she's not here, and Celia might die from the sheer amount of pressure being put on her windpipe by someone much smaller than her.
Chili 9/22/2023 3:39 PM
Sinclair couldn't help what happened next. As if his body moved on instinct. As if propelled by fear. Someone he loved dying right in front of him. And the power to stop it. Before anyone knew it; Sei had become a red smear, and Sinclair stood over the mess clutching Vogel so tightly that any more force and he might split the polearm, looking as if he had gone berserk. When he realized where he was and what he had done, he dashed back to his room. Blödmann! Even if she died it's not like she'd be gone forever! All you did was get yourself in hot water with her and Vergilius! Sinclair pushed into his room, and slammed the door behind him shut. ...Why can't it just be easy..? (edited)
shit gets real 9/22/2023 3:47 PM
At least it was him...Anyone else would've been less forgiving. As Sei's body collapsed, Celia also slumped into a defeated, half-sunken pose. Donqui first got up with Gregor, holding her body up to make sure she didn't faint. Donqui kept her entire palm on Celia's face -- she was holding the mask in place, which was slipping off Even Heathcliff was concerned, grumbling swears to himself but keeping an eye on Celia. "That blasted wench... needs to keep her mouth shut.... Celia. You alright?" "...Fine." "She'll be okay, and so will Sei." Rodya looked back at Dante, who almost seemed terrified to intervene. This new wave of sinners were all much less refined and prone to outbursts. "I'll make sure Sinclair doesn't get much flack for it, it was a defensive measure. One death is better than three. Celia, bud, just breathe." Gregor was trying to comfort. "I'll clean up the mess," Meursault stated simply. Frankenstein got up to follow, her expression overcast with a sense of disdain. Celia struggled to breathe. She was more concerned about Sinclair, but in moments her eyes would close and she'd cease to live until the clock was rewinded. The last words she heard were both Rodya and Heathcliff shouting at Dante to reverse the clock ... and then her eyes opened. Sei was on the ground, still hunched over and quiet. "Verg will talk to you in the morning, Sei," Gregor said calmly. Holden even wanted to get a comment in, but he kept to himself and simply left the room. The others had it handled. When Celia got up, she simply waded to Sinclair's door. No knock, just her body slumping over into a pathetic pile upon herself. Heh... I'm sure she didn't mean it either, she thought to herself.
Chili 9/22/2023 4:10 PM
Sinclair was sitting in his chair, staring absently at the ceiling. He'd have to go clean Vogel later, blood still fresh on the blade. But for now he just wanted some silence. I thought I got better... at controlling myself. I guess not... Sei probably wants to tear me to ribbons… hopefully Vergilius is in a good mood… better to be chewed out than be beaten bloody. Sinclair shifted uncomfortably in his chair. I hope Celia’s alright…
shit gets real 9/22/2023 4:13 PM
After a few minutes, she gathered enough strength to stand up and slowly open the door. Immediately knowing the safety of the room, Celia shed her mask. "Sinclair...?" She was quiet, almost trying to minimize her presence and not disturb him. But right now, she needed his comfort, and felt it went the other way too. The adults -- er, the older adults will handle the situation. It'll be fine... Right now, she's just desperate for his touch. (edited)
Chili 9/22/2023 6:42 PM

My room isn’t much…”
shit gets real 9/22/2023 6:49 PM
"It's fine." She rushed to his side, immediately hugging him. Celia didn't protest or make a comment about the room, either. Right now, it didn't matter. "Thank you... so much..."
Chili 9/22/2023 6:54 PM

shit gets real 9/22/2023 7:01 PM

Chili 9/22/2023 8:47 PM

shit gets real 9/22/2023 9:00 PM

Chili 9/22/2023 9:09 PM

shit gets real 9/22/2023 9:11 PM
“No, no, it’s okay.” She moved over to him, then carefully lowered herself onto Sinclair’s lap, taking his hands delicately. Celia smiled. “This is just fine.”
Chili 9/22/2023 9:15 PM
“Ah… ah… ah?” Sinclair went from feeling blue to turning red almost instantaneously. What? What? Huh? What? Whatwhatwhatwhatwhatwhat- Sinclair couldn’t stop himself from descending into a gibbering mess.
shit gets real 9/22/2023 9:20 PM
Celia took a deep breath, holding Sinclair’s hands right over her thighs. “I-I’m sorry, I felt this was the best option. A-and I wanted to be close, I… I need it right now.” Admitting it with her face exposed was hard enough - Celia wasn’t facing him, so he couldn’t see how red she was. “I hope this is fine.”
Chili 9/22/2023 9:28 PM
“F-fine! Fine. It’s totally fine… I-I’ve never been better!” Sinclair finally spat out when he worked up the nerve. He was red up to his ears by this point. Sinclair felt like he might just melt right in his seat.
shit gets real 9/22/2023 9:38 PM
“Considering a few moments ago, I… question the second part.” Celia closed her eyes. She was almost shaking, but something felt so exciting about this - in the way she felt excited about holding Sinclair’s hand.
Chili 9/22/2023 9:58 PM

shit gets real 9/22/2023 10:01 PM
“I’m better now. Not even upset, I just hope Sei is okay… I heard she was noted to be emotionally unpredictable…” Celia held a hand to Sinclair’s head, gently stroking his hair. This moment was theirs, just to calm down. Her heart was calm and steady, very relaxed in his arms. “J—just rumors, though.”
Chili 9/22/2023 10:59 PM
“Right…” Verdammt… last thing I want is someone as unstable as me to be breathing down my neck… “I think I’ll apologize when she’s… in a better mood.”
shit gets real 9/22/2023 11:02 PM

Chili 9/22/2023 11:05 PM

shit gets real 9/22/2023 11:10 PM

Chili 9/22/2023 11:54 PM

shit gets real 9/22/2023 11:58 PM

Even if it was killing him, she was simply trying to keep that connection and ground herself. You’re okay, you’re alive, and he’s alive. All is well. shit gets real 9/23/2023 12:45 AM

Chili 9/23/2023 1:00 AM

shit gets real 9/23/2023 1:10 AM

Chili 9/23/2023 1:22 AM

shit gets real 9/23/2023 1:35 AM

Chili 9/23/2023 1:56 AM

shit gets real 9/23/2023 2:02 AM

Dwelling over her perfect chance to land a kiss, right after taking a photo to seal the moment. Part of her even feared the chance would’ve been missed in the far-off possibility she wouldn’t have been able to be revived from the mishap in the kitchen. Besides, if we stay alive long enough… this will be a story to tell far in the future. She considered that enough, but would not make much comment or acknowledgement for a bit while Sinclair stewed in it.
Chili 9/23/2023 2:20 AM
Sinclair kept with her, but seemed to be unable to speak. He felt like his heart might erupt into flames, as he held onto her. It was almost cruel, that now he had her, he could never live again without her.
shit gets real 9/23/2023 2:27 AM
She took his hand and lead him out the room, peeking down the corridor both ways to see if anyone would notice their quick escape. Coast is clear. Celia quietly dragged him to her door, opening it into the vastness of her room. When the two of them were in, she shut the door and took off her mask again. More of her lighthearted side was coming out, as she was now laughing to herself and holding her face in her hands. So cute.
Chili 9/23/2023 2:56 AM

shit gets real 9/23/2023 3:03 AM

All of the books were stowed away in the library, and the bags of candy shoved into the shelves of the desk in that same room. Celia walked out right after, holding a small lighter for the candle she bought.
Chili 9/23/2023 3:21 AM

shit gets real 9/23/2023 10:38 AM
“Mhm.” Celia kept quiet about the fact she was also simply doing what felt right, based on observations of the other sinners who appeared to have similar relationships — Rodya and Gregor came to mind specifically. It was no secret the two were close, every ‘babe’ and ‘darling’ rolled off of Rodya’s tongue nor naturally than her nicknames for every single one of her coworkers, but Celia occasionally witnessed how truly affectionate the woman was. Part of her felt it was what proper couples do. The other example, Iris and Faust, wasn’t particularly standard. From Celia’s view, they simply were rarely seen apart, always talking in Iris’ room or standing side by side. Maybe affection is not needed for them, Celia would reason to herself, but I think I need it. Bringing herself back to the lighter in her hand, she waved it around and smiled. “Fun fact; The tree can’t light on fire.” Picking up the candle, Celia ignited the lighter and held it up to the wick, watching a pale white flame flicker in the dim light of the room. Placing the candle down, she watched the smoke carefully rise and dissipate into the air. Suddenly, Celia was calmed.
Chili 9/23/2023 11:06 AM
“I don’t know if I want to know how you found that out…” Sinclair gazed intensely at the flame as it danced. Sinclair had always had a particular affinity towards fire, in the way that it was something that had existed for so long, but no technology could ever truly replace. But despite that, it was impermanent, it would consume the fuel that sustains it and eventually burn out. Sinclair let out a breath he hadn’t known he was holding, allowing himself to loosen up a bit.
shit gets real 9/23/2023 11:52 AM
“I figured it out in my dream.” Such a simple response, with layers of implications. Celia sat in front of the piano, carefully watching the flame. Slowly, she began to almost improvise a melody that accompanied its flickering. Few things in life were as natural as flame, music being one of them. Celia found solace in candles because of the scent they bring, forging memories she’d never forget. She often finds herself trying to find a specific candle for a specific memory, unaware that the keys to such moments are not so simply acquired. Nevertheless, she tried, and just like now … Celia sought to find a memory in this candle. Mint Tea.. I’ve never had this before. As she played, Celia’s heel tapped the rhythm that the little candle’s fire danced to. She paused. “…come, sit.”
Chili 9/23/2023 12:42 PM
Sinclair moved himself into the space next to her. He was hoping the next time he’d be sitting next to her at the piano, he’d have time to read up a little, but no such luck unfortunately. “You know… with your talent you would have been pretty popular where I came from..:”
shit gets real 9/23/2023 12:47 PM
She continued playing, hands moving as if reciting a familiar tune. “Really…? Heh, well I…” She bit her tongue. Suddenly, a face became clear in her memory. A star pianist, the one who lent her her talent, a performer who inspired Celia… Her brother. She stopped. Violently repressing that memory, that face, she blinked and stared into the flame. “…” Let’s not think about that. Celia smiled, then carefully leaned back into playing the piano. “…Maybe, if I grew up elsewhere, we would have met a different way, and had a different relationship.”
Chili 9/23/2023 1:37 PM

shit gets real 9/23/2023 1:41 PM
All the candle did was keep a steady, pale flame. As it burned brighter, Celia’s music intensified. When it eased down, she played softer. The memory of her brother still lingered in her mind, no matter how much she wanted snuff it out. She continued burying it with memories of Sinclair instead, imagining what life could’ve been like if… If Hans never died, If he never let her in, If she got to say goodbye, And if everything would be alright. Would they have been friends? Would they be close like they are now, or just passing school friends, never able to get a single moment together? Would Celia really like that change? She thought on and on, eyes now staring towards her hands. “Mm… I agree.” (edited)
Chili 9/23/2023 2:09 PM

shit gets real 9/23/2023 2:16 PM
As he leaned on her, she shifted the melodies to be softer and more relaxing. Her heart began pounding faster, trying to keep cool while her mind flooded with thoughts of how adorable Sinclair is. Ohhh no, oh nonono… he’s falling asleep on me… aahh… how cute…! Celia eventually slowed down the music and fully stopped, staring into the flame for a few moments. Delicate, potentially dangerous, but so beautiful… and full of life. That’s… what he is. I have to be the wick, then, letting that flame burn brightly until it desires to die out. And our love… Is the wax, sweetly scented and melting as we unite. Celia smiled. She put the flame between her fingers, instantly extinguishing it. She felt better, finally. (edited)
Chili 9/23/2023 2:26 PM
The last thing Sinclair remembered before his eyes fully shut, was the smell of her hair, the warmth of her shoulder, and the music that filled the air. All of these things were important to him, because she was important to him. He couldn’t help but dream, of a world where things were a little more fortunate for them. He could hold her hand in his hometown, walk her through the streets without worry. No need for a uniform, nor a weapon, because they only needed each other.
shit gets real 9/23/2023 2:37 PM
Celia held Sinclair’s hand in hers, smiling to herself as he fell asleep. Well, now I have to get him to bed. She didn’t know how much of a light sleeper he was. Now was a time to figure it out, as the girl picked up her sleeping companion and held him bridal style. How she had the strength was unclear, but she seemed to struggle very little. Onto the platform, and up to the tree. Since discovering it, many things have become easier. That would’ve made the dream more pleasant to endure… And still, Celia carried Sinclair to her room. Gently placing him down, she sat beside him and picked a book off of the shelf. It was… empty, besides where she left the photo he took. Holding it between her fingers, Celia thought about how things could have gone. It’s useless to wish like that. She looked down at Sinclair. Would it be okay… for me to lay next to him…?
Chili 9/23/2023 3:59 PM
Sinclair’s slumber remained undisturbed by her, his gentle breaths being his only movement. It’s rare for Sinclair to sleep so peacefully, many nights he would thrash about or awaken in fear. But he felt safe with her, his faith deeply rooted in the idea that no harm could come as long as they were together.
shit gets real 9/23/2023 4:02 PM
I should just bite the bullet. Celia removed her shoes and leaned over, kissing Sinclair on the cheek. She pulled Mirai over to the other side of the bed — she didn’t need to hug it tonight, Celia had something almost better. Settling into bed was the easy part. Just pull the blankets over, wrap her arms around Sinclair, and rest her head on his chest, listening to his heartbeat. …Staying was the challenge. She was nervous, being so close and holding him so tightly. But he was at peace. She was safe with him. “…” Celia closed her eyes, taking in Sinclair’s warmth. It didn’t take long for her to sleep, too, cuddling him with no intention to let go.
Chili 9/23/2023 5:12 PM
Instinctively, feeling warmth on his chest Sinclair held tightly to it. He was not eager to abandon comfort while he still had it, and kept her close to his embrace. The soft beating of his heart filled the absence of noise now that she was resting her head on his chest.
shit gets real 9/23/2023 5:24 PM
“…” She finally had a nice dream. Nothing ruined it, it was simple and beautiful. She was in school again, talking with classmates she’s never seen before. Blurred faces, obscured names, but all the same uniforms. A boy in her class caught her eye — meek personality, cute blonde hair, golden eyes, and the talk of the other students. Hm… what would I have done, if I met him like this? She wanted to impress him. Or, at least, make herself seem approachable. She played piano well, much like … someone, which made her a figure of wonder among classmates. Even that boy, Sinclair, noticed her in this dream. He wasn’t as skilled, but he admired her talent, and she admired his kindness. Maybe we could’ve been friends… had I not… It wasn’t long before she began spending her lunch times with him, learning about his family and where he came from. Celia knew she had to say something, to let him know what she was thinking. And in that case, I would have… Before Celia could say anything to that Sinclair about how she felt, she woke up. Woken up from a false dream. She rubbed her eyes, reaching for where Mirai should’ve been — but only Sinclair was there. Celia was a bit too sleepy still to really react to the fact they were in her bed, holding each other while they slept. …He’s… warm… (edited)
Chili 9/23/2023 6:13 PM

Celia quietly left the room, standing at the edge of the canopy while staring at the stone platform ready to carry them down.

shit gets real 9/23/2023 11:56 PM
Celia grabbed her jacket, sliding off her weapon to put the jacket on first. “…” Staring at her reflection, she almost lamented how much she had to repress everything. Ignoring the truth has its toll, and the more she saw the self she lost come back when with Sinclair, it became more difficult to push everything back. Is he… somehow still out there? Waiting for me? What am I saying? She blinked, shaking her head to clear her mind. Stepping out into the corridor, Celia made her way up to the front of the bus. Instead of the usual livelihood of it… it was near silent. Rodya looked on in relief. Gregor refused to make eye contact. Heathcliff even seemed tense, sitting next to a Sei with all visible signs of life drained from her. What did Vergilius do…? Even Hong Lu was unable to look Sei’s way, when normally the two were joined by the hip. Celia looked towards Vergilius, who seemed to disregard her entirely. I guess he’s pardoning me this time.
Chili 9/24/2023 12:10 AM
It took a good while, but Sinclair awkwardly managed to clean Vogel by manifesting the washroom in his room, and washing it there. The tension was so thick in the bus that you could push a knife through it, and he wasted no time to move into his seat. ...This is the worst...
shit gets real 9/24/2023 12:16 AM
Vergilius also seemed to be rather forgiving towards Sinclair. Iris glanced while briefly rising from her seat, gave a nod, and then sat back down and crossed her legs. That was the sign that we got saved, wasn’t it? Celia thought. Considering Sei’s near deranged disposition right now, she got a number done to her. Even Ryoshu could tell it was a somewhat mortifying sight — a normally pink, self-important cherry blossom now reduced to a dead branch, eyes devoid of any light. I’m sorry…. “Now,” Vergilius said, looking at Dante, “I’ll excuse the incident last night, for only one reason; I made sure that she will not cause you any further trouble. And in the case she does…” “Yo. Aren’t you a little too big of a dickhead about this? Strawberry Shortcake’s already stewing in her shame, don’t rub it in.” Holden blurted out, brow furrowed. Receiving a cold glare, he shot a mean mug back. Every head in the bus turned to the man, as if knowing he was making a grave mistake. Fortunately… Vergilius only sighed. “Transgressions from an insect aside, yesterday was stressful. I am trying my hardest to be nice, especially with the new sinners. Keep your weapons to yourselves, and your unsavory judgements from now on… and we’ll ride smoothly.” No one responded, but the message was well-delivered.
Chili 9/24/2023 12:33 AM
Sinclair bit on his tongue. Crap... it really got that bad? He elected to keep his head low and mouth shut, Vergilius is probably not in the mood for any more fuss, so he ought to forget about doing anything out of line for now.
shit gets real 9/24/2023 1:17 AM
The bus was silent for a while. People kept staring, making quiet conversations through looks (or hand signals, if you’re Holden). Sei, through her colorless seething anger, was glaring directly at Sinclair. She seemed bothered by the fact he was the one who killed her, but the anger would dissipate soon. Sei was one to be known for her erratic mood swings. After a while, Iris raised her hand. < Yes, O Holy Knight? > Dante responded in a lighthearted manner. “Where are we going, what’s our plan?” She asked. Vergilius stood up again. “Alright, I guess I owe you that after our detour. Given we handled yet-another contract within District 11, that same office signed another contract for us to snuff out some backstreets scraps of their office to prevent further infection. So that is where we’re headed, to one of those hives.” …Infection? Hives? “Luckily for you, if you get too close to those things, you won’t be affected for long. Is that enough of an explanation?” “Thank you very much, sir.” Iris said, putting her hand down. “You’re welcome.” Celia felt uncertain, but she kept her head up in curiosity. After the last ordeal with that office and their chief operator distorting, she felt there was endless surprises to be had.
Chili 9/24/2023 1:32 AM
Sinclair could feel Sei boring a hole into the side of his head with her stare, despite his best efforts to act otherwise. I'm not sure I follow Mr. Vergilius's explanation fully... but it sounds like whatever those things are, make for a quick death. Sinclair was suddenly grateful for the range his weapon provided, as opposed to Meursault's or Yi Sang who demanded being up close and personal. He was tempted to turn to the neighbors in his row and strike up a conversation, but ultimately found himself dissuaded. In this situation, Sinclair found that pretending to disappear would be for the best, and decided to stay quiet and as motionless as he could be.
shit gets real 9/24/2023 1:38 AM
It seems with that question, the tension on the bus faded slowly. Conversations began, even if one participant was stuck malding in her own seat. Celia turned towards Holden. She stuck her chin on his seat, staying quiet. They had a brief, but positive exchange. “Hey, Celi. You okay?” “Mm.” “Ah, quiet as usual. Yknow, you’re around the same age as my baby sister. I’d hate for her to be as quiet as you.” “…” Rude. “N—not, like, being rude. You vibe how you wanna, I respect it. But if she never talked to me, I’d lose it.” “Well, Sinclair doesn’t mind if I don’t talk to him.” “You’re friends with him? The little dude?” “You can say that.” “…Do you even make friends?” “…” “Damnit. And just like that, you’re gone. That’s cold, Celia.” “No, I just thought about my answer. I don’t think I need to.” “Damn right. Fuck most of the people on this bus.” “Mhm. You included.” “What?” “…” “Okay, fine. Be that way.” He scoffed, folding his arms and turning to the window. Celia seemed to like this response. She looked towards Sinclair, waving in his general direction to hope Donqui or Yi Sang could think it was for them — an easy cover. It worked, as Don Quixote enthusiastically waved back.
Chili 9/24/2023 1:46 AM
Sinclair saw Don Quixote wave her hand in the air towards Celia, shaking it like a bee had stung her right on the palm. He looked towards Celia, and presumed she was sending it towards him, only to end up with the wrong recipient Meekly, he gave a quick wave as well, before guiding his gaze back away from Sei's general direction. It felt like a minefield to try and interact with anyone more than a few inches away on the bus right now, between Vergilius and his coworkers. I hope this is easy...
shit gets real 9/24/2023 1:58 AM
Crossing the border into the backstreets, the entire scene seemed to change — as expected. But this wasn’t the first or last time they’d been in the backstreets of a district. Expectations were set, and these … were beginning to p “Ho!! I doth see where we may be stopping,” Donqui cheered with wonder. Rodya and Outis looked out the far window, the former grimacing at the sight. As others begin to notice, their expressions changed accordingly. Ryoshu looked maddened with delight, Hong Lu was curious, even Iris’ brows raised in surprise. Standing in front of a building engulfed in what appeared to be inhuman viscera, pulsating and growing with rotting vegetation… was a nearly white blur. A halo much like iris’ was near its head, carefully spinning and flickering. The bus screeched to a halt at that instant. Many braced for impact, but Celia sort of hit her entire body on the back of Holden’s seat and sunk to the ground. Ouch. Dante stood up. < Wait. Celia, please stay back for a second. The rest of you, wait and prepare please…. > Celia stood up on command, her stomach sinking. Is she in trouble? She hoped not.
Chili 9/24/2023 2:18 AM

In terms of preparation, there was little for Sinclair to do, as he already had his weapon and was fully dressed for the day. Still, he remained at the ready for whatever order may come next. shit gets real 9/24/2023 2:43 AM
As Dante walked to the back of the bus, Celia followed. Most others knew what this meant. By now, it’s become clear that Celia needed extra care with ID extraction. Her blank slate of a person meant that she was like raw uranium in terms of looking into mirror worlds, any small detail overlooked and it could mean an unstable Celia. Their gazes were kept on the window for the most part, but some were lining up to don their mirror world selves in preparation. Iris stayed behind — she was plenty strong enough to not need the help of a mirror, knowing who was out there and what they were dealing with. In the back of the bus, Dante lead celia to a dark room. She was already shuddering, walking up the stairs slowly. Not again… She sat upon the chair. Staring up at the ball of chains, Celia looked back down and stared at Dante. As the chains moved, different fragments of mirrors showed up. They overlapped themselves, showing too many possibilities. A perfect pianist, someone’s partner, an ignorant little girl. Even a cult member passing out orders, a feather of a fallen wing, or a brave knight with a cerulean blade. In the chair, Celia’s image aberrated. She was becoming nothing more than a blur, more and more infinite possibilities showing up. A queen, a student, a sailor. Instantly, Dante stopped. Looking into the mirror, was a devoted knight for a less-than-noble cause. Covered in roses and looking up to a godly figure… < This … has to be it. > Celia’s image formed again, mirroring that image. She rose from the seat, soon following Dante’s steps. She made no sound as they walked down the aisle, holding her thorn in one hand and staring at the ground. Iris’ stomach sank. No, that can’t be… why…? < It was the best I got. >
Chili 9/24/2023 3:11 AM
Sinclair had stayed back with Iris, as he was feeling a bit hesitant to assume any alternate identities for today. The sight was repulsive. The moment Sinclair saw it, he began to gnash and grind his teeth. His grip on his weapon tightened, his body trembled. His mind desperately fighting against his instinct. She's not the same. She's still the one you loved. They're part of the same group. You love her Sinclair. You loved them too. I... Sinclair looked as if he was about to faint from the strain he was placing upon himself.

Chili 9/24/2023 3:30 AM
There was an unmistakable fire in Sinclair's eyes when she approached. It was getting harder and harder for him to look at her the same way. shit gets real 9/24/2023 3:40 AM

Celia’s gaze seem fixated on Sinclair, as she idly stabbed away at anything that got too close.
Chili 9/24/2023 1:30 PM

shit gets real 9/24/2023 1:44 PM

She tapped Sinclair on the shoulder. “If you get too close or you get hit by any of the ones that explode—“ As if on cue, a burst was heard and a sickened shout from a Rosespanner Rep came right after. “—Dante can easily reverse the damage before it gets too bad. But keep a safe distance, or find some way to cover your airways.” And with that, Iris was off, dashing right to Faust to help her. She seemed to be the only one with familiarity to these things, dodging their moves with swiftness.
Chili 9/24/2023 2:20 PM
As Iris jumped into the fray, Sinclair was left by himself. He couldn't stand by idly, and joined the combat as well. The rending of flesh made a sickly wet noise, but it was oddly stress relieving. It felt like the tide of infected was never ending, as Sinners continued to swing unrelentingly. The range advantage of his weapon seemed to be rather beneficial in this regard. Ugh... this is gross... He was able to see his compatriots fighting as well, Some seemed to be struggling due to the lack of range provided by their weaponry, while inversely those with guns from their mirror ID's were rather glad to be able to keep their distance, at least until their ammo ran dry. Every so often Celia entered his field of view as they fought and the sight of her redoubled his fervor, thankfully keeping the main target on his enemies as opposed to lashing out on his coworkers.
shit gets real 9/24/2023 2:37 PM
The way Iris was slaying the blighted civilians looked almost like magic, the swiftness in her half-awake gaze. Noa even watched on in wonder -- even if Iris was no longer as strong as she once was, she still was a skilled combatant and worthy of praise. Vergilius, treat her well. Celia seemed to also have a somewhat easy time keeping her distance, moving fast and keeping her face covered by her blooming mask. Celia's mask fell to her side, exposing her blood-covered face. rose petals were stuffed into her mouth, peeking between her teeth as she gave a crazed smile. Rodya noticed the scene. She tried to call out, but her calls fell on deaf ears as Celia plunged the thorn down. ...deserves to die. No, stop! The body exploded. Celia mostly shielded the blast, her armor corroding and rotting into her skin. Her hair, now wild and covered in blood, covered her face. She kept her hands strongly around the thorn, twisting it with what little strength she had left before she had died from the overrunning of the blight.
Chili 9/24/2023 2:52 PM
It felt cold, as it descended through flesh, but the pain was burning. He was alive, but not for much longer. Blood welled up in his throat, and tears in his eyes. shit gets real 9/24/2023 3:02 PM

Chili 9/24/2023 3:13 PM
Sinclair was still alive, unfortunately. But everything felt further away, and he couldn't even feel pain anymore. Even his thoughts were sluggish. Unfortunately for him, unless someone else did the honors, he would bleed out. He faded in and out of darkness, sometimes hearing shouting, sometimes the roaring of weapons through the air. The sole constant was her. As distant as he was from the world, he could recognize the fact that wherever he was, Celia was there. Stay... awake... Stay... here... The only comfort as he felt the life drain out of him was that her flesh was still warm, even after her heart had stopped beating.
shit gets real 9/24/2023 3:19 PM

Chili 9/24/2023 9:53 PM

Chili 9/24/2023 10:39 PM
"I'm glad you feel the same way." Sinclair's room looked a little brighter. His laugh was a little louder. His eyes were softer. He even seemed to stand a little taller. Everything Sinclair wished he was, he was with her. Whether he knew it or not, she completed him. She made it possible for him to be a kinder, gentler person. To be a stronger person.
shit gets real 9/24/2023 10:49 PM

She laughed more, she smiled, she was awkward and joyful. “I really do love you… sometimes, I wish that things weren’t like this, where we can just be happy together.” But, she admitted to herself, it’s not too bad right now. Chili 9/24/2023 11:10 PM

shit gets real 9/24/2023 11:18 PM

She found herself turning her chin up towards Sinclair, eyes half-closed, as if asking for a kiss.
Chili 9/24/2023 11:38 PM
It was embarrassing, but Sinclair indulged her. Descending his lips upon hers, locking himself to her until she wishes to pull away. I hope... eventually I can do this without feeling so flustered... Her lips were so soft, it felt so nice for them to be pressed against his.
shit gets real 9/24/2023 11:48 PM

After a few moments, Celia separated, eyes remaining closed. Her heartbeat was steady, finally calmed. "I feel a lot better now," she whispered.
Chili 9/25/2023 12:35 AM
Sinclair let out a brief sigh of relief. "I'm glad... I'm a little jealous, I didn't have anyone to comfort me when I first had to wear mine..." Sinclair said this teasingly, although it was also a rather bitter statement. "Have you eaten yet..?"
shit gets real 9/25/2023 12:39 AM
“W—well, I’m here for you now,” Celia said, looking up with a pleading expression. “You don’t have to be alone…” When he asked if she had eaten, Celia nearly forgot she had skipped out on eating today. “Ah- no, I haven’t. I don’t think I really felt hungry until you mentioned it, truthfully.”
Chili 9/25/2023 12:53 AM
"Mm... c'mon then, lets get you some food." Sinclair slipped his gloves back on, just in case, before waiting for Celia to be ready. I hope... I learned enough from those books...
shit gets real 9/25/2023 1:00 AM
"Mm? Okay." He's gonna make me food...? She picked up her mask and put it on, taking her gloves and putting them on as well. She didn't specifically have a reason to other than feeling put together. This sudden care was odd, but welcome. Celia felt like she should be comforting Sinclair instead, though.
Chili 9/25/2023 6:32 AM
Sinclair dipped his head out of his room to make sure no passerby’s would see them. When the coast seemed to be clear, he ushered her over into the kitchen. “Just sit down and relax… I’ll take care of everything.” Hmm… what should I make?
shit gets real 9/25/2023 6:39 AM
Sitting down in a chair to watch him get ready to cook, Celia seemed to be full of light again. “A-Ah, really? How kind of you,” she said, leaning in with a grin. Ah, Celia, again with such childish thoughts. But … it’d be nice to see.
Chili 9/25/2023 11:23 AM
Sinclair rifled through the kitchen, and was surprised to see some fresh ingredients. We probably got them after what happened with the office... It was fortunate he got to it first, before the others found it. There's no telling if they'd leave anything but scraps. He wrestled out a pan, and set the heat, before grabbing his ingredients. Vegetables had to be chopped, eggs had to be beaten, but Sinclair was capable enough for that. I think... this is good.
shit gets real 9/25/2023 11:33 AM
Celia looked back to see if anyone was close to walking in. She heard the usual rummaging, occasional chatter as people walked from room to room and mingled about the evening. Thinking the coast is clear, she turned back and slowly discarded her mask to hold. You just entered this relationship, don’t get ahead of yourself. It’s too soon to think so far ahead. Celia’s cheeks flushed a bright pink when she looked at Sinclair, but she tried to mitigate it by holding her cheeks. It only made the blush worse. (edited)
Chili 9/25/2023 12:05 PM

Sinclair was making the recipe of an omelette he had found in one of the cookbooks he picked up. However he didn't want Celia to know that he bought it on their outing together, so he memorized it instead. "Almost done..." Hope it tastes good...
shit gets real 9/25/2023 12:09 PM

I didn’t know you could cook….” Celia could feel herself falling in love a little more, as if she weren’t already head over heels in love with Sinclair. Maybe I should cook for him too. Do I remember any good recipes…?
Chili 9/25/2023 12:20 PM

shit gets real 9/25/2023 12:38 PM

Perhaps the realization hit. “Ah— I— Sorry, no one’s ever cooked for me…! Chili 9/25/2023 1:31 PM

shit gets real 9/25/2023 2:28 PM
Celia ate the food happily. It wasn’t too salty, she even felt a sense of nostalgia while eating. Like a child being given a late breakfast, made with love just for them. Her cheeks were flushed pink. Even if she had no words, it was clear to tell any of what had happened through the day no longer wore her down. “Thank you…!!”
Chili 9/25/2023 3:26 PM

shit gets real 9/25/2023 4:14 PM

Chili 9/25/2023 5:23 PM

shit gets real 9/25/2023 5:33 PM

Chili 9/25/2023 5:37 PM

shit gets real 9/25/2023 5:48 PM
As he kissed her on the head, she lit up for another moment. Slowly, Celia grabbed her mask and walked back to her room. She changed into more comfortable clothes, staring back at the trailing of her cloak. I almost feel bad that I said no… but I think I need to give him a bit of space. In the back of her mind, she was starting to remember everything. As she traveled up the tree, walking to her room, Celia sighed. Looking out at the rain, she climbed over the fence and stepped into the foggy darkness. It was raining. The cherry blossoms looked gray, rustling in the wind. With every step, there were ripples of light along the water. What if I never woke up from that dream? I know I didn’t want to wake up then, I wanted to…. To die. But I … don’t want to be awake to this life, either. Staring up at the gray sky into the rain, Celia’s heart sank. She looked into the distance. The same figure stood, silhouette vaguely able to be discerned. You’re here to mock me again, aren’t you? Why can’t I figure out who you are…? Why are you important?
Chili 9/25/2023 6:02 PM
That ceiling.... do I... still want it to change? For the first time in a long time, Sinclair had something he held so dearly. Something he loved so much he doubted, should he ever desire to have his old life back. I love her. But... ... I want her... and I want them... but why can't I have both? Sinclair didn't like that once again, he was divided on something. It felt like the list grew ever longer. ...I'm scared.
shit gets real 9/25/2023 6:09 PM
Staring on, she found herself unable to move. And… what if I went back? to…you? I can’t pretend not to know, but the more I move on, the more I want to forget. I can’t move on, even if I learn to live … The pain still lingers, compounding and building on itself. She walked more in the rain, soon running at the figure. The moment its face began to show, she shut her eyes. Please, take me back…! It dissipated soon enough, leaving Celia to fall into the water. Tears welled up in her eyes. …Please, let me forget… and … just be happy in the now…
Chili 9/25/2023 6:19 PM
It was a painful thought for Sinclair. The ghosts that seem to linger in corners. The faces he can't remember. The voices he forgot. He swears he can feel them where he goes. Sometimes being haunted is better than being alone. It was his fault. He could never seem to forget that. Even if she killed them, it was him who gave evil the keys to his home. The first sin of man, was the one who damned him to eternity.
shit gets real 9/25/2023 6:42 PM
As she worked her way to getting up, she balled her fist. I can’t go back, I have to keep going forward… She trudged back to her room, shaking. Maybe now, she needed Sinclair more than ever. I’ll read to get my mind away from it… Celia looked at the books she bought. She took one of them, hands trembling as she opened it. Something about her past deeply bothered her. Spending half of her life asleep meant a lot of her was lost, but she knows what was in that dream. She remembered each loop, the amount of times she tried to stop it. And yet, here she is, out of that dream and having lost why she entered it in the first place. “…” But now, in this new, sweeter dream, she didn’t want to wake up again. To stay with Sinclair forever would be fine… but dreams are meant to end. She couldn’t even read, putting the book away. Her brow furrowed, and she grabbed Mirai. What am I to do, then? (edited)
Chili 9/25/2023 7:18 PM
A swirling mixture of emotion filled Sinclair. Do they forgive me? Do they know it was my fault? There was nothing to distract Sinclair from his shame in the empty room, as he felt his heart tear itself to pieces. I wonder... if they grew to resent me, even in their final moments.
shit gets real 9/25/2023 7:24 PM
Celia held Mirai close, staring up at the ceiling. Slowly, as her thoughts burned her energy out, she drifted to sleep. I wish… he was here… …to comfort me. Celia curled into a ball and fell asleep, holding Mirai in her arms. She had no dream, not willing to lock herself into another one yet again. I want… you.
Chili 9/25/2023 9:11 PM
Sinclair found himself wringing his hands together, hoping that the pain of twisting his hands in one another would keep him rooted to the world. I don't want... to be alone again... I think... I'd rather be dead... than lose anyone, ever again. And that includes you...
shit gets real 9/25/2023 10:16 PM
Celia only woke up once in the night, staring up at the ceiling. She looked out past the waterfall again, into the rain. Exiting her bed and slowly leaving the room, Celia made her way to the bottom of the room, walking around the perimeter. Tonight’s a sleepless night. As she opened the door to leave and walk around, she was met with another face. “…Sei.” “Good morning. You don’t mind if I look around and we talk, right?” “….No?” “Thank you, sincerely.” Wearing a dozen robes and slowly regaining her usual color and confidence, Sei appeared mellow and relaxed. Celia felt her anxiety spike.
Chili 9/25/2023 11:01 PM

It felt as if that when he looked back up from his hands, he heard the kerfuffle of the sinners readying themselves for the morning. ...Not ready to go yet... Sinclair continued to sit in silence, looking ahead blankly. Can I... stay a little longer? Sinclair remained seated, instead intending to use all the free time allotted to him.
shit gets real 9/25/2023 11:14 PM
Sei walked into the room, past Celia — an unmasked Celia. “Wait, your robes —“ “And your mask is off, it’s okay. This room is… a marvel,” Sei remarked, traversing the water in long, delicate layers of robes. The noblewoman stepped up to the piano and sat down at it. “Hey, are you upset still?” “…Truthfully, the only reason I was going to have your blood on my hands was because I was already intent to kill. You could just ask me for food instead of stealing, you know.” Celia blushed in embarrassment. “Right…” she murmured. “I’ve already forgiven you. But this is about Sinclair, rather… You two are friends, right?” Celia found it uncomfortable how much she was speaking. She nodded. Sei leaned in, her pink eyes losing their light in a serious expression. “The rage in his eyes was a little too potent, you know. I think it was something a little more.” “…hmm?” “If you confirm something, I won’t tell a soul. Let him know he owes me apology, and you both owe me a new cake. Oh, and…” “?” “…Put some flowers here. It’s so dreary, with your depressive mood and all. If you’re totally-just-friends, I think a flowery room impresses anyone.” With unsolicited advice and more unexpected shifts in Sei’s behavior, the princess seemed to leave without much issue. Celia hung her head low in embarrassment. What is with her…? Is it that obvious, or did it take her dying for her to get suspicious…?! (edited)
Chili 9/26/2023 1:38 AM

shit gets real 9/26/2023 4:09 AM
As Celia prepared for the day, she was definitely off. Quieter than usual, barely even able to greet the sinners she was closest to. However, everyone was still the same. Making her way up the aisle, Rodion had tapped Celia’s head and handed her breakfast — a small chocolate-chip muffin from the kitchen, still in its cheap and environmentally un-friendly plastic. Eating it while no one was looking her way, Celia appreciated the kind gesture. As the rest of the sinners finished their morning routines and got on the bus, her least-favorite neighbor Holden turned around. She wasn’t in the mood to talk, but with his big, oafish grin, she had no choice but to at least listen. “Yo, Cel.” “…” “Oh, not talkin’ today? Why, did you lose your little cat toy?” “…” “Sorry. But the sound of a birthday she never knew existed at all was nice. “We should totally do something fun or find some way to celebrate,” Holden said with a smile. Celia gave him a thumbs up. My birthday… huh.
Chili 9/26/2023 12:23 PM

Sinclair wasn’t sure what to expect for the day, although he already wished it was over. (edited)
shit gets real 9/26/2023 12:36 PM
The sound of Holden saying “birthday” made the back of the bus erupt in excitement. Any chance to not do this grueling work, they’d take it. Ishmael furrowed her brow. “Birthday…? I forgot those were a thing.” “It’s gonna be Celia’s — so it’s special,” Holden said while pointing his thumb back at Celia. She was embarrassed by the sudden attention, especially after a bad night, but seeing everyone finally get along was interesting — a relief, she wanted to call it. (edited)
Chili 9/26/2023 1:32 PM

shit gets real 9/26/2023 1:38 PM

shit gets real 9/26/2023 2:03 PM

shit gets real 9/26/2023 7:05 PM

She stopped by Sinclair, leaning into his ear — he could hear the gentle ambient sounds of her halo as it glowed, like a distant crystalline cave. “Did you have any ideas?” She asked.
Chili 9/26/2023 9:42 PM

That's what counts.
shit gets real 9/26/2023 10:58 PM

Ah, it’s quite a different relationship.” Iris chuckled, cheeks going a little pink. When he described their progress, her heart felt warm. Young love is cute… but, sleeping together? Wow, I didn’t know they were that comfortable. “…You’re awfully cute, though. Come, I wanna get away from the commotion. Can we talk in the kitchen? I can tell you more.” Iris stood tall, dragging her large weapon behind her. It was like a sign to stay away, don’t move. Despite Iris’ sleepy demeanor and soft looks, she almost commanded fear with how quickly she can slay things with such an impressive blade. It’s no wonder Celia looks up to her so much.
Chili 9/26/2023 11:11 PM

I'm sure there's some answers I can get from her. ...I can't seem to find anything notable in my birthday parties... I wasn't very popular... so there weren't any people except for family... (edited)
shit gets real 9/26/2023 11:15 PM
Passing the rows of doors and soon opening the double doors, Iris placed her weapon on the wall and immediately walked to grab a notepad and paper — stationery was handed out often to take notes or jot down recipes, or leave notices on the corkboard. “Thanks for humoring my request,” Iris said with a shallow grin. “So, you said you wanted to play piano for her…? What, are you starting to learn?” She asked, holding the pen delicately in between her fingers.
Chili 9/26/2023 11:22 PM
"Oh, sort of... I used to play. My parents..." Sinclair furrows his brow, trying to figure out how to word his statement. "They wanted their children to be talented. I did play the piano, but so did my sister. And she seemed to be the star they were hoping for... so I quit." ...I wish I could have made them proud. "But now I have a reason to play again..."
shit gets real 9/26/2023 11:34 PM
Iris nodded. She tapped the pen to her lip, then gave a little smile. “…Celia’s the same way, actually. Her older brother — although, I believe she’s forgotten about him — was a fairly respected pianist in our hometown. Even the school I grew up in, we’d go to his recitals. If you thought she’s good, he was even better.” Iris leaned on the counter, tilting her head towards Sinclair. Her halo glew brighter, spinning at a moderately fast pace. “But she, instead of quitting, was inspired by him — aiming to be as great as him someday. She’s fairly close, if what I hear from her room tells anything. …Truthfully, I didn’t even know that she was his younger sister until the first day I met her working here. It must have run in the family.” Passing off the small background knowledge of Celia she knew, the knight began writing a few things down. “You need to practice, right? In Dr. Frankenstein’s room, she has a little upright piano— I can probably get on her good side and let you use it, if you need that.” (edited)
Chili 9/26/2023 11:42 PM
"Eh? Seriously? You were from the same hometown? I feel like I should have known this..." "A-and are you certain that it's not too much trouble for you?" Sinclair had never heard anyone play as well as Celia, so the fact that there may have been someone better was bewildering. The world of piano must be vicious... I'm lucky I quit when I did...
shit gets real 9/26/2023 11:48 PM
“Yes, actually. I was from the other side of town, and we never truly crossed paths, but we come from the same hometown. It’s why …” Iris grimaced. “I’m not overly enthusiastic about going back soon. Because that means one — or both of us might have to face uncomfortable memories.” She wrote down more things, then nodded in response to his question. “Half of the bus dislikes me because of Lady Faust, but among those who don’t are Dr. Frankenstein and Madame Outis. If I get along with one, the other bends to my will. Either way — it brings me to my 2nd part of my idea.” She picked up the notepad, gazing directly at Sinclair — unlike Faust’s icy cold stare that made one regret direct eye contact, Iris’ was filled with determination and confidence. It was like staring into a hero’s eyes. “You ready to hear?”
Chili 9/26/2023 11:56 PM
"A-as ready as I'll ever be..." Sinclair feels a bit nervous, particularly by the way she prefaced the statement. Just suck it up for her Sinclair...
shit gets real 9/27/2023 12:09 AM

In the center of the page was a drawing of a park with a garden, with a gazebo in the center. “There’s a park in our town that has the most beautiful sights in the City. Of course, this comes with the cost of how bad the backstreets are, but in that gazebo—“ She pointed to the drawing of the gazebo. “There’s a piano there, and from my memory, it has lights that almost react to the music. She’ll love it. You take her there, maybe buy her a gift, play the piano for her… …This relies on you not choking up in the process, though. Which… i’m not sure if that’s fully possible.” She awkwardly smiled. “No offense, though.”
