Sinclair tilted his head curiously. "Oh? What is it?" Sinclair crouched next to her and leaned it to hear her whispers.
shit gets real 10/11/2023 2:13 AM
It was quiet, but the memory was laced with an audible smile in her voice. “When I was younger… I used to go birdwatching on my birthday. I—it was right when all of the trees were at their brightest…” She put her hands against her mask. “I’m sure there’s not many birds anymore, but I want to do something like that again. Since… my birthday’s soon.” Celia was unaware of his plans, but it was a good time to line them up with a nostalgic memory.
Chili 10/11/2023 8:37 AM
“Birdwatching…” This is good… I think. It’s an excuse to get her off the bus. “Maybe we can get lucky? If we’re thinking positively, even if our chances are slim they aren’t zero…”
shit gets real 10/11/2023 2:10 PM
Celia lit up visibly from the possibility. “Really? Do you think we’ll be allowed to go off the bus for that?” Even if her memory wasn’t crystal clear, the childlike joy of such a nostalgic activity seemed to brighten Celia from her prior indifference.
Chili 10/11/2023 10:52 PM
"Er... I don't see why not? If we're not doing anything anyway, we might as well breath some fresh air..." It seemed like a reasonable deduction that as long as they asked permission, there wouldn't be any reason that Vergilius or Dante would be against them taking a stroll for a little while.
shit gets real 10/11/2023 11:00 PM
“Mm. Good, good.” She leaned her head in a little more as if to mimic a small kiss — not like anyone was looking in their direction, either way. With a small nod, she soon stood up and resumed her usual emotionless, closed-off demeanor as if making an entire switch from the excited young lady witnesses moments ago. “Mm, Rodya?” Within seconds, the older woman immediately cut off her conversation. “Celiiii~?” “Sinclair and I are heading to bed now, we’re both tired. Have a good night.” She walked over and gave her a brief side-hug, which seemed to make not only Rodya burst into an excited fit of laughter and squealing, but also Sei and Hong Lu, who joined in the conversation over dinner. “Awwww, have a good night.” Sei said, putting a hand on her cheek. “Rest well, my sapling~” Rodya cooed. “Ah? Be sure to take care,” Hong Lu chimed in right after. Celia turned back with a blank expression, as if to signal that it’s time to bail before anyone else got drunker or wanted to catch her attention.
Chili 10/15/2023 11:50 PM
It appeared to him that she had made the decision for them. Sinclair politely bowed out, giving his goodbyes to the sinners, both those intoxicated and sober. "Have a good night..." He wasn't sure if they would even notice their absence, but it never hurt to be courteous either. He nodded swiftly when she turned to him, silently stating that he understood her message.
shit gets real 10/16/2023 12:35 AM
Celia then slipped into the shadows, out of sight of anyone else. She put her back to the walls of the bus’ corridor, lifting her mask a couple of inches off of her face to get a quick breath of fresh air. “…” Turning to Sinclair, Celia tilted her head as if she were smiling at him. Beneath the mask… was a genuine grin. They made it out alive. “…There, now we’ve eaten. I think… that settles our needs for now?” Celia got nervous, wanting to ask if Sinclair wanted to stay longer, but failing to find the right words to use. In turn, she just remained quiet, silently stewing in her shyness beneath her mask.
Chili 10/16/2023 12:57 AM
"I-I think so? I'm not sure if there's anything left to do..." Sinclair couldn't help the sheepish smile growing in his face. "That was definitely something I wasn't expecting to deal with... but we managed."
shit gets real 10/16/2023 2:12 PM
“Mm… do you want to go to bed, then?” The proposal was made quietly, as if Celia was trying to hide that she asked. Even if she did ask for his comfort at times, there was still a sense of embarrassment in admitting she desired closeness. Celia cleared her throat.
Chili 10/17/2023 1:34 PM
Sinclair took a breath to steel himself before nodding. "Uh... yeah. I suppose I do..." Sinclair found himself bashful once again, but there was an undeniable desire to be with her,
shit gets real 10/17/2023 1:39 PM
“Mm.” One nod, and a subtle tapping of Celia’s fingers down Sinclair’s wrists to hold his hand. She guided him into her room once more, unphased by the familiar scenery and the gentle splashing of her shoes against the shallow water. She squeezed Sinclair’s hand, keeping their fingers interlocked. Standing on that same platform, Celia looked down at her feet. “…ready?” She was starting to feel more and more tired as she got closer to her room.
Chili 10/17/2023 2:28 PM
Sinclair's perception was dulled as he held her hand. He was so focused on the warmth of it he hadn't realized they arrived in her room. "A-ah... Yes. I'm ready." The atmosphere of her room was serene enough to melt away all the worries of the world outside of it.
shit gets real 10/17/2023 2:35 PM
Right as she began pulling off her mask, the platform twisted itself off the floor, discarding the water on it, and lifted into the air. The process was the same every time. It was slightly nauseating, somewhat awe-inspiring, and all the more convenient. Celia’s steps got slower, shallower once the platform stopped. She walked towards her door, pushing the wooden door open, looking out at the rainy, hazy view ahead. Celia turned and put Sinclair’s hand to her cheek for a moment. She then let go, making her way to her bed and lazily crawling onto it. She sighed. Big day soon… I think I’m ready for it.
Chili 10/17/2023 8:33 PM
Sinclair felt his face warm as she gently touched it. He slowly climbed onto the bed next to her, feeling the worries of the day break down. "Sleep well Celia..." He leaned over and gave her a gentle kiss on the top of the head, before laying back down.
shit gets real 10/17/2023 8:44 PM
Celia shuffled in and got closer to Sinclair. She needed something to hold, and well… he was the perfect candidate. Her head slipped beneath his arm, laying right on his chest. Her arm reached across his torso, giving a gentle embrace. Her eyes stayed open for a moment. “…” “Goodnight, Sinclair.”
Chili 10/17/2023 9:40 PM
Being in her embrace was comforting. It was an odd descriptor, but Sinclair felt like he was a giant teddy bear for her. He didn't mind it though, as she rested her sleepy head on his body Sinclair came to an understanding. Always hoping... praying to wake up somewhere familiar. No, this is somewhere to be. This is all you have, but it's still something. bus seats and weapons, the sky, the world, her - you're still alive" I'll never truly be able to forget it all... I'll still wish for everything I've lost... but it hurts a little less when I find something to fill that absence. Sinclair pulled her a little closer. Held her a little tighter.
shit gets real 10/17/2023 11:56 PM
She felt relaxed… oddly enough, it was in this embrace that Celia felt most at home. Was this a new home? Well, one could call it, even if ‘home’ and ‘employment’ became a homogenized concept. It wasn’t like Celia had somewhere to go, unless she asked Iris to take her in — but Iris also had nowhere to go back to, either. This new ‘home’ wasn’t as fulfilling as the last. No parents making meals, no trophies of awards, no expensive fluorescent lights illuminating a piano that… her brother played. All it was now was Celia, in Sinclair’s arms, in a fabricated room on a mysteriously working bus. Searching for boughs, her own star, and a way to move forward. Those thoughts and realizations carried her through her dream. And after that dream, it was onto a boring workday, with the same gossip and arguments and lukewarm meals by sundown. Another night of cuddling, pretending the world around her was okay and that the truth was still unknown and invisible to Celia. She embraced her new home and the newfound feelings with it. (edited)
Chili 10/18/2023 1:27 AM
Sinclair slowly found himself pulled out of his slumber. He was still in the bed of Celia's room, and she was still resting on him. He shifted around slowly to sit upright, doing his best to keep her asleep. He'd let her sleep in for a while longer. It was her day anyway, so she deserved it. Sinclair absently played with her soft hair, running his fingers through it. Just a little longer... Sinclair wanted to stay like this for as long as he could, enjoying every last moment he could afford to give.
shit gets real 10/18/2023 9:20 AM

No more tossing and turning each night, clinging to Mirai to hope for a little more rest, or waking up to seeing things that she long wanted to forget. shit gets real 10/18/2023 10:04 AM

Chili 10/18/2023 10:31 AM

Chili 10/18/2023 11:42 AM

shit gets real 10/18/2023 11:48 AM

Sei discussing dessert plans with Hong Lu while grooming his hair, Holden, Ishmael and Heathcliff bickering about seating and whether or not they’re overwhelming Celia. Chili 10/18/2023 9:12 PM

shit gets real 10/18/2023 9:26 PM

Even now, they were bickering and laughing loudly at eachother while Celia was quiet in the back, listening intently. After a few minutes, though, all sound stopped as the doors opened. Chili 10/18/2023 10:20 PM

shit gets real 10/18/2023 10:44 PM

Chili 10/21/2023 12:34 AM
"Oh? Maybe... I wonder if we could find something interesting here. Maybe old sheet music? Or something like that?" Sinclair crouched next to the keys and poked at them. "...Assuming anything worth noting here wasn't crushed by rubble..."
shit gets real 10/21/2023 12:38 AM
"Ahh... right, we're supposed to be exploring more. I'll tell Iris about this if we run into her. Let's... go downstairs for now." She stared outside for another moment, then turned back to walk towards the lobby. Gigantic gears covered in cobwebs casted shadows on the ground -- a sign that nothing here has worked for quite a long time. "...Should we... go to the engine room next?" That's where we were directed, right?
Chili 10/21/2023 12:39 AM
Sinclair took her hand again. "...Yeah. Lets check it out." Sinclair would be lying if he said that he wasn't entirely offput by the scenery. But having Celia in his hand allowed him to feel a little braver.
shit gets real 10/21/2023 1:03 AM
Celia found herself curious, and given they were tasked with helping restore the Terminal. Part of her didn't realize the subtle unfairness of such a deal, but being given an adventure on her birthday was worth it. "Okay~" She said, interlocking their fingers sweetly. She looked for any signs pointing to the engine room, following small corridors and hastily-nailed arrows. Upon entering, the space was wide and open -- gears and pipes followed a golden central core that ... was dulled. "So, this is where it originates. Aahhh..." In the center of the room was a mural of the entire terminal and what it could have looked like in its prime. Illuminated only by two lights on the floor, each detail showed even the mechanics in the basement of the terminal. Mmm... did Iris plan for this too? (edited)
Chili 10/21/2023 1:21 AM
"I've never seen anything like it..." Sinclair glanced around meekly, but was emboldened by his lover in his hand. "I don't know if we found it... but I wouldn't be quite sure what to do with it anyway..." Sinclair wasn't even going to begin to pretend like he grasped what was at hand.
shit gets real 10/21/2023 1:24 AM
"I think... I've been left with more questions than answers." She looked at the mural, dragging her finger along various parts of it. Dust built up on her glove before she swiped at the mural with her entire hand. Celia lit up. "It was a practice room! So, that means... is there something that powers these...?" She whispered, fingers touching the painted gears and axels beneath the terminal. "Hmm. Maybe we need to somehow... return power to the engine room?"
Chili 10/21/2023 6:09 PM
“Really? Maybe you should have pursued another career as a detective… but how do we get power back on?” Sinclair’s gaze idly followed Celia as she meandered by the mural. This wasn’t what I had in mind for today… but as long as she’s happy. (edited)
shit gets real 10/21/2023 6:14 PM
"I do have a Seven Association ID," Celia stated matter-of-factly. "...besides, I..." She wanted to say she didn't get a choice in having this career, but it would've dampened the mood. Celia just shrugged instead. "I dunno, I kinda like doing this a little more. My brain won't get me in trouble." Her mind went back to getting the power on. Right as she was about to come to a solution, three voices echoed from the top of the room. "...missing..." "Singularity? Are we..." "No, maybe the basement." Celia looked up and held a hand out. It was the rest of their party, all reaching the same roadblock. "Celia," Ishmael called down, "you beat us here!" "Mhm. Any ideas?" All three sinners shook their head. For once, not even Faust was truly certain of an answer. Hmm... this has to be really old, then, for Faust to be stumped too...
Chili 10/21/2023 9:15 PM
Sinclair suddenly felt rather pointless. He was far from the smartest or most logical person in the room, and if even Faust was lost, it seemed unlikely he would gave an answer. Instead, he paced around nearby. Geez...what should I even do? As far as the thinking goes, everyone else has got it covered it seems. I'm just as much in the dark as they are anyway.
shit gets real 10/21/2023 10:06 PM
"We found the basement, if that helps," Iris stated. "Did you go up?" "Mhm... to the top floor. It was... a practice room. It's destroyed now." "Sad," Ishmael sighed. Celia kept looking at the mural, trying to find an answer. "The basement..." "The market street outside faced destruction as well." Faust's voice carried through the vastness of the engine room. Celia tilted her head. Hmm... is there anything there, then? Faust continued speaking. "Iris made repairs to the speakers in the lobby, which dropped... this." Faust held the hand of a clock. Celia lifted her arms to try and receive it -- when it was dropped, she barely caught it. Does this go somewhere? As Sinclair paced, a small golden flicker made itself visible in the cast shadow of the gears above. It was a key, appearing to have been lost or cast aside.
Chili 10/21/2023 10:11 PM
The shine caught his eyes, and Sinclair bent down to grab the key. An ornate design that began to show signs of age, similar to most of the splendor in the room. He reconvened with his coworkers. "Um... Sorry to interrupt... but I found this..." Sinclair presented the key towards them, hoping they could have found a use for it.
shit gets real 10/21/2023 10:16 PM

Celia sighed and stomped her foot lightly. "I didn't even get to ask about...-- hm. Well, now we have two new clues. Good looking out, Sinclair."
Chili 10/21/2023 11:30 PM

shit gets real 10/21/2023 11:39 PM

They must've found something... Holding the clock hand in hers, Celia walked up to the door. "This has to be the basement, right? Try the key."
Chili 10/22/2023 12:03 AM
"Mhm.." Sinclair pushed the key into the lock and turned it till it clicked. "Ah... there it is." He pushed open the door, but was left confused at what exactly he was looking at.
shit gets real 10/22/2023 12:19 AM
Down a small flight of stairs appeared to be a workshop. A wide desk with an endless array of various old items and papers was towards the left side, a large pile of books on the right. In the very back was another piano -- fortunately unscathed, attached to a grandfather clock conveniently missing a hand. A slot was in the wood, as if meant to be fed sheet music. "Ah -- this hand is... for the clock right there, I assu--" Right as Celia was going to rush to the piano, a glaring sound played through the entire terminal. She ducked down to cover her ears, clearly startled by the noise. "Urk....agh--" It didn't seem to stop. It was like nails on a chalkboard, screeching and blaring with mechanic noise.
Chili 10/22/2023 1:47 AM
Sinclair held his hand to his ears, trying to block out the sound. He was going to say something encouraging, but there was no point presently. Instead he hunkered down with his ears assaulted by the loud noise. What the hell? It just started out up no where... ugh... why is it so loud? Is there a way to turn it off..?
shit gets real 10/22/2023 1:53 AM
Celia half-crawled to try and reach Sinclair, eventually getting close enough to pull him in and shield his ears with her arms. The entire building shook for a few moments as if an earthquake struck. She didn’t even bother to cover her own ears properly, just making sure Sinclair was fine and that any stray boards or objects hit her instead. Then, after a few moments, it… stopped. “…What… was that?” (edited)
Chili 10/22/2023 12:12 PM

shit gets real 10/22/2023 12:20 PM

I can just… Standing on the small bench, Celia anchored herself on the edge of the piano. She carefully put the hand on the clock, adjusting until it read close enough to the right time — last she remembered, it was just about to be 4 P.M. Right as she finished, however, the building shook more — no glaring sounds this time. I think… we might be doing something right, then. Somehow, she kept her balance. Hands were on the wall, keeping her steady while it felt like the ceiling would collapse. (edited)
Chili 10/22/2023 1:24 PM

Chili 10/23/2023 1:14 AM

shit gets real 10/23/2023 8:52 AM
The easiest plan would be truly to just get into something comfortable. Not many clothes were at her disposal, and it’d be too much effort to try and use the mirror to take up an ID’s clothing. So, Celia put on her casual wear. That same dress shirt, tied with its usual black bow, cuffs neatly folded back exactly to her wrists. Even her cloak, white and only slightly stained from the months of hard labor and occasional bloodshed, sleeves billowing and hood withdrawn. Chili 10/23/2023 11:41 AM

Good as time as any, it's getting warmer. With a quick look over, Sinclair was ready for the day. He slipped the gloves back on, and hid his glasses in his bag before walking out into the hall.
shit gets real 10/23/2023 11:46 AM

"...Thanks." She brushed a stray hair on Sinclair behind his ear -- it was a tender, loving gesture. Celia stared on in her usual half-conscious gaze giving delicate attention to her lover. She smiled. "Uhm... I think we might have a little more time to walk before we should head back. May we?"
Chili 10/26/2023 11:49 PM
Sinclair nodded gingerly and took her hand, standing up slowly with her. "O-of course... lead the way. I'm here for every last thing you need today..." Sinclair was still blushing, and could not bring himself to look at Celia directly. He instead kept his eyes low and stuck to the ground, looking as if he were studying his footwear.
shit gets real 10/26/2023 11:54 PM
Quickly picking up her mask, Celia put it on before holding Sinclair's hand in her own. Their fingers interlocked, and she kept him by her side -- as if scared to let go, lest she lose him. She walked through the park. Past flowers she's never seen, or things she's long forgotten the names of. Surely, it wasn't too long until the two would be expected to be seen. The sun was setting. and the clear afternoon air was slowly cooling into the evening. It was like for just this moment, they weren't working a job that required the deaths of dozens each day.
Chili 10/27/2023 12:11 AM
As they took their last steps around the park and began their walk back to the bus, Sinclair was full of fuzzy feelings. He couldn't name them precisely, but he knew they were all facets of love. And they were all focused on Celia. He gave her hand three little squeezes, just as she often did with him. I. Love. You.
shit gets real 10/27/2023 12:16 AM
Right as he did it, Celia stopped in her tracks. She turned back, and even if her mask was now concealing her face, it was clear she was blushing and looking at him like a deer in headlights. She pressed her face against his cheek briefly. Just cold porcelain on skin, and now four squeezes back. I. Love. You. Too. Turning away, Celia sheepishly walked the two of them back to Mephistopheles, letting go of his hand subtly so the others wouldn't notice. Now... is a good time to have the mask.
Chili 10/28/2023 4:41 AM
Sinclair was quiet as a mouse as they returned to the bus. He wringed his hands together as he felt his face grow hot with embarrassment, every last sensation still fresh in his mind and on repeat. He didn't have long to mull it over though, as soon as they boarded the air was filled with loud cheering and excitement in the air. A collective "HAPPY BIRTHDAY!" shot out from all the Sinners. Some voices more easily heard than others but all were present regardless.
shit gets real 10/28/2023 10:13 AM
Celia was pleasantly startled by the surprise. The sight was humorous to see — some sinners were covered in cake flour, others were perfectly clean, a few had noticeable streaks and stains of syrups and fruit on their clothes. Then, right in the center of the aisle, standing on a swivel-chair and dressed in a makeshift chef’s uniform was their leader and bossy princess, Sei. “You! Birthday girl!” She shouted, aiming a whisk covered in whipped cream towards Celia. “Your cake is ready~” “Ah—thank you!” “Now, come. You must be starving, come eat and open your gifts.” Comically, Hong Lu stepped from the crowd and carefully pushed the chair down the aisle so Sei could hold out her hand and receive Celia’s. Just before their hands met, Sei gave Sinclair a stern glare — one that did not match her next words. “And, Thank you for keeping her safe. Your contribution is appreciated.” Celia tilted her head. That was… oddly nice of the normally snooty woman.
Chili 10/29/2023 6:11 PM
Sinclair clammed up when she glared at him, nodding meekly in response. Scary... He chose to drift near Iris instead, taking advantage of the commotion to talk to her. "Ah... how did things go? I hope it wasn't too much trouble for you guys... I'm glad to say everything went well... no major errors on my part..."
shit gets real 10/29/2023 6:16 PM
Iris gave a lighthearted salute. As crowds made their way towards the kitchen, she brushed some flour off of her shoulder and gave a half-grin. "In the end... we made a cake. I can't say the process up to that point was smooth, though." She nodded towards the messier sinners, the worst of which being Heathcliff, who still had clumps of what appeared to be a prototype cake baked into his uniform. "I think we're all due for some cleanup after this. But, seriously, good job. Celia looks... happy. More than usual, I assume that was your doing?" Iris walked to the kitchen after things were empty. By the time her and Sinclair arrived, it seemed the festivities had begun again.
Chili 10/29/2023 7:51 PM
"I-It might have been..." The party, or as close to one could get on the bus, was in full motion. An excited chatter filled the air, although most hung closely to their respective groups. Still, everyone seemed willing enough to play nice for the sake of the day. Even Outis took a break from her typical demeanor to keep the mood up. "Hm... It's kind of nice for all the shouting to not be at each other for once..."
shit gets real 10/29/2023 11:27 PM
"Agreed--- oh." Already, a knife was being waved around as different sinners fought over who'd slice the cake. Lighthearted shouts of "me!" "No, not him!" "Let ME do it!" echoed in groups, before the same swivel chair was pushed ahead. "NONE of you! I'll do it. Give me the knife." With no protest, Ryoshu, who currently held the blade, gave it to Sei. Celia, who cowered beneath them, watched anxiously. Sei hopped off the chair, adjusted her apron adorned with the words 'kiss the chef,' and carefully cut the cake. "Already? Hm. They're wanting to go back to their rooms fast," Iris murmured. She looked towards Sinclair. "...did you get her any extra gifts while you two were out?"
Chili 10/29/2023 11:32 PM
Sinclair felt the color drain out of his face. A gift. A gift. A gift. A gift. A gift. A gift. Scheiße... "I-I...forgot... I was... p-playing the piano and then she wanted to walk through the park so we never went shopping..."
shit gets real 10/29/2023 11:40 PM
She watched his expression change, quietly offering a pat on the shoulder. "It's fine. I'm sure the memories you made were enough. Besides... the shops at this terminal aren't as nice as the last one's." Iris returned to Faust's side, joining in the chorus of excitement among the sinners. Without even a birthday song for Celia, they were already digging into the mediocre cake -- at least it was untouched by Sei, only directed by her -- and enjoying it. Rodya served Celia her slice, giving her a pat on the head. "You're all dolled up~ awwww. Say, have you had alcohol yet?" "...?" Iris stepped in. "Now, Rodya, even if Celia's an adult, are we sure we want to--" "Paahhh, Iris~~ don't be such a downer. It's a party.... maybe Celia should have a sip. What do you say?" "...." Celia looked towards Sinclair. Rodya took note of this. "Oh, you want Clair to try with you? You're good pals, why not?" "..." That wasn't what I was trying to imply....
Chili 10/29/2023 11:47 PM
"H-huh? Drinking...? Um..." I was never allowed to drink before... my parents were more than happy to enjoy a bottle of something during holidays, or to celebrate whatever achievement my sister had... "I-I guess... I'm not entirely opposed..?" Sinclair bit his tongue nervously. He wasn't sure if he was saying the right thing, but if Rodya believed for the sake of the party he should... the last thing he would want was to ruin Celia's special day.
shit gets real 10/30/2023 12:00 AM
"Rodya." "eh?" She asked, already receiving a glass and bottle from Hong Lu -- who appeared to be taking a brief break from his chariot duties. "Are you sure...?" "It's fiiiiine. See? Sinclair said he's not opposed? And we'll just let them have a sip." Rodya grabbed a straw, putting it in the (cheap) wine glass to hand to Celia. "Swirl it, let it sit for a moment, then taste. Got it?" "Mm." Iris seemed uneasy -- but, knowing she was just slightly overprotective, she let it go and put on a shallow smile. She reached for Faust's hand, as if to tether herself to the other sinner. Following the instructions, Celia carefully slotted the straw into the mouth hole of her mask. Then, immediately, pushed the cup away and shook her head. "...ggghhhghghh." "Eh? gross? Ahh, she doesn't have a taste for it yet. Go on, Clair, try!" Rodya said, passing the glass over. "....you... like that?" "Oh, I love it. but maybe that's cause my taste buds aren't as fresh and strong as yours. Savor that, mmkay?" "mhm." At that moment, Celia decided she never wanted to try alcohol again.
Chili 10/30/2023 12:15 AM
It was Sinclair's turn next. Swirl, sit, sip. He followed Rodya's instructions to a T. The taste was strange. It was obviously not top shelf, and who knows where this bottle had been. But more than the flavor, it was the smell of it. Somewhere in the deepest recesses of his memory, he could remember the scent of alcohol. He was never allowed to drink, but he had been around others when drinks were being handed around. Someone opening a bottle with cheer and happiness in the air. Surrounded by people who didn't quite know him, but nor did he know them. Buzzing voices of a million different topics that he couldn't begin to wrap his head around. When was this? When Christmas meant something else... Where was this? Home... Sinclair downed whatever was left in the glass, and had to choke back his urge to cough. It was almost repulsive. Almost.
shit gets real 10/30/2023 12:20 AM
Rodya clapped joyously. "Thank you! We spent a pretty penny on that, don't let it go to waste." "I'd like to correct you, miss. It was actually fairly cheap, you were getting bourgois on a budget." Sei corrected, taking the glass out of Sinclair's hand to place in the sink. This time, Heathcliff was pushing her chair around, his face overcast as he passed by. "Mm... I don't think I want that ever again." Celia murmured. "All good. Now you've tried. Go, have cake," Iris said while grabbing herself a slice. Celia looked down at the plate she had -- it was half empty, as she snuck a bite when no eyes were on her. Guh... I suddenly feel so young again. The sentiment was met as she looked at the others. They were just talking, eating, discussing topics she could barely make out and drinking glasses full of what felt like poison to her. Celia tried to enjoy herself, still, though. She was surrounded by those who cared about her most -- a 'family' in a way, even if just coworkers bound by individual contracts. "mm... thank you." (edited)
Chili 10/30/2023 12:24 AM
Sinclair was satisfied with idly refilling a cup with drink. He wasn't quite sure what to do in the party, but was happy enough to partake in the refreshments and the nostalgia they provided. He remained within earshot of Celia, just in case she wanted to converse with him. It's... weird. It tastes a little less worse the more I drink it though... Tastes a little less like anything though...
shit gets real 10/30/2023 12:31 AM
It felt like the alcohol was endless, and the energy was bottomless as well. Each new cup was refilled, but Iris kept a careful eye on Sinclair. Let us know when you're ready to open. DTLT, though." * "Mm? O...kay.... just a little longer." Celia had no clue what Ryoshu was on about. She simply kept subtly eating her cake. It was an airy dulce de leche cake -- oddly luxurious for their situation, but with the higher number of chefs among their crew, it wasn't too out of the question. She was happy about it, though. Such a sweet cake.
Chili 10/30/2023 12:40 AM
Sinclair wasn't sure where he was at in terms of drinks, but everything was starting to blend together. He was definitely inebriated at this point, and with the little rational thought his mind could still produce, decided it would be a good time to quit drinking. The distance between him and Celia seemed very far away. Truthfully it wasn't that far, but with how awkward it was to walk currently, it took more time than he liked. "Y-You... g-gaht mail..." Sinclair started translating to Celia when he finally got to her. "Don't take too l-l... hic long..." The scent of alcohol on him, and the loss of decorum was enough for one to deduce that Sinclair had gotten drunk. He was a lightweight, but he had no way of knowing that till now.
shit gets real 10/30/2023 12:49 AM
By the time her plate was empty, Celia had processed what Ryoshu said -- thanks to Sinclair. Her gaze scanned different pieces of the room, landing on Sinclair -- and Iris right behind him. "Ah, right." The knight was glaring at Rodya. The glare was met with a shrug and a wink -- Rodya already knew why Iris was so stern, but she was a bit too tipsy to really care. The taller sinner rubbed Celia's head. "Celi, you full now?" "mm." "Yah, well, Iris is looking awfully mad at me." Iris sighed. "That's because you're letting s--" "Letting Sinclair drink? It's fine! Celia's head turned to the table towards the kitchen's viewing window. A small pile of gifts wrapped differently were laid out, of different sizes and colors of wrapping. "...Am I?" "It's your call." "Uh.... in a moment." A smear of icing was left on the mask, carefully wiped away by Celia's wrist.
Chili 10/30/2023 12:57 AM
Sinclair mumbled out a brief apology to the closest person every time a hiccup escaped him, even if they weren't bothering to listen. Thankfully for the Sinclair of the future, he was not embarrassing himself, and seemed to just pace around instead. "Sh-Shelia... how is your b-birthday..?"
shit gets real 10/30/2023 1:03 AM
"Ah-- oh, it's good. I'm happy we're all having fun." "Gift time?" A deep, excitable voice called from the other side of the room. A few other calls of "Gifts? Celia dipped below the other sinners around her, making her way to the table. Rodya followed, then Gregor and Ishmael. Iris and Faust followed a few steps behind, Iris' halo flickering fervently despite her usual tired expression. Chili 10/30/2023 1:11 AM

shit gets real 10/30/2023 1:25 AM
The array of gifts was carefully opened. With each new one, Celia read out who gifted it and took a moment to savor each gift. From Rodion, a pair of opaque black tights and a ribbon for her hair. From Victor and outis, a record player. It was unclear how they got it. From Yi Sang, a small desk lamp fashioned like a sapling. From Hong Lu, an envelope of ... an uncountable amount of Ahn and a perfume he recalled his grandmother recommending. From Meursault and Natsume, a cookbook. To refine a skill... From Ryoshu and Holden, a set of matches and a scented candle shaped like a piano. Seemed to be a purchase from a while ago, given the receipt in the bag. From Donqui and Gregor, signed copies of some books Celia once mentioned wanting -- signed by her two biggest inspirations, Iris and Noa. One last gift from Dante... a small plush, fashioned like a cat -- a friend for Mirai. Celia put her hands to her face, sniffling. Rodya immediately hugged her as she teared up. "Aaah.... thank you....!"
Chili 10/30/2023 9:19 AM

It’s gonna be so cool… and Celia’s gonna love it… and then she’s gonna hug me… A wide grin was on Sinclair’s face. If someone hadn’t realized he was currently intoxicated, they would just assume that the party put him in a good mood. (edited)
shit gets real 10/30/2023 12:00 PM

Chili 10/30/2023 2:07 PM

shit gets real 10/30/2023 2:09 PM

Chili 10/30/2023 2:13 PM

shit gets real 10/30/2023 2:15 PM

Best of all, though, I had time with you. So…” Celia beamed. “… It’s the best birthday i’ve ever had.”
